loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is married and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merla is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merla requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing net.

Merla has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Safa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Safa and it consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 Yemeni rial (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Boshra is a hardworking, 36-year-old married woman who lives with her family. She is the leader of the group. Boshra is an educated woman with a Secondary education. 

Boshra has had her business selling women's clothes and accessories door-to-door for more than two years. She started her business with a small amount of capital thanks to the assistance of her husband who supported her financially. 

Year by year her business improves more, but most of what she earns in profit goes to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in this business. 

Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to provide her family with a better future, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and accessories to resell to her customers.

Boshra looks forward to expanding her business more in order to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and accessories to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Naiseang's Group

texts.en:
Naiseang lives in a rural area of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is 51 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she has been raising chickens and weaving mats for 31 years, and the current business earn her about 43,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.
 
Naiseng is a first loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Naiseang wants to use her portion to buy materials for supporting her weaving business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her weaving business

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a candy making business in the Philippines.

She requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Leonisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Seanglai's Group

texts.en:
A villager who lives in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Seanglai is 37 years old and married with one kid. She has been weaving mats, and her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. The current business earns her about 48,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

Seanglai began with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy weaving supplies to support her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies to support her business

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, cream, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, cream, etc.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 19-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs.

Hasan is a student in the university where he studies law. He would like to take a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Hasan appears in the photo in the computer store.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es: Rosa es casada, tiene dos hijos menores de edad que asisten a la escuela, su esposo trabaja y le apoya en los gastos de la casa. Rosa trabaja en una zona franca como supervisora. Este crédito lo usará para comprar los materiales para la instalación del servicio higiénico en su vivienda (inodoro, tubería, cemento, arena). A través de los créditos que ella ha solicitado ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida, mostrando ser una persona muy responsable en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones. Y espera poder seguir trabajando con créditos para lograr así terminar de construir completamente su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 2 minor children who attend school. Her husband works and contributes to cover their household expenses. Rosa works in a free zone as a supervisor. 

She will use this loan to buy materials to install the hygienic service of her house (toilet, pipe, cement, sand). She has been able to improve her quality of life thanks to the loans received, and she has proven to be a very responsible person when it comes to meeting her commitments. She expects to keep using loans to completely finish her house.

loans.use: to install the hygienic service of her house.

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es: Henry es conductor de una ruta de transporte urbano en la ciudad de Managua. Es casado, y tiene dos hijas menores de edad, su esposa le apoya con los gastos de la familia. Con la entrada del invierno en la ciudad, Henry se ve con la necesidad de cambiar el techo de la sala de su vivienda, el cual está en muy malas condiciones, y así poder evitar que el agua se filtre en su vivienda, y le afecte sus enseres del hogar. Es la primera vez que hace un crédito y espera poder terminarlo muy bien, para así poder seguir mejorando su vivienda a través de otros créditos.
texts.en:
Henry works as driver of an urban route in the city of Managua. He is married and has 2 minor daughters. His wife helps with household expenses. Now that winter is starting, Henry feels he needs to replace their living room ceiling, which is in a very bad condition. This would prevent water from filtering into the house and damaging their belongings. 

This is his first loan. He expects to repay it as scheduled and to be able to use other loans to keep making improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy zinc layers and steel bars to replace his living room ceiling.

loans.name: Ameed

texts.en: Ameed is 28 years old and lives in Nablus. Nablus is a city in the northern West Bank, approximately 49 kilometers north of Jerusalem, with a population of 126,132. He is marred and he has two daughters and a son. He sells music CD’s, which is his only financial income. He earns 550$ monthly. Ameed asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy packaging requirements and CD’s. Ameed is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy packaging materials and CD’s.

loans.name: Husni

texts.en:
Husni is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a simple house. He works in a supermarket for very long hours where he gets a low income that is not enough to cover all this needs. 

Husni is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future. 

Husni took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Husni will be able to do his homework and write his  reports easily. 

Husni appears in the photo in the computer store.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 26-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids - three sons and one daughter, in a simple house. He is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
 
Bassam is also a student in the university where he studies Arabic literature, and he would like to take the BA degree and find a better job in the future. He has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will allow him to do his homework and write his reports more easily.
 
Bassam appears in the photo in the computer store.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder  salir adelante; Julio trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable.

Julio agradece el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda  podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, especialmente arreglo de paredes, colocación de piso, entre otros, de esta manera podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the city of Ica and works as a laborer in a local farm, which provides him with income to get ahead. Julio works approximately 9 hours per day and believes things go well because he is very responsible. 

Julio is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will make improvements to his house, especially the repair of walls and floors. This way he will improve his quality of life and keep fighting to reach his biggest dream: to have his own business.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Roger Alfonso

texts.es:
Roger vive en el distrito de Parcona, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que es padre de un pequeño al cual ama muchísimo, su esposa actualmente vive fuera del país ya que viajo para poder conseguir un empleo y poder apoyar a Roger. Roger trabaja con mucho esmero como chofer de una empresa de transporte desde hace 1 año, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos.

Roger esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá solventar algunos gastos personales, lo que le permitirá< mejorar su calidad de vida para seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Reunir a su familia”.
texts.en:
Roger lives in the Parcona district. He is a young man willing to get ahead and to support his son, whom he loves so much. His wife currently lives abroad as she left to find a job and help Roger. Roger has worked as a driver in a transportation company for 1 year and puts great care in his job. This is how he obtains income to cover expenses. 

Roger is greatful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to cover some of his personal expenses, improving his quality of life and fighting to reach his bigger dream: to have his family reunited.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Emelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made clothes for resale

loans.name: Hibya Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hibya Al- Hodeidah and it consists of three women who are all hard workers. They live in Hodiedah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 130,000 YER. 

Hibya is 38 years old and married with five children.  Her oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest one is 9 years old. She is an educated woman with an Elementary education. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She said she had a small amount of money that she saved. Hibya invested that money in her own business. She started her business five years ago selling clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense in order to help her husband with expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable one for her. For further expansion, Hibya requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense to resell to the women in her area.

Hibya expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more accessories, makeup, and ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Santhiaba Ii Group

texts.fr: SANTHIABA II  est un groupement de femmes qui se réunissent à chaque fin de mois et qui organisent des tontines. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités. La femme qui a levé la main sur la photo s’appelle Seynabou, c’est leur présidente. Elle est âgée de 29 ans, mariée t mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus légers venant de la Mauritanie et des bazins teintés (Gagnila)  qui viennent  du Mali. Seynabou a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. C’est une jeune femme  qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la maison et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 15h. A l’avenir,  elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Santhiaba II Group is made up of women who meet at the end of every month to run a savings group.  They all live in the same neighbourhood and operate the same type of business.

Seynabou (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is the group president.  She is 29 years old, married and has children.  She sells light fabric which comes from Mauritania and dyed damask fabric (Gagnila) from Mali, and she has more than ten years' experience in her business.  Seynabou is a young woman who helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household, and the school fees of their children.

Seynabou has requested this loan in order to increase her stock holding and respond to the demands of her customer.  She starts her working day at nine in the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon.

In the future, Seynabou would like to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Apolline Marie Valentine Tokpo's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Apolline Marie Valentine (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 54 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Apolline Marie Valentine est mariée à un certain Marcel. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Apolline Marie Valentine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Apolline Marie Valentine vend des chaussures depuis vingt ans.  Apolline Marie Valentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Apolline Marie Valentine ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: This group is made up of four members who are friends and who live in the same district. The group representative, Apolline Marie Valentine (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to frequently attend school. Apolline Marie Valentine is married to a man named Marcel. The couple has six children, with some of them receiving an education and two of them under their care. The various household expenses are met by Apolline Marie Valentine and her husband. In order to meet these expenses, Apolline Marie Valentine has been selling shoes for 20 years. Apolline Marie Valentine gets her supplies from a market in Bénin. In her quest to satisfy her customers, Apolline Marie Valentine, together with the other member of her group, are requesting a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan was paid back in full.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Noemi Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Noemí ha tenido que enfrentar varios desafíos a lo largo de su vida, uno de ellos es tener que afrontar la situación de discapacidad de su esposo la cual le ha privado de realizar muchas actividades, incluso la de trabajar.
Es por eso que Noemí ha decidió tomar las riendas del hogar y buscarse un trabajo, desde hace tiempo viene trabajando con mercancía de catalogo de reconocidas marcas como Yanbal, Avon, Carmel, etc, estas marcas son especializadas en la venta de productos de belleza y para el hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un inventario de mercancía más amplio y así obtener excelentes descuentos por compras al por mayor.
Esto le generara un incremento considerable en sus ventas e ingresos y así, poco a poco, podrá cumplir su sueño de tener un almacén, casa propia y brindarle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Noemí has had to face several challenges in her life. One of these challenges has been dealing with the situation of her husband’s disability, which has prevented him from doing many activities, even working.

For this reason Noemí has decided to take the reins of the home and look for work. She has been working with merchandise from catalogues for a while, including recognized brands such as Yanbal, Avon, Carmel, etc. These brands specialize in selling beauty and household products. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a larger inventory of merchandise, thereby obtaining excellent discounts on her wholesale purchases. 

This will generate a considerable increase in sales and earnings for her, and in this way she will eventually be able to fulfil her dream of having a store, having her own house, and giving her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal and Avon products to sell

loans.name: Book Jom Group

texts.fr: BOOK DIOM SANTIABA est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 personnes qui veulent tenir leur destin en main. Elles habitent ensemble et font des tontines à domiciles, ce qui leur permet de se réunir chaque semaine et de discuter de leur situation. Elles ont comme présidente Ndèye  Rokhaya  qui est une femme qui a 49 ans et elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus. Elle a une expérience de 6 ans dans la vente de tissus. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle demande ce crédit pour acheter et vendre des tissus pour hommes et femmes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir, elle voudrait vivre dans le confort et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
The Book Diom Santiaba Group is made up of ten women who want to take control of their futures.  They live together and run savings groups from their homes.  This allows them to meet each week to discuss their situation and daily lives.

Ndèye Rokhaya is the group president, she is 49 years old, married and has children.  She has been selling fabric for six years now.  She begins her working day at eight in the morning and finishes at six in the evening.  

Ndèye Rokhaya has requested this loan in order to buy fabric for men and women.  She helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family, and the school fees of their children.

In the future, she would like to live more comfortably, increase her revenue and improve her savings level.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil and cereals

loans.name: Gs Renacer Mira Flor Group

texts.es:
La Señora Ismelda tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de 1  hija, convive con su esposo  Su actividad es la venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad, con el crédito que esta solicitado le permitirá tener un mayor surtido en el negocio y esto le vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos en el hogar, lo que le permitirá cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros contraídos.
Ismelda espera surtir con productos como Arroz, Azúcar, Manteca, espagueti, refrescos, pan, churros, frijoles y otros productos de la canasta familiar.
Ismelda su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a su hija y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, Los demás integrantes se dedican  y lo integran;
Santos tiene su pequeño negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva.
Marilu se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva.



                                                                                            Trojes, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Ismelda, 27, has one child and lives with her husband.  To earn a living, she sells basic, everyday food for the family. She has been doing this for more than ten years. 

With the loan she will be able to stock her business which will help improve her income in the home, allowing her to cover family expenses and other financial commitments.

She hopes to stock up on products such as rice, sugar, butter, spaghetti, soft drinks, bread, churros, beans and other typical products of everyday use.

Her dream is to be able to provide for her daughter's education and improve the standard of living for her and her family.  The support that she receives through the loan will help her to achieve these goals. 

The other members work in the following areas: Santos has a small business selling new clothes.  Marilu also sells new clothes.

loans.use: to buy basic household foods such as rice, sugar, butter, spaghetti, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rita Maritza

texts.es:
La señora  RITA  de 45  años de edad  es casada y vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en su casa de habitación se dedica la venta de ropa americana de forma ambulante, su ventas son por las diferentes aldeas vecinas donde cuenta con sus clientes, Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, es una persona luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha seguido adelante con su negocio. Radica en la aldea la Cuesta al sur de Honduras.
Doña Rita esta solicitando 5, 000.00 lempiras para compra  de un fardo de ropa americana. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Doña Rita desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio con mejores ganancias.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Rita, 45, is married and lives with her two children and her husband in their house.  She sells American clothes on the streets. She sells her goods in the various neighboring villages where her customers live. She has been doing this now for five years.  

She is a hard-working woman who has managed to move her business forward with a lot of effort. She lives in the village called La Cuesta in the south of Honduras.

Rita is asking for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to buy a consignment of American clothing. With the support and profits she gets from this loan, she hopes to get along and continue to generate more of an income. 

Her dream is to have a business with improved earnings.

loans.use: to buy a varied bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Neri Bruna, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
Las socias que salen adjuntas a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'Patron de San Jeronimo'.  It is located in San Jeronimo in Cusco and is belongs to the Cusco office.       
                                                                                                                                                                                      
Neri Bruna is a member who has a grocery store. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has been doing this for years and her business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. She is a responsible and tenacious person.  She wants to be able to carry on working so she can support her family.

 She is asking for a loan to buy some milk among other things.

The partners whose photos are attached in the image had asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

 The other partners have businesses selling jewellery, clothes, groceries and beauty products.

Neri Bruna is grateful to those who help her dream through the loan system and she is committed to meeting the monthly payments she has been set.

loans.use: to buy milk and other things.

loans.name: Benita Lissette

texts.es:
El olor a comida nos seduce al entrar a la casa de Benita de 32 años, quien trabaja como comerciante de comida desde hace 9 años. Esta madre de un pequeño de 6 años, trabaja todos los días teniendo siempre en cuenta que la educación de su hijo está en sus manos. Todo inició con unos cuantos encargos de comida que le hacían sus amistades cercanas, luego, tras ahorrar, junto a su pareja y madre, condicionaron su casa para vender comida.
Las expectativas de Benita son altas, pues siente que podrá seguir creciendo y subiendo la variedad y cantidad de su producto. Es por esta razón que necesita de un préstamo para comprar carne, arroz, pollo, vegetales, gaseosas, ente otros productos para tener suficiente producto para abarcar una buena cantidad de clientes, que inmediatamente le permitirá incrementar su inventario. Entre sus planes está dar a conocer su producto en el centro de la ciudad, en un bufet de comida. Por el momento le gustaría mejorar las condiciones de su comedor, ampliando el espacio del local.
texts.en:
The food smell seduces us when we enter Benita's house. Benita is a 32-year old woman who has worked as a food seller for 9 years. She has a 6-year old son and works everyday knowing that his child's education is in her hands. Everything started with a few orders from close friends. After a while and with some savings, she got the house ready to sell food together with her mother and partner. 

Benita's expectations are high, as she feels she can keep growing and increasing the variety and quantity of the products she sells. This is why she needs a loan to buy meat, rice, chicken, veggies and sodas, among others, to serve a good amount of clients and increase her stock. She plans to promote her product in a food buffet in the center of her city. Her goal for now is to improve the condition of her dining room, making it bigger.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, chicken, veggies and sodas, among other food items.

loans.name: Romel Paul

texts.es:
Romel nació en Apurimac, departamento de la sierra del Perú y llego con su familia a la capital,Lima, en busca de un mejor porvenir. Sus padres son separados y el vive actualmente con su madre, ella cría y mantiene sola a el y a su hermana vendiendo comida en un terminal de transporte terrestre ya que el aporte económico que le brinda su padre es mínimo. Su madre no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder darle una educación superior a Romel por lo que tendría que comenzar a trabajar y así olvidar su sueño que tiene de estudiar diseño industrial de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Es por esto que el esta muy agradecido y feliz por el apoyo que puede recibir para llegar a ser un profesional de éxito y ayudar a su madre y hermana a salir adelante.
Romel piensa que la educación es la mejor inversión que puede hacerse y por esto que agradece en nombre de todos los beneficiarios tan gentil apoyo.
texts.en:
Romel was born in Apurimac, which belongs to the office that deals with the mountain areas of Peru.  He moved to Lima with his family in search of a better future. His parents are separated and now he lives with his mother.  She raises him and his sister on her own.  She generates an income by selling food at a transport terminal.  

The financial support that he gets from his father is minimal. His mother doesn't have sufficient resources to be able to pay for his higher education.  This means that Romel would have to start working and therefore forget his dream of studying industrial designing, unless he can get the support of the Kiva loans.

This is why he is very grateful and happy for the support that he can receive to become a successful professional and help his mother and sister get along.

Romel thinks that education is the best investment you can make and for this reason he gives thanks on behalf of all beneficiaries for the kind support.

loans.use: to pay for his studies on an industrial design course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture, an Xbox and a computer.

loans.name: Diego Alberto

texts.es:
Diego es un joven de 24 años de edad, nació en el departamento de Potosí y actualmente vive con su tía en la ciudad de El Alto del departamento de La Paz– Bolivia. 
Diego es soltero, es el menor de tres hermanos, sus padres están separados hace muchos años y menciona que al no haber vivido con su padre, no contó con su apoyo, su mamá fue la única que se ocupó de su familia, ella vive en la ciudad de Potosí y trabaja en una pastelería para mantener su hogar y ocasionalmente le envía algo de dinero.
Diego empezó a trabajar hace tres años para aportar en la casa de su tía, por lo cual tuvo que dejar la universidad, sin embargo, al enterarse de la existencia de un programa que le daba la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios, se motivó a volver a la universidad y retomar su carrera profesional, debiendo de esta manera elegir horarios que le permitan trabajar y estudiar de noche.  Para Diego es muy importante salir de la universidad pues será un ejemplo para sus primos menores con los que actualmente vive y los podrá ayudar económicamente, pero además por que cumplirá el anhelo que su mamá siempre tubo, ver a sus tres hijos profesionales. Diego nos cuenta que su sueño es ser uno de los mejores y lograr tener un trabajo estable. 
Diego agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a los jóvenes y generan nuevas oportunidades para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diego, 24, was born in Potosi and now lives with his aunt in El Alto, which falls under the La Paz office. 

Diego is single and is the youngest of three brothers.  His parents split up several years ago and as he has never lived with his father so he gets no support from him.  His mother is the only person who looks after the family. She lives in Potosi and works in a cake shop so that she can provide for the household.  From time to time she sends him money.

Diego started working three years ago to contribute to the expenses at his aunt's house.  To do this he had to give up studying at university. However, when he found out about the programme which made it possible to carry on with studies, he found the motivation to go back to university and take up his course again.  To do this he had to choose a timetable which allows him to work and then study in the evening.  

For Diego, it is very important to finish university and be an example to his younger cousins who he lives with.  He can also help them financially. But above all, his dream is the same as his mother's: to see her three children working as professional people. Diego tells us that his dream is to be one of the best and to get a steady job. 

He is grateful to the people who give financial help to young people and generate new opportunities for them to study.

loans.use: to pay for a degree in engineering.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro es un hombre disciplinado y muy enfocado en sus intereses. Desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en un cultivo de café que el mismo sembró en un terreno regalado por su suegra.
El es agradecido y devuelve el favor con la garantía de trabajarlo con esmero y dirigiendo sus esfuerzos en el sostenimiento de su familia.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de algunos insumos como abonos, y riegos, elementos necesarios para la preparación de la tierra y poder tener unos cultivos de café de calidad.
Tiene muy claros sus objetivos y es sacar su familia adelante con mucho esfuerzo y poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Pedro is a man who is disciplined and very focused on his work. For a while now he has been working on a crop of coffee that he himself planted in a field given to him by his mother-in-law.

He is grateful and returns the favor by working hard and putting all his effort into looking after the family.

He is asking for a credit to buy some supplies such as fertilizers, and irrigation products.  These things are necessary to prepare the soil to have good-quality crops.

He is very clear on his goals which are to provide for his family and give his children a good education.
.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more of women's clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Al- Tamayoz Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tamayoz. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Sabah is a hardworking woman. She is a 34-year-old married woman with four children and lives with her family in a poor area in Sana'a. Her oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest one is 6 years old. She is the leader of the group. In order to help her husband with expenses and to improve the economic condition of her family, Sabah decided to work in dressmaking. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Her business lacks materials for sewing and her capital is still low. For this reason, Sabah applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, and buttons in order to improve her business.

Sabah looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small store for dressmaking and buying many sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics, threads, and buttons

loans.name: Carlos Smith

texts.es:
Carlos nació en Piura, costa norte del Perú. El es huérfano de madre y su padre lo envió a la capital para que pueda estudiar y cumplir su sueño de ser profesional, actualmente vive con su hermano mayor.
El extraña mucho su ciudad natal y espera poder regresar un día convertido en un profesional, su padre esta muy orgulloso de el.
Carlos estudia mecánica de mantenimiento en un instituto y su hermano cubre sus pensiones de estudio, sin embargo el gasto que le genera su manutención no hacen posible que siga apoyando a Carlos en su carrera y ocacionaria que este ultimo tenga que comenzar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamista de Kiva.
Carlos al igual que muchos jóvenes migran de sus ciudades natales en el interior del país para poder acceder a una mejor educación y así poder tener mayores oportunidades de salir y sacar a sus familias adelante, es por ello que se siente bendecido y muy agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva para continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  After losing his mother, his father sent him to the capital city to study and become a professional, and he currently lives with his older brother.  He misses his home city and hopes to return some day once he finishes his training.  His father is very proud of him.

Carlos studies mechanical maintenance at an institute and his brother covers his study costs, but the expenses of his room and board is making it impossible for his brother to continue supporting him, so he will have to start working if he is unable to get help from Kiva lenders.

Carlos is like many other youth who leave their cities of origin inside the country to get a better education and have better opportunities to go out and help their families get ahead.  He feels blessed and is very grateful for the support received from Kiva lenders so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: To pay for his mechanical maintenance technical studies.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es una persona con experiencia de más de 10 años en la preparación de comidas para atender eventos como matrimonio, primeras comuniones, etc.
Ella trabaja sola y las recetas las ha aprendido de manera empírica, adicional a esto tiene un pequeño puesto de comidas que saca al frente de su casa los fines de semana.
Ella es una mujer con gran capacidad de trabajo y con una vocación de servicio impresionante.
Desea obtener un préstamo para comprar insumos e ingredientes para sus preparaciones ya que debe atender varios eventos por esta temporada y no quiere quedar mal con ninguno de sus clientes.
Su principal desafío es el tiempo ya que debe trabajar contra el reloj.
texts.en:
Angela is a person who has more than ten years' experience in catering for weddings, first communions, etc.

She works alone and she has made up the recipes as she goes along.  Besides this, she also has a small food stand which she sets up outside her house every weekend.

She has a lot of energy to work and likes to provide an amazing service.

She wants a loan to buy supplies and ingredients for her meals since she has to take care of various events this season and she doesn't want to let any of her customers down.

Her main challenge is time because she has to work against the clock.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her meals.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo vive en la ciduad de imperial, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, e spor ello que trabaja muy duro en su negocio de venta de golosinas, refrescos, frutas y comida a las afueras de un colegio de su ciudad, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y la cual le ha permitido poder ganarse el pande cada día y poder sacar adelante a su familia ya que es madre de 3 hijas.

Amparo esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como golosinas al por mayor, compra de nuevos recipientes para la venta de sus repuestos, entre otros; lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos apara vender y atender de mejor manera a sus clientes, así podrá seguir en el camino de hacer
texts.en:
Amparo lives in the city of Imperial.  She is a woman who is determined to get ahead, so she works very hard in her business selling sweets, soft drinks, fruit and food outside a local school.  She has been in business for three years earning a daily income to support her family.  She has three daughters.

Amparo is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her store such as wholesale sweets and new containers for sales purposes.  This way she will have a wider variety of products to sell so she can provide her customers with better service and continue with her work.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, containers and other items.

loans.name: Sope Sa Deuk Group

texts.fr: SOPE SA DEUK est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles vivent dans le même quartier et leur lieu de travail se trouve dans le même endroit qui est le marché central de leur commune. Elles ont choisi Madame Mariétou comme président  de leur groupement. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. On le reconnait par la main levée sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des ustensiles de cuisine. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières à part ses besoins personnels. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des  ustensiles de cuisine. Elle commence sa journée à  8h pour la terminer à 13h et après la pause déjeuner elle reprend ses activités à 15h pour revenir à la maison à 20h. Grâce aux crédits de l’institution, elle voudrait renforcer et diversifier ses marchandises et gagner d’autres parts du marché.
texts.en:
The Sope Sa Deuk Group is made up of ten women who live in the same neighbourhood and work together in the central market of their district.

Mariétou (seen in the photo with her hand raised) has been chosen as the president of their group.  She is married and has children.  Mariétou sells kitchen utensils.  Apart from her own personal expenses, she doesn't have any other financial responsibilities.

Mariétou has requested this loan in order to buy more kitchen utensils.  She starts her working day at eight in the morning and finishes at one in the afternoon.  After stopping for lunch, she restarts work at three and returns home at eight in the evening.

Thanks to the loans that she has received from the field partner, she is now able to look forward to strengthening and diversifying her business, and expanding into other areas of the market.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy comprometida con su trabajo de venta de mercancía al por menor como ropa, lociones y accesorios.
Se dedica a este negocio desde hace varios años con el afán de obtener recursos para la manutención de su mama y de un sobrino que tiene a su cargo.
Tiene grandes expectativas con su actividad, tanto así que planea montar un  almacén de variedades y generar algún empleo.
Ella aspira a un crédito para comprar mercancía y aumentar la oferta de productos a sus clientes que en su mayoría son amigos y familiares.
Impactara su vida de una manera positiva ya que tendrá oportunidad de ayudar a su mama que es lo más importante que en estos momentos tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who is very committed to her working selling retail merchandise such as clothing, lotions and accessories.  She has been in business for several years in an effort to earn enough income to support her mother and a nephew who is in her care.

She has high expectations for her business, such that she is planning on establishing a variety store and generate employment.  She hopes to receive a loan to buy merchandise and expand the range of products she offers to her customers, who are mainly friends and neighbors.  It will have a positive impact on her life as it will allow her to help her mother, which is her priority at this time.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of clothing, accessories and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина живет с мужем и тремя детьми в районе Носири Хисрав. Она сельская женщина в возрасте 37 лет. Муж Нигины работает в фотоателье, а дети учатся в школе. Нигина у себя во дворе дома занимается разведением скотов. На протяжении двух лет она откармливает бычков и перепродает их. Одновременно она занимается растениеводством. Нигина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовье скотов. На сумму кредита она хочет закупить пару молодых бычков с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Nigina lives with her husband and her three children in the Nosiri Khusrav district of Tajikistan.  She is 37 years old and lives in the countryside.  Her husband works in a photo shop and her children are still in school.  Nigina raises cattle at home.  For the past two years she has been feeding and reselling bulls.  She is also involved in agriculture.  Nigina has requested a loan to increase her cattle headcount.  She wants to use her loan to buy a couple of young bulls for further fattening and resale.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gs Col. 20 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
José es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con su esposa. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 13 años, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual es muy conocida y visitada por  vecinos de la misma.
Jose está pidiendo el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, entre otras; que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio. El espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento considerable, y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Jose espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia  y así de esta manera poder vivir de una forma más tranquila y que tener un mejor futuro al lado de su esposa.

Felixcia su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 2 años.
Martha su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos desde hace 10 años,
Erika su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos desde hace 2 años,
Yenis su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años

Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Jose is a very honest, responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with his wife.  For 13 years he has been running a grocery store out of his home, which is very well-known and visited by neighbors.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as corn, shortening, eggs, cheese, soft drinks, doughnuts, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices and other goods to stock his store.   He is hopeful the loan will be of great help since he will be able to have on hand the supplies necessary to meet customer demand for their satisfaction.  He also hopes sales will increase considerably so he will have more income to benefit his household and family lifestyle.

Jose wants to increase business and continue supporting his family so he can live without wory and can have a better future with his wife.

Felixcia has been in the grocery store business for two years.
Marth has been selling plastic products for ten years.
Erika has been selling plastic products for two years.
Yenis has been selling used clothing for ten years.

Choluteca, Honduras - April, 2014

loans.use: To buy corn, shortening, eggs, cheese, soft drinks, doughnuts, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices and other goods for his business.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
“¡Gaseosa, gaseosa!” gritaba Johana por la calles, cuando tenía 38 años. Sosteniendo en unos de su brazo un termo blanco, les presentaba a sus clientes una variedad de marcas y sabores, dando inicio a su trabajo como comerciante de gaseosas, luego le permitiría extenderse a la venta de cosméticos. Ahora tiene 41 años y solo pudo completar su colegio, lo que la motiva a no dejar de trabajar para poder brindarles una educación estable a sus 3 hijos de 19, 6 y 4 años edad. Sin embargo, no todo llega allí, pues anteriormente vendía ropa. Siempre su espíritu trabajador la ha impulsado a superarse. 
Johana recibe el apoyo de su pareja, quien le envía remesas para aportar a su familia. No obstante, desea seguir creciendo y cumplir su sueño de establecer una agencia de gaseosas, para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos como: gaseosas, calzado, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Todo este crecimiento le permitirá en un futuro dar a conocer sus productos en el mercado, como ella lo desea.
texts.en:
"Soda!, soda!" Johana used to shout through the streets when she was 38 years old.  Carrying a white thermal container, she would offer customers a variety of different brands and flavors.  That is how she began her soda business which allowed her later to branch out into cosmetics.  She is now 41 and only was able to finish elementary school.  This motivates her to work so she can give her three children, ages 19, 6 and 4, an education.  She also used to sell clothing.  Her working nature has motivated her toward getting ahead.

Johana has the support of her partner who sends money to help the family.  But she wants to continue growing and fulfill her dream of establishing a soda shop.  So she needs a loan to buy products such as sodas, shoes, creams, perfumes and other items.  This will allow her to grow and offer more products in the future, just as she wants.

loans.use: To buy products such as sodas, shoes, creams, perfumes and other items.

loans.name: Ihrom

texts.ru: Ихром малый бизнесмен из района Шахритус, где он живет с матерью и женой. Ему 30 лет. Он занимается сезонным торговым бизнесом. В данный момент Ихром занимается куплей и продажей мороженного. Он сам закупает товар, но не продает его. Он нанимает продавцов в разных точках, которые продают его товар и получает за это заработную плату. Сейчас сезон мороженного и продажа мороженного идет очень хорошо. Поэтому Ихром хочет расширить бизнес и приобрести еще один морозильный ларь для продажи мороженного. Свою цель он собирается осуществить посредством получения кредита. Он надеется, что ему окажут финансовую поддержку в нужный момент.
texts.en: Irhom, age 30, owns a small business in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan, where he also lives with his mother and his wife.  He is involved in the sale of  seasonal goods.  This time of year he buys and sells ice-cream.  While he buys his merchandise himself, he doesn't actually resell it but he hires vendors in different locations and pays them a salary to resell his goods.  It is now the season of ice-cream and it is selling very well.  For this reason, Irhom wants to expand his business and buy another chest freezer for ice-cream sale.  He plans to achieve his goal by requesting a loan.  He hopes to receive financial support at a time when he really needs it.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer for ice-cream sales.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 58 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom who are currently in school.

Felicidad is in the agricultural business. She raises cattle in the Philippines. Felicidad has requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

Felicidad has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her sewing business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lucia has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lucia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, etc. for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Халим мужчина в возрасте 26 лет,женат имеет 2 детей на иждивении. Халим добросовестный, честный, ответственный человек. Халим живет в сельской местности и как каждый сельский житель занимается животноводством. Халим работает на частных стройках подсобным рабочим и зарплата его не позволяет обеспечить семью. Основным источником дохода является откорм крупного рогатого скота. В свободное от работы время Халим полностью занят животноводством. Жена Халима помогает мужу по хозяйству и смотрит за скотом. Халим по выходным выводит скот на скотный рынок и продает,на вырученные деньги он покупает молодых телят и ухаживает за ними. Халим вырос в бедной семье и сам старается сделать так чтоб его дети не знали нужды и выросли в достатке. Халим хочет дать своим детям достойное образование которое он не получил. Халим обратился в организацию  Арванд за финансовой помощью в надежде расширить свой бизнес и заранее благодарен за предоставленную помощь.
texts.en:
Halim is 26 years old, married, and he has two dependent children.  He is a conscientious, honest and responsible young man who lives in the countryside.  Like the other local residents, he is involved in animal husbandry.  He also has a job working as a laborer on private construction sites but his salary is not enough to provide for his family.  Halim actually derives his main source of income from raising cattle and he spends all his free time from work involved in animal husbandry.  

Halim's wife helps him around the farm and takes care of the cattle.  On weekends, Halim brings his cattle to the cattle market for resale, and with the money he gets he buys fresh young calves and raises them.  Halim comes from a poor family and he is doing everything in his power to make sure that his children are not in need of anything and always have enough.  He wants to give his children a decent education, which he himself never received.  Hoping to expand his business, he has turned to the MFI Arvand for financial assistance.  He thanks Arvand in advance for all the support he will receive.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Natan Nehemías

texts.es: Natan tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su mamá. ÉL trabaja como profesor de informática en su localidad y es así  como apoya con la economía del hogar. Natan es un joven trabajador visionario y lleno de sueños. Con el deseo de mejorar las condicione de su vivienda ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del techo de la misma dado que se encuentra deteriorado y desea mejorarlo lo antes posible. Con el monto solicitado comprará teja y madera.
texts.en: Natan is 21 years old and lives in his own house with his mother. He works as a computer teacher in his community and that is how he supports the household. Natan is a hardworking young man who is a visionary and full of dreams. Wanting to get ahead to improve his living conditions, he has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in building the roof on the house because the one it has has deteriorated and he wants to improve it as soon as possible.  With the amount he has asked for, he will buy tiles and wood.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood to repair the roof on his house.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Epifanía Group

texts.es:
Criselda sigue siendo la lideresa del grupo, gracias a su buena gestión y la motivación que promueve en su grupo la siguen nombrando en ese cargo. Ella y 6 integrantes más conforman Banco Mujer Epifanía un grupo que tiene una trayectoria de 3 préstamos otorgados por Fundación Mujer caracterizada por la responsabilidad y el compromiso. 
Esta microempresaria ha sabido aprovechar muy bien los recursos prestados, logrando consolidar y fortalecer su negocio.  Su cartera de clientes ha crecido, y con ella la demanda de los productos que comercializa, es por eso que este financiamiento es una nueva oportunidad de inversión en ropa, lociones, cremas, perfumes y joyería, que será de mucho provecho para su negocio. Gracias a esta actividad ella cuenta con los recursos para seguir estudiando, además de contribuir con los gastos del núcleo familiar.  
Doña Criselda asegura que el crédito le ha permitido superarse económicamente, y estar en el grupo la hace sentirse útil, valorar el hábito de ahorrar, así como aprender  a trabajar en equipo, fijándose cada día nuevas metas.
texts.en:
Criselda continues to be one of the leaders of the group. Thanks to her good management and the motivation that she gives the group, they have continued to give her that post. She and 6 other members make up the Banco Mujer Epifanía, a group that has had 3 loans from the Fundación Mujer. It is described as responsible with its commitment.
 
This micro-businesswoman knows how to take advantage of the resources of the loans. She has been able to consolidate and fortify her business. Her clientele has grown and with it the demand for the products she sells. That is why this loan is a new opportunity to invest in clothing, lotion, creams, perfumes and jewelry. It will be very advantageous for her business. Thanks to this activity, she has the resources to keep going to school as well as help with the family expenses.
  
Criselda confirms that the loan has allowed her to get ahead financially and being with the group has made her feel useful and value the habit of saving, as well as learn how to work as a team, setting new goals every day.

loans.use: to buy clothing, lotion, creams, perfume and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Karen Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Karen tiene 25  años de edad está soltera no tiene hijos, y se dedica al comercio su fuente principal de ingreso provienen de la venta de ropa, calzado y ropa interior actividad que tiene más de 3 años de realizarla, ella es una persona con deseo de superación, actualmente solicita el apoyo de un préstamo Para surtir más negocio lo que le generara mejores ingresos y la captación de nuevos clientes. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante y domiciliar en los diferentes aldeas de su municipio.
Karen el préstamo lo va a invertir en camisetas, faldas, pantalones, blúmeres, brasieres, calcetas, tobilleras, medias, bóxers y blusas para ofrecer mas variedad a los clientes que le visitan.
Karen Uno de sus sueños es poder instalar un negocio mucho mas grande como ser una tienda donde pueda generar más rentabilidad para darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia, y generar fuentes de empleo en la localidad, con el apoyo financiero que se le brinde estaría subiendo un peldaño más de su alcanzable sueño.
Trojes, Honduras – Abril   2014
texts.en:
Karen is 25 years old. She is single and has no children. She is a merchant and her main source of income is selling clothes and shoes. She has done this for more than 3 years. She is a person who wants to get ahead. Right now, she is asking for the support of a loan to stock her business more. This will generate better income and capture more customers. She does her business as a street vendor and door to door in different communities in her town. 

Karen will invest the loan in shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, bras, socks, anklets, stockings, boxers and blouses to offer her customers more variety to the customers who visit her. One of Karen's dreams is to open a much bigger business like a store where she can generate more profits to give her family a better lifestyle, as well as generate employment in her community. With the financial support she is being given she will be one step closer to her attainable dream.  

Trojes, Honduras – April   2014

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, bras, socks, anklets, stockings, boxers and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Evelin Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Evelin habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comarca llamada buenos Aires, soltera, convive con su padres pero ya es independiente, ella se esfuerza mucho para lograr sus metas, tiene un pequeño negocio una Pulperia, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de Abarrotes como Arroz, Frijoles, Aceite, Azúcar, Carnes, Chiberias, Refrescos, ya que ella quiere seguir aumentando su negocio y asi obtener mayores ganancias. Agradece el apoyo que recibe de Afodenic y de Fondo Kiva.
texts.en: Evelin lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in the region called Buenos Aires. She is single and lives with her parents but she is independent. She works hard to achieve her goals, such as have a small store as a business.  This loan that she requests is to purchase groceries such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, meat, snacks, and soft drinks since she wants to continue growing her business and have increased income. She is grateful for the help that she receives from Afodenic and the Kiva fund.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Don Concepción de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida e hijo, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles. Últimamente los clientes han aumentado y cada día la demanda es mayor. Su sueño es poder ver florecer su negocio y sabe que para eso tiene que invertir un poco más en la producción de tal forma que logre cubrir toda la demanda. Para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Concepción, 46 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and child. He owns a carpentry shop where he makes and sells a variety of beautiful and fine furniture. He has worked in this business for many years and, thanks to God and his dedication, has managed to keep it going. Many prefer his shop since he offers quality and good prices for his furniture. Recently, he has had an increase in customers and every day the demand is higher. His dream is to be able to see his business grow and he knows that for this to happen, he has to invest a bit more in the production so that he can meet the demand. For this, he has decided to ask for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business and purchase wood, nails, adhesive, varnish, rushes, and other materials that will attract more customers so that he can meet his goal to improve the quality of life of himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, adhesive, varnish, rushes and other materials.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from selling electronic mobile load.

She is borrowing PHP 28,500 through NWTF to buy additional container of gasoline to sell for her gasoline retailing business.

Monalisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional container of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 42 years old and has four children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Naomi is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for nine years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Naomi requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional packs of frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods vending business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and widowed with four children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gloria has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sarb Al- Hamam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sarb Al- Hamam. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She works as a housewife, and she has a lot of house work. Her house lacks a washing machine and she always washes the family's clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired. Also, washing by hand causes sensitivity in her hands. Fatima couldn't afford this condition. 

She asked her husband to buy a washing machine for the house, but unfortunately, her husband is a pensioner and his salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash clothes.

Fatima looks forward to furnishing and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her wash clothes.

loans.name: Aduviges

texts.es: Eduviges tiene 43 años de edad y se gana la vida trabajando como albañil independiente. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila con baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder obtener este crédito y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Eduviges is 43 years old and earns a living working as an independent construction worker. In this way he earns a living and is able to sustain his household.  With the desire to improve his living conditions, he asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in constructing a large cement basin with a bath for which he needs materials such as bricks, cement, sand and gravel. He hopes to get this loan and begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand and gravel to construct a large water basin and bath.

loans.name: Blanca Gloria

texts.es: Blanca de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la venta de productos nutricionales naturales, los comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Blanca está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más productos nutricionales naturales  por mayor  y así seguir con sus ventas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 50 years old, lives in her own home with her two children. For the past 8 years, she has worked selling natural nutrition products, which she sells as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods are near her home. She has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices. Blanca is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to be ale to purchase more natural nutrition products in bulk and, so, be able to continue with her sales to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase natural nutrition products in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable siempre está dispuesta en darle lo mejor a su familia desde hace 9 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Rosa vive en casa propia con sus seis hijos y su padre, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus siembra y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 34 years old. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is always ready to give the best to her family. For 9 years she has been working in agriculture. She grows corn and sells her products around her area. Rosa lives in her own house with her six children and her father. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, organic fertilizers, plague controls, etc., and to improve the soil she shows on the photograph, so that she can continue with her cultivation and in this way give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, organic fertilizers, plague controls, etc. and improve the soil

loans.name: Cristhian Nahum

texts.es:
El Joven Cristhian de 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos que dependan de él, vive en casa propia en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en el centro de Honduras. 
Cristhian se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 1 año y medio y su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, en su negocio tiene una empleada y también sus dos hermanas le ayudan en el negocio y juntos elaboran  ropa para dos negocios de su comunidad.
Cristhian está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como ser telas, maniquí, ganchos, espejos, una vitrina y para pago de alquiler del  local y así surtir más su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Cristhian espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguirlo prosperando y que gracias a esto pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia en el hogar, además que siga siendo el sustento de él y sus hermanas.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 22-year-old young man. He is single and doesn't have any dependent children. His lives in his own home in the Tegucigalpa neighborhood in the center of Honduras.

Cristhian has worked making clothing for the past year and a half and his business is located in his home. He has one employee in his business and his two sisters also help him with his business and together they make clothes for two businesses in the community.

Cristhian is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise such as fabric, a mannequin, hangers, mirrors, a display case and to pay the rent for the building and to stock his business more and be able to meet his customers´ demand.

Cristhian hopes that this investment will be a great help to him so his business grows and generates the income needed to continue prospering and that thanks to this he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family in the home, and also be able to continue supporting himself and his sisters. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2014.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, a mannequin, hangers, mirrors, a display case, and to pay the rent for the building and his business.

loans.name: Cristina Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora Cristina de 28  años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella,  vive en casa propia en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en el centro de Honduras. 
Doña Cristina se dedica a su negocio que es un salón de  belleza desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado su casa de habitación, siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos. 
Doña Cristina está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como ser champo, químicos, tratamiento, acrílico, chapuceras, etc. y así mejorar su negocio para brindarles un mejor servicio  a sus clientes y también hacerlo crecer.
Doña Cristina espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguirlo prosperando y que gracias a esto pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Espera que sus hijos puedan terminar los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien con mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Cristina, 28 years old, lives with her husband and has 2 children who depend on her.  She lives in her own house in the neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras.

Cristina has worked in her beauty salon business for the past 4 years. Her business is located in her home, and is her primary source of income.

Cristina is asking for the loan in order to purchase merchandise to stock her business such as shampoo, chemicals, treatments, acrylics, shampoo chairs, etc. so as to improve her business and offer better services to her customers and also to make it grow. 

She hopes that this investment will be a great help to her so that her business grows and generates the income necessary to continue profiting and thanks to this, she will be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

She hopes that her two children can finish school and become good people with better opportunities in their lives. 


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2014.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, chemicals, treatments, acrylics, shampoo chairs, nail polish, nail polish remover and other beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, buttons, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Estefany Alejandra

texts.es:
La Joven  Estefany Alejandra de 20  años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hija que dependen de ella,  vive en casa propia en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en el centro de Honduras. 
Estefany se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de condimentos desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado su casa de habitación, siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos. 
Estefany está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como: especias, sal de ajo, sal de cebolla, achote, salsa, ajo, chiles verdes, salsa negra y vinagre y así tener el producto necesario para seguir con su negocio y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
Estefany espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguirlo prosperando y que gracias a esto pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril del 2014.
texts.en:
Estefany Alejandra is a 20-year-old young woman. She is single and has a dependent daughter. She lives in her own home in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras.

Estefany has worked in her business, which is selling seasonings, for the past 2 years. Her business is located in her home, and is her primary source of income.

Estefany is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business such as: spices, garlic salt, onion salt, annatto, green chiles, Worcestershire sauce, and vinegar to have the products needed to continue with her business and be able to meet her needs. 

Estefany hopes that this investment will be a great help for her so that her business grows and generates the needed income to continue prospering and that, thanks to this, she will be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her daughter. 



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2014.

loans.use: To purchase spices, garlic salt, onion salt, annatto, green chiles, Worcestershire sauce, and vinegar for her business.

loans.name: Flori May

texts.en:
“I started with nothing, and some of our neighbors laughed at me because we don’t have anything. We just consider it a challenge in our life," said Flori May about the grocery retail business she runs in her village. In addition to groceries, she also sells hogs and poultry feed in the community. 

Flori May is 29 years of age and blessed with two children. She has been running her business for two years and earns a profit of P8,000 a month.

She and husband's greatest dream is to uplift their living. They will do their best to do so so they can improve their ability to meet their children's needs. Flori May wants to expand and extend the products she sells to her costumers. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy feed and other poultry supplies to sell. She is hoping for continued growth of the business and to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feed and other poultry supplies to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El Joven Jorge tiene 20 años de edad, habita en la comunidad de Arenales en el Oriente de Honduras convive con su compañera de hogar es padre de 1 hijo su actividad es la compra venta de Chía.
