El cuenta con más de 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela y está solicitando el crédito para la compra más producto de chía y así tener un muy buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros
Jorge su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica en el futuro de el y toda su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y así sentir el apoyo que Prisma de Honduras le estaría dando junta a Kiva.

                                                                           
                                                                                   Trojes, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old and lives in the community of Arenales in the eastern part of Honduras.  He lives with his life partner and is father to a one year old child.  His work involves buying and selling chía, which is a seed used in fresh fruit and energy drinks.  He has more than two years of experience in this field and he has good customers and is improving his income in order to cover his household expenses and his financial commitments.  

Jorge's dream is to improve his living conditions and to offer economic stability in the future to his whole family.  With the help that he will receive from the loan he will purchase chía seeds for his business. In this way he will work on achieving his dreams and thus benefit from the support that Prisma of Honduras is offering together with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase Chia for his business.

loans.name: Airis

texts.en:
Airis is single and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Airis requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more shorts, pants, blouses, etc. to sell.

Airis has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Airis would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory of shorts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 60 years old, widowed, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ceferina has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Ceferina requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, spices, rice, fish, meat, etc. for her business. Ceferina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, spices, rice, fish, meat, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shahr Al- Baraka Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shahr Al- Baraka. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Afrah is a hardworking woman. She is a 34-year-old married woman with seven children and lives with her family in their own house in Sana'a. She is the leader of the group. In order to help her husband with the expenses of the family, Afrah decided to work in dressmaking. She started her business over ten years ago, working as a dressmaker inside her house. She started with a small amount of capital. Recently, she has been earning good profits from this business. But the crisis of power these days negatively affects her ability to do her work, particularly in the evening. As a result, it takes Afrah a long time to fulfill a small amount of work, which limits her ability to succeed. 

For this reason, Afrah applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase power generator, which will allow her to operate her business even when the electricity cuts off.

Afrah looks forward to expanding her business more through opening her own sewing show. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator to improve her business when the electricity cuts off.

loans.name: Elmer Joel

texts.es: Elmer de 41 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, Elmer está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elmer, 41 years old, is a very hard-working man who is responsible with his family. He has worked for a number of years in agriculture.  He grows corn and sells his products in the different markets that are near his home. He lives in his own home with his life partner and their children. Elmer is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, fungicides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, fungicides, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja como obrero avilcutor en una empresa de venta de huevos de su ciudad, con este humilde empleo Julio puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder apoyar a su hija de 8 años.

Julio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, asimismo podrá solventar algunos gastos personales, de esta manera el podr´pa ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir trabando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the city of Chincha and works as a poultry farm worker in a business that sells eggs in his city. With this humble work, Julio can have income to be able to get ahead and to support his 8-year-old daughter.

Julio is thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help that they offer, he will be able to make improvements to his house, and to be able to pay some personal expenses, and in this way to be able to continue improving his quality of life and continue working and fighting to be able to realize his great dream: to have his own business.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is separated and works hard to support her family. She operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years.

Elizabeth requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, noodles, etc. for her food production business. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, fish, spice, noodles, etc. f

loans.name: Jose Ariz

texts.es: Jose de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la amabilidad y responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He provides transportation services throughout the surrounding neighborhoods and has many customers due to his friendliness and responsibility when he is driving. 

Jose is asking for a loan so he can buy tires for his vehicle and perform maintenance on it.  Since this is his only source of employment, this will allow him and his wife to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena  is  66 years old, married, and a resident of Lower Salug Daku Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. 

She earns a living through farming.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP  20,000 to buy farm inputs and pay for labor for land preparation and seedbed preparation.

Elena deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labor for land preparation and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita, 44, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Estrellita has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Estrellita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Henrita

texts.en:
Henrita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Henrita earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for her business.

Henrita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for her business.

loans.name: Hector Joel

texts.es:
Hector vive con sus padres, ellos trabajan juntos vendiendo comida en la calle de manera ambulatoria y ganan solo lo suficiente para sobrevivir. Ellos desean que su hijo tenga las oportunidades que ellos no tuvieron de estudiar una carrera y ser profesional, sin embargo esto no sera posible sin el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva ya que sin recursos económicos suficientes tendría que comenzar a trabajar irremediablemente.
El confía en conseguir el apoyo necesario y por eso agradece de antemano todo el apoyo recibido por los prestamistas de Kiva para continuar sus estudios.
El desea lograrse como profesional y laborar en una buena empresa que le permita seguir creciendo y ayudar a sus padres en todo lo que pueda para devolver el sacrificio que estos hacen por el.
texts.en:
Hector lives with his parents who work together selling food on the streets. They earn enough only to survive. Their wish is for their son to have the opportunity they never had to study for a degree and become a professional. However, this will not be possible without the help of Kiva lenders, because without financial resources he would have to begin working immediately.

He is confident that he will receive the support he needs and wishes to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for all their help in enabling him to continue his studies. He hopes to become a professional and get a job with a good company which will allow him to continue to grow and help his parents in whatever way he can to repay the sacrifices they have made for him.

loans.use: pay for technical studies in heavy equipment maintenance.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 29 years old and married with two children. Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as bread, cookies, juice, soft drinks, coffee, etc. 

Mary Jane requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, cookies, juice, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, cookies, juice, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 6 de Enero está en su ciclo número Séptimo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una se fijó el crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilberta, quien se dedica a las confecciones de prendas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, comenta que hace todo tipo de confecciones, y que gracias al buen trabajo que hace no le falta nada y da a su familia todo lo que no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called 6 de Enero (Sixth of January) is in its seventh cycle of the women's committee program, where each individual noted her growth, not just economically, but also as a person. They are very hardworking and self-sacrificing women. 

One of the members is Gilberta, who works making clothing, and it is also worth noting her work of the counselors. She mentions that she makes all kinds of clothing, and that thanks to the good work she does, her family is not wanting for anything and she gives her family everything they couldn't have. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread, which will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income and continue to help her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Paulina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock.  

Paulina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Paulina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 52 years old,married, and has six children, with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks, beers, etc. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anelle

texts.en:
Anelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anelle is 34 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Anelle has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Anelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Anelle has been in this business for four years. Anelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 41 years old and married. She has four children, and two of them are currently in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 11 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia works hard to support her family. Patricia is married and has an ice cream bar vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Patricia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ice cream bars to sell to her customers.

In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ice cream bars to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Crispiniana

texts.en:
Crispiniana is 52 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Crispiniana works very hard to provide for them.

Crispiniana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Crispiniana has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, sugar, drinks, canned goods, bread, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Crispiniana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aldalene

texts.en:
Aldalene is 41 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.  

Aldalene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aldalene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aldalene has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aldalene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diana Mae

texts.en:
Diana Mae works hard to support her family. Diana Mae is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Diana Mae requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Diana Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsa is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Elsa has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers.

Elsa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 34 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Analou works very hard to provide for them.

Analou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analou has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Analou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old, married with three children. Two of her children are in school, she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Analyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gladys Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Gladys  tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene hijos que dependan de ella, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa en el centro de Honduras. 
Doña Gladys se dedica a dos actividades que son la elaboración de tortillas las cuales vende los fines de semana en la colonia donde vive y también la venta de mercadería nueva y usada tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a estas actividades las cuales le generan los ingresos necesarios para salir a delante con su familia.
Doña Gladys está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como ser pantalones, vestidos, faldas, calzonetas, blusas, sandalias, etc. y poder así surtir más su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Gladys espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguirlo prosperando y que gracias a esto pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril del 2014.
texts.en: Gladys is 45 years old and married with children who depend on her. Her husband helps with household expenses, they live in their own house in city of Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras. Gladys works in two activities which are making tortillas that she sells on the weekends in the community where she lives, and she also sells new and used merchandise. She has worked in these activities for a long time which generate income to move forward with her familia. Gladys is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise like pants, dresses, skirts, swimwear, blouses, sandals, etc. and so be able to stock her business better and meet the demand of her customers. Gladys hopes that this investment will be a lot of help so her business grows and generates the necessary income to continue prospering. Thanks to this she can improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, skirts, swimwear, blouses, sandals, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jenifer Sarai

texts.es:
La Joven Jenifer de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella,  vive en casa de un familiar en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en el centro de Honduras. 
Jenifer se dedica a la venta de mercadería desde hace 1 año y medio y su negocio está ubicado en un mercado de la capital, siendo este negocio su principal fuente de ingresos. 
Jenifer está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como ser tenis, zapatos, sandalias, camisetas, gorras, calzonetas, calcetas, etc. y así surtir más su negocio para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y hacerlo crecer.
Jenifer espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos necesarios para seguirlo prosperando y que gracias a esto pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia en el hogar.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Abril del 2014
texts.en:
Jenifer is a young woman of 21. She lives with her husband and does not have children to support. She lives in the home of a family member in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in central Honduras. 

Jenifer has worked for a year and a half selling merchandise. Her business is located in a market in the capital city, and it is her main source of income. 

Jenifer is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sneakers, shoes, sandals, t-shirts, hats, underwear, socks, etc., and thus stock up on more goods in order to satisfy customer demand and expand her business.

Jenifer hopes that this investment will be a great help to her, so that her business can grow and generate the income necessary to keep prospering. Thanks to this, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family in her household. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy sneakers, shoes, sandals, t-shirts, hats, underwear, socks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 57 years old and married with six children. Delma works very hard to provide for them.

Delma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, laundry soap, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita, 52, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anelita has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Anelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

In the future, Anelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 35 years old and married. She has six children, with three currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, shampoo, etc.  

Annabelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 35 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Gemma has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 44 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like canned goods, sugar, salt, seasonings, cereals, toothpaste, noodles, etc. to sell.

Genara has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Genara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like canned goods, sugar, salt, seasonings, cereals, toothpaste, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Ma. Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. Ma. Ester is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her manicure/pedicure business.

Ma. Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 61 years old and married with seven children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

Editha has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marina is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marina has a buying and selling of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Marina requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 32 years. Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marita is 51 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marita has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. Marita requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Edeña

texts.en:
Edeña is 51 years old, married and has seven children, two of whom are in school.

Edeña is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edeña requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Edeña has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edeña would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds  and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 52 years old and married with three children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like sanitary pads, candies, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mercy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like sanitary pads, candies, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province. Sokhoern is 48 years old and widowed. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, Sokhoern has been weaving mats for 28 years. The current business earns her about 48,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Sokhoern has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy weaving supplies for supporting her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies for her business

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Donan Hulu Group

texts.en:
Earlier Donan group recently completed two cycles of the program with Kiva. They grew their businesses and were helped by a loan from Kiva, therefore for the next cycle , the group is back again participate in the Kiva program. Group members of Donan Hulu have not changed; still six members. The impact of a Kiva loan really means a lot to the family's welfare and the progress of their efforts. One member of this group was just devastated; her business premises caught fire. All members help each other to recover. They are mutually reinforcing.

Kharina, the leader of this group, has a business selling tools and household items. Her husband works as a contractor, and Kharina has four children. Two children are in school. With this loan, she wants to buy home appliances for resale because a lot of people respond to Kharina's household appliances. She dreams of the future: she wants to open a hardware store in the town of Cilacap. Hopefully this loan from Kiva will help develop the businesses of its members. Kharina is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy  home appliances for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de panes con jamón, los anda en su carretón por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de habitación así como lo muestra la fotografía, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder reparar el carretón donde anda los alimentos para poder seguir vendiendo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y asi poder tener junto con su compañera de vida una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The client is 25 years old and lives in a rented house with his life companion. He works selling panes de jamon (ham bread). He goes about the different neighborhoods that are located close to his place of residence as shown in the photo. He manages to pay some of the household expenses with what he makes. The client is requesting a loan to be able to repair the cart where he puts the food so that he can continue to sell. This is his only source of income and he wants to have better financial stability along with his life partner.

loans.use: to repair his cart.

loans.name: Iriba Ryiza Group

texts.fr:
Ally fait partie du groupe Iriba ryiza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 43 ans  et est marié  à Purette, une magasinière. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de bière, et de limonade  depuis  20  ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  caisses de  bière et de limonade à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait importer les ustensiles  de cuisine et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ally is a member of the Iriba Ryiza group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 43 years old and lives in Purette, a storekeeper. They have four children ranging from 1 to 10 years of age, three of whom are in school.

He has been selling beer and lemonade for 20 years. This is his first loan from Turame.  Thanks to his  Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade to resell in order to earn more. In the years to come, he would like to start importing kitchen utensils for sale and provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beer and lemonade for resale.

loans.name: Benkelema 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 1sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konona, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Fatoumata debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  d’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 1 Group are married women with an average age of 43 and an average of four children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in Konona, a village in Dambela Commune in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This will be their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were all paid back in full. The group's main produce is corn. The group's representative is Fatoumata, the woman standing on the left at the end of the standing row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on buying farm inputs and seeds in order to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold on a village level as well as at the markets of Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women. She is planning on making an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.


.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 47 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y  maicillo, y esa así como se gana la vida honradamente, con su trabajo logra solventar cualquier gasto que se le presente en su hogar, Miriam vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y sus hijos, ella quiere seguir con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo pero no tiene de suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y también mejorar el terreno donde hace su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y asi poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Miriam is 47 years old and has been farming corn, beans and sorghum for a number of years. This is how she earns her living honorably. Through her work she manages to pay all the household expenses. Miriam lives with her family with consists of her husband and their children. She wants to continue her growing as this is her only source of income. She does not have enough capital to do this. So she is requesting a loan to be able to buy the needed inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control. herbicides. She also wants to improve the land she grows on as is shown in the photo. Then she can continue to supply her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides and also improve the land.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 55 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable, honesto y humilde, con gran esfuerzo hace varios años empezó a trabajar en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol, hoy ha tenido buenos resultados ya que obtiene una buena cosecha que comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, posee mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y lo vende a buen precio, el vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, el esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra como lo son: abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y también mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tomas is 55 years old. He is a hard-working, responsible, honest and humble man who with great effort started to farm corn and beans a number of years ago. Today he gets good results as he has good harvests which he sells around his area. He has lots of clients since his product is of high quality and he sells at a good price. He lives with his family which consists of his wife and three children in his own house. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy the inputs needed to plant which are the following: fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. He also wants to make improvements on the land that is shown in the photo. Then he can continue with his farming and provide his family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides and improve the land he farms.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien es agricultor y sus hijos en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por que vende a buen precio los platos de comida, josefina está solicitando un crédito para la para poder variar el menú y así poder tener más clientes y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Josefina is 54 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. Her husband is a farmer. She has a business selling food located in her house. She has a large clientele as she sells her meals at a good price. Josefina is requesting a loan to be able to vary the menu and be able to attract more clients and provide her family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, beans, rice, fruit, corn, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia Antonia

texts.es: Doña Eugenia, casada madre de un hijo en edad escolar su esposo la apoya siempre ya que el labora para una empresa privada y se dividen los gastos, ella tiene como actividad comercial la venta de Ropa de segunda mano, tiene como 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, y solicita este crédito para la compra de 2 pacas Golden Para Niños y Adultos Mixtos ya que ella desea incrementar sus ventar y que su ganancia sea mayor ya que con lo que le queda de ganancia ella aporta a la construcción de su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a married mother of one school age child. Her husband always supports her as he works for a private company and they divide expenses. 

Eugenia works selling second-hand clothing. She has had this business for 5 years and is asking for this loan to buy 2 bales of ‘Golden For Children’ and ‘Adult Mixed’ clothes, as she wishes to grow her sales and increase her profits. 

She will put the remaining profits towards the construction of her house. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have given her.

loans.use: to buy clothes bales.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de recargas telefónicas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se presentan en su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de tarjetas de recargas por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ana is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She works selling phone cards. Her business is located in her house and has has lots of clients. She manages to pay the household expenses with what she earns. Ana is requesting a loan to buy phone cards wholesale and be able to continue with her work and provide her family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy phone cards wholesale.

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konona, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Sali debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  d’intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkelema 2 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old, have three children, and all live in polygamous families in Konona, one of the villages in the commune of Dambela in the third administrative region of Mali, Sikasso. The joined with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, having fully paid back their previous loans. The crop cultivated by Sali, who is standing second from the left to the right in the photo, is corn. With her loan, she expects to buy fertilizers and agricultural seeds to maintain 1.5 hectares. The produce is sold at the village level, in the markets of Sikasso after the harvest, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 105,000 francs CFA per field. This profit will allow her to pay off her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and agricultural seeds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 42 años de edad es hombre muy trabajador, responsable y honesto desde hace 3 años tiene en su casa de habitación una pequeña tienda donde vende variedad de productos y a precios accesibles, por esa razón tiene mucha clientela, Daniel vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, aceite, refrescos, golosinas, sopas, etc. y así seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old and is a hardworking, responsible and honest man.  For the past three years he has had a small store in his home where he sells a variety of products at accessible prices.  For this reason, he has a large customer base.  Daniel lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their son. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise such as: basic grains, oil, beverages, snacks, soups, etc to continue with his business which generates good earnings to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, oil, beverages, snacks, soups, etc.

loans.name: Demetrio Celedonio

texts.es: El señor Demetrio, siempre dedicado a la Agricultura, ya que es prácticamente una herencia que ha recibido de sus padres el amor al trabajo del campo, el esta solicitando este crédito para darle mantenimiento a una cosecha de Piña que tiene para así pronto poder sacarla, el comprara, Triple, Urea, Completo, Fertilizante, agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de Fondos Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Demetrio has always worked in agriculture, since a love of working in the countryside is practically an inheritance which he received from his parents.

He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his pineapple crop so he can harvest it soon. He plans to buy Triple, Urea and Complete fertilizer. He is grateful for the support he has received from Kiva and Afodenic funds.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ian Gabriel

texts.en:
Ian Gabriel, 20 years of age, wants to have a diploma, even for a vocational course. For that, he is asking for a loan of PHP 40, 000 from Kiva lenders, through ASKI. He will use the loan to pay his tuition fees to take a Microfinance Technology course. 

According to Ian Gabriel, what drives him to pursue his studies is his dream of uplifting his family’s living. For he believes that, with education, he can get a good job where he can earn enough money to support their daily needs and wants, as well. 

He is very positive that lenders will approve his requested loan because it will definitely pave the way for him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nita has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Prodencia

texts.en:
Prodencia is 45 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

Prodencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Prodencia has been in pig-fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estrellita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Estrellita de 39 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y honrada, desde hace varios  años ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra cada año maíz y frijol, y esos años le han dado la experiencia necesaria para cosechar un buen cultivo, muchos vecinos dan buenas referencias de su persona y de los productos que comercializa por esa razón posee mucha clientela,  ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia, , Estrellita está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Estrellita, age 39, is a hardworking, responsible, and honorable woman.

She has been working in agriculture for several years, growing corn and beans each year, and these years have given her the experience necessary to harvest a good crop. Many neighbors give her and the crops that she sells good references, thus she has many customers. 

She lives in her own house with her husband and her four children. 

Estrellita is requesting a loan from Integral, in order to purchase necessary agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and similar items. This way, she and her family can have a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and similar items.

loans.name: Benkelema 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konona, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Marietou assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des  intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkelema 3 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old, have FOUR children, and all live in polygamous families in Konona, one of the villages in the commune of Dambela in the third administrative region of Mali, Sikasso. They joined with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their agricultural businesses well during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, having fully paid back their previous loans. The crop cultivated is corn, including by Marietou who is sitting in the middle. With her loan, she expects to buy fertilizers and agricultural seeds to maintain 1 hectare. The produce is sold at the village level, in the markets of Sikasso after the harvest, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow her to pay off her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and agricultural seeds.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 10 hijos; 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, 5 hijas: 4 de ellas mayores de edad y una de 13 años de edad estudia en el nivel básico, Marcos obtiene sus ingresos trabajando como albañil, este trabajo le permite llevar sustento a su familia, él solicita un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción (block, cemento, hierro, entre otros), lo que  más desea Marcos es tener una casa digna y tener mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Marcos is 56 years old and lives with his family in the town of Sololá in the state of Sololá.  He has 10 children.  His five sons are all adults, and he has five daughters, four of whom are adults and one is 13 years old and is in school.  Marcos earns his income working as a mason.  This work allows him to provide for his family.

He is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials (blocks, cement, iron, etc.).  What Marcos desires most is to have a proper home and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ligia trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo como domestica y se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante junto a su hija, su esposo la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de Materiales ya que desea mejorar su vivienda, compra, cemento, arena, bloques, donde ella habita la casa es minifalda mitad bloques y mitad madera, ella cambiara todo por bloques, Espera seguir contando con el apoyo y ayuda de Kiva y Afodenic ya que a podido sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Ligia has worked as a maid for a very long time and she strives to get ahead with her daughter.  Her husband supports her with the household expenses.  She is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials because she hopes to repair her home.  She will purchase cement, sand, and blocks.  The home that they live in is half cement and half wood.  She will change the whole house to cement blocks.  She hopes to continue counting on Kiva and Afodenic's help and support because they have allowed her to get her family ahead.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Family  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Family está formado por un grupo de gente emprendedora que buscan el bienestar de sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad hermosa muy visitada por los ecuatorianos y extranjeros, uno de los atractivos son las hermosas artesanías que se encuentran por toda la ciudad, desde blusas bordadas, suéteres de lana, joyería de filigrana bañada en oro y plata y tejidos. Cuenca igualmente tiene una tradición en artículos de cerámica. Artesanías y productos frescos pueden ser hallados de venta en la feria de los jueves o en el mercado los sábados. Una industria líder en Cuenca y sus alrededores es la de la confección de sombreros de paja toquilla.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Zoila, tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de  3 y 1 año, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Zoila labora en un comedor de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en sus tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, tiene e4ste negocio desde hace 5 meses. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa. Su meta es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The lending group "Family" is made up of a group of enterprising people who are looking out for their families' wellbeing.  They live in the city of Cuenca, a beautiful city that is heavily visited by Ecuadorians and foreigners.  One of the attractions is the beautiful crafts that can be found throughout the city from embroidered blouses, wool sweaters, gold and silver plated jewelry, and textiles.  Cuenca also has a tradition of ceramic items.  Crafts and fresh produce can be found for sale in the fair on Thursdays or in the market on Saturdays.  One of the leading industries in Cuenca and its surroundings is making straw hats.

One of the members of the group is Zoila.  She is 25 years old, and is a single mother of a three year old and a one year old.  She does not own her own home, so she rents one.  Zoila works in a restaurant from Monday to Friday from 7am to 5pm.  In her free time she works selling clothing from a catalog.  She has had this business from the past five months.  The money from the loan will be used to purchase clothing.  Her goal is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Heithel Santiago

texts.es: El señor Heithel continua con sus planes a largo plazo ya que el desea mejorar su vivienda, actualmente esta realizando otro anexo a la casa pero requiere de mas capital para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, estribos, Piedrin, Bloques, el quiere que su familia tengan  las mejores condiciones pero se le dificulta ya que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar por los diferentes gastos que se le presentan. Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por la oportunidad que le dan al otorgarle este financiamiento
texts.en: Heithel continues with his long term plans to make improvements on his house. Right now he is building another addition to the house and he needs more capital to buy materials like cement, sand, re-bar, gravel and cinder blocks. He wants his family to have better living conditions but it is difficult as he cannot amass the money he needs at one time to buy all the different things required. He is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for the opportunity they are providing him with this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Turimurunani Group

texts.fr:
Alexis fait partie du groupe Turimurunani et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 33 ans  et est marié  à Odette, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 mois à 6 ans .

Il fait le commerce de bière, et de limonade  depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  caisses de  bière et de limonade à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter  une parcelle et construire une maison  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Alexis is a part of the Turimurunani group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Odette, a saleswoman. Together, they have three children aged between 2 months to 6 years old. He has sold beer and lemonade for three years. He is on his first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade to resell at a profit. In the coming years, he would like to purchase a piece of land, build a house and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Jorge Rolando

texts.es: Jorge Rolando es una persona de 23 años de edad, es soltero, viven en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, vive en la casa de sus padres, se dedica a vender artículos para regalos, cumpleaños, bodas entre  otros, decidió iniciar con este negocio porque en el lugar donde vive no hay, además  trabaja como agente de negocios, Jorge Rolando solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 5,000.00 para comprar productos para variedades (artículos para regalos, bodas, cumpleaños)  para la tienda, él comenta que tener más surtido la tienda le genera más ingresos y permite atender mejor a sus clientes, el sueño de Jorge Rolando es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jorge Rolando is a 23 year old man.  He is single and lives in the city of Sololá in the state of Sololá.  He lives in his parents' home.  He works selling items for gifts, birthdays, weddings, etc.  He decided to start his own business because where he lives there aren't any.  He also works as a business agent.

Jorge Rolando is seeking a loan for Q. 5,000 to purchase a variety of products (items for gifts, weddings, birthdays) for his store.  He states that having a better stocked store will generate greater earnings and allow him to better serve his customers.  Jorge Rolando's dream is to build his own home.

loans.use: purchase a variety of items.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: Es originaria de Managua, desde hace aproximadamente 25 años se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas, con el propósito de establecer su propio negocio y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 12 años que cursa su primer año de secundaria. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para ir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, barrilla, madera, clavos, zinc y para cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar con la construcción de su casa y brindarle una vivienda segura y amplía sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eva Maria is originally from Managua, about 25 years ago she moved to Puerto Cabezas to establish her own business and have her own source of income.

She is married with four children, three of which are adults and independent, and the youngest is 12 years old in their first year of secondary education.

With the aim of improving her house, and for her family to live securely she is asking for her second loan to carry on constructing her home little by little.  She will buy construction materials: cement, rebar, wood, nails, zinc and cover labour costs. 

Her dream is to finish the construction of her house and give her children a secure and spacious home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, rebar, wood, nails, zinc and to cover labour costs.

loans.name: Innovación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Innovación está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades que les han permitido mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de Cuenca, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, a esta ciudad le hace grande su gente, su gastronomía, su cultura y la belleza de su naturaleza, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jessica, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Innovación, de este grupo le gusta la solidaridad y la gran amistad que existe, también los créditos le ayudan a salir adelante con su negocio.
La Señora Jessica es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora en su negocio de internet y cabinas telefónicas, la casa en la que vive es de familiares.
Doña Jessica labora prestando sus servicios de auxiliar contable, trabaja media día y de lunes a viernes, el resto de su tiempo lo dedica al negocio con su esposo. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar accesorios de celulares. Su meta es tener una imprenta.
En la foto está la hija de una socia, es la Srta. que se encuentran en la parte de atrás con una chompa negra, blusa rayada de rojo y blanco
texts.en:
The 'Innovación' communal bank is made up of 9 female members and one man.  They make a living from various activities which have enabled them to improve their household finances. They live in different parts of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in the country. What makes this city great are its people, its cuisine, its culture and its natural beauty. Since December 1999 it has been a World Heritage site because of its beautiful architecture. 

Jessica is one of the group members. This is the third loan she has taken out along with her friends and fellow members of the Innovación communal bank. What she likes about this group is the solidarity and great friendship which exists. In addition, the loans help her to move forward with her business.

Jessica is married and from her marriage she has produced a daughter, now five years old, who goes to a little primary school in the city. Her husband works in his internet and phone booth business. The house they live in belongs to family members. Jessica works as a bookkeeper, working half days from Monday to Friday, and the rest of the time she works in the business with her husband.

The money from the loan is to buy mobile phone accessories. Her goal is to have a printer's shop.

The daughter of one of the members is in the photo. She is the young lady at the back with a black cardigan and red and white striped top.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora es un grupo nuevo, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres jefas de familia que se han unido con el propósito de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Marciana es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de remedios naturales para mate y terere (bebidas tradicionales de Paraguay), es por medio de este trabajo que ella ayuda a su familia y a sus demás seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo, ya que quiere poder comprar remedios naturales para poder surtirse y tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Maria Auxiliadora” is a new group in its 1st loan cycle in the Women's Committee Program. These are women who are heads of families and have united with the proposition of being able to grow and improve their conditions of life and that of their families.

Marciana is one of the members. She is a very hard-working woman, who reports that she sells natural remedies on the streets to be taken with mate and terere, Paraguay's traditional drinks. By means of this work she helps her family and other loved ones.

Marciana is requesting this loan so that she can purchase natural remedies to restock her inventory and have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive en la ciudad de Nazca, trabaja como vigilante en un colegio de su ciudad con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de familia y su trabajo es la única fuente de ingresos para poder sacarla adelante.

Carlos esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita como refaccionar las paredes, mejoras las instalaciones d eluz, entre otros, asi podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poer hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida para su familia”.
texts.en: Carlos lives in the city of Nazca and works as a caretaker in a school in the city from which he makes money to improve his situation, above all because he is the father of a family and his work is their only way of improving their conditions. Carlos is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his home, such as refurbishing the walls and upgrading the light fittings which, among other things, will improve his quality of life and allow him to follow his dream: "providing good quality of life for his family".

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, tea and sugar to sell at retail

loans.name: Eynor Antonio

texts.es: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos adolescentes, que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para mejorar su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas, establecer su propio negocio y apoyar al desarrollo humano de sus hijos.
texts.en: Eynor is a native of Puerto Cabezas. He is 29 years old and has two adolescent children who study in secondary school. With the goal of improving their quality of living he is requesting his second loan to make improvements on his house and buy construction materials. His dream is to provide his family with a house with adequate living conditions, establish his own business and support the human development of his children.

loans.use: to buy construction material to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Raquel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

Raquel has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
Las Obreras es un grupo muy conocido en el barrio por su unión y por la forma en que trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para que a través de la encuesta de eliminación puedan conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Florencia, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su barrio y otras zonas. Los comestibles ella misma los hace y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, y deleitando a sus clientes. Quiere comprar carne, condimentos, verduras, pollo y demás.
texts.en:
Las Obreras is a group which is well known in the neighbourhood for its unity and for the way in which they all work and help each other. They are also taking part in the poverty elimination programme so that through the elimination survey they can each find out their situation.

Florencia is one of the members. She makes a living selling food in her neighbourhood and other areas. She makes the food herself and then goes out selling in the street.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies so she can continue making her food and delighting her customers. She wants to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, chicken and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, chicken and other items.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is 38 years old and happily married to her husband Sixto who works abroad. God blessed them with loving children, all of whom are studying. She and her husband are working hard so they can give their family a good future.

Judy owns a computer shop. These computer shops are rented for 20 PHP per hour. Some families don’t have their own computers, so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad; and others, especially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8am and close at 7pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns 400 PHP a day.

Just as any other business owner, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Agatona

texts.en:
Agatona is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Agatona is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Agatona has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, diapers, candies, and biscuits to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, diapers, candies, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her business.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store. Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 33 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, que estudia su primaria.  Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, estableció en su vivienda  un taller de bicicletas. Con los créditos anteriores que le otorgo PANA PANA, le han permitido comprar herramientas y equipo de trabajo. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda y comprar repuestos de bicicletas. Su sueño es acondicionar y ampliar el local que actualmente tiene en su vivienda y ofrecer al por mayor la venta de repuestos de bicicletas.
texts.en:
Orlando is originally from Puerto Cabezas, is 33 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old child who is in elementary school. With the goal of having his own source of income, approximately five years ago he started a bicycle repair shop in his home. 

    

With the loans previously given to him from PANA PANA, he has been able to buy tools and work materials. He requests funding to improve his home and buy spare parts for bicycles. His dream is to fix up and expand the space that he currently has in his home and offer spare bicycle parts wholesale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 46 years old and married with two children. Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, and sugar to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and married with three children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elsie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with four children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like shampoo, hair conditioner, coffee, detergent soap, candy, biscuits and diapers to sell.

Fe has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Fe aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory items like shampoo, hair conditioner, coffee, detergent soap, candy, biscuits and diapers to sell

loans.name: Francisca Eugenia

texts.es: Es una mujer sociable y alegre, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 48 años de edad, madre soltera de 6 hijos, de los cuales 5 son mayores de edad, y el menor de 9 años que cursa su tercer grado de primaria. Desde hace tres años utiliza una letrina, que se encuentra en estado un poco deteriorado. Con el objetivo de construir un tanque séptico, solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales: cemento, hierro, bloques y cubrir los gastos de mano de obra. Con el crédito el primer crédito que le otorgo PANA PANA, lo utilizo para trasladar a Managua a su hijo menor que se encontraba enfermo, con el propósito de realizarle análisis y estudios médicos. Su sueño es contar con un inodoro sanitario, para evitar la salida de olores.
texts.en:
This is Francisca Eugenia, a social and happy woman originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 48 years old and the single mother of 6 children, five of which are older. The youngest, at 9 years old, is finishing third grade. As of three years ago she has been using a latrine, that finds itself in a deteriorated state. With the objective of building a septic tank, she is requesting a second financing in order to buy materials: cement, iron, blocks and to cover the costs of labor. 

With the first loan that Pana Pana awarded her, she utilized in order to move her youngest son to Managua as he was ill, with the purpose to carry out medical studies and analysis for him. Her dream is to count on indoor plumbing in order to get rid of the unpleasant odours.

loans.use: to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Khosgerel
