texts.en: Khosgerel is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a distributor at a fuel station since 2002. Her husband works as a security officer for a private firm. Their son is a cook and works at a restaurant. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs repair. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for the house renovation. When the work is completed, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and so fewer pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Fanny Ella

texts.es:
Fanny vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, trabajoque le permite tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que es madre de 3 hijos d e18,16 y 3 años, a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes lucha para darles una vida digna.

Fanny esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, lo que le permitira ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle uan buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the city of Ica and works as a labourer for an agricultural fund in her city, which allows her to have the income to cover her household expenses. She is the mother of 3 children aged 18, 16 and 3 who she loves dearly and for whom she fights to provide a decent life.

Fanny is grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to their help she can improve the house where she lives, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and keep fighting to make her greatest dream come true: "to give her son a good education".

loans.use: improve the house where she lives

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.en:
Ancelma is 50 years old and single.

Ancelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ancelma has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Ancelma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and married with five children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Eva has a general store business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sardines, noodles, snack foods, and other groceries.

Eva has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sardines, noodles, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 24 years old, married, and has two children, one currently in school.

Elsie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Diosan

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Diosan works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store and buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Diosan is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Diosan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening. Fedelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ivy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ivy has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebayar, 39 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2011. His wife makes and sells deels (traditional clothes) to local people. He is one of our most reliable and trustworthy clients and pays his installments without any delay. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to renovate his old house. The loan will be spent on the purchase of building materials and payment of the workforce. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and thus, releases less pollutant into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen 2  está en su 9no ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando y esforzándose un poco más.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Erodita, quien a través de las confecciones de prendas que hace está luchando por ir mejorando cada día, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que siempre quedan muy conformes con el trabajo que ella les hace, ya que es muy hábil. Su sueño es poder tener un taller más grande, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, ayudando a su familia a través de él.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás, con lo que podrá seguir con su trabajo, ayudando a su familia y tener también más clientes.
texts.en:
This group's name is Virgen del Carmen 2, and it is in its ninth cycle in the women's committee program, through which all its members made a commitment to work and help each other in order to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, and three of these seventeen women fall below the poverty line, which means they must keep up their efforts and work a little harder.

Erodita is one of them. By making clothing items, she is striving for things to gradually improve day by day. She says she has a very good customer base and that her customers are always very satisfied with her work, because she is very skilled. Her dream is to be able to have a larger shop in order to keep working and helping her family through her work.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and other items. This will allow her to keep working, helping her family, and also reach more customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and other items.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis vive en la ciudad de ingenio, e sun hombre muy trabajador, es pro ello que se dedica con mucho esmero a su trabajo como agricultor, el actualmente ha sembrado tuna, la cual es una fruta muy deliciosa que crece en una planta parecida a un cactus. Luis trabaja en este oficio hace mucho tiempo y cree que le va bien porque es muy dedicado.

Luis esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá infestar la planta de cochinilla, la cochinilla es un insecto el cual es usado para dar color a diversos materiales; asimismo con el apoyo Luis podrá solventar los gastos de riesgo, abono, entre otros; de esta manera Luis tendrá una buena cosecha, asimismo podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un fundo”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Ingenio. He is a very hard-working man, and so he takes a lot of care over his work as a farmer. Currently he has planted prickly pear, which is a very delicious fruit which grows on a plant similar to a cactus. Luis has been doing this job for a long time and thinks it is going well for him because of his dedication.

Luis is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to introduce cochineal bugs to the plants. The cochineal is an insect which is used for colouring various materials. Luis will also be able to cover the costs of irrigation, manure and other items. This means Luis will have a good harvest, and will be able to increase his income and keep on working towards realising his dream of having a farm.

loans.use: to introduce cochineal bugs and buy manure and other items.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Perlita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Perlita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Perlita has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Perlita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is 42 years old and has six children. Silva is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Silva and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Silva is taking out a housing loan of PHP 7,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Silva has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Silva can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ediltrudes's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Ediltrudes is taking out a 9500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Ediltrudes has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Ediltrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native mats weaving business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her native mats weaving business.

She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her native mats weaving business

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangelista is 52 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Evangelista has a fruit- and vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Evangelista requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Evangelista has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Evangelista would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janidy

texts.en:
Janidy is 35 years old and married, with five children. Janidy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janidy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Janidy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Cerenia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nenita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Nenita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married and works hard to support her family. She sells purchase order cards in the Philippines.  Victoria requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 6 years now.  Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy purchase order cards to resell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Florenda has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 54 years old and married, with six children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell, like coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, eggs, rice, noodles, and cereals.

Leonora has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Leonora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, eggs, rice, noodles, and cereals.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo san Francisco están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que sus miembros vayan mejorando sus vidas, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delmira
Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, comenta que tiene una despensa y que por medio de ella está creciendo y saliendo adelante. Quiere ir creciendo en su negocio es por ello que se está esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, balanceados, carne, pollo, embutidos y demás, de manera a tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the San Francisco group are doing the poverty elimination survey so that the members can keep making improvements to their lives.

Delmira is one of the members. She is president of the group and is a very active and hard-working woman. She says she has a shop and this means she is able to grow and make progress in life. She wants to continue growing in her business and this is why she is making a lot of effort. 

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, balanced feed, meat, chicken, sausages and other items, so she can have a better variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, balanced feed, meat, chicken, sausages and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another two goats

loans.name: Nelen

texts.en:
Nelen works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 7500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. She has been with NWTF since 2013.

With your help, Nelen will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Nelen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 33 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jona has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Shiela's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Shiela has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Shiela has taken a 9000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Shiela is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Merlinda is married and has four children who are in school. Merlinda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Merlinda is taking out a housing loan of 9000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Merlinda has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Merlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godofreda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Godofreda is 58 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Godofreda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Godofreda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Godofreda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Godofreda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 37 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricris is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.
 
Maricris has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Judith requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear stock to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 61 years old, married and has six children. 

Arsenia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Arsenia has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arsenia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, rice, etc. for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. Ma. Elena is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ma. Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Irene is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: Minerva is a widow who works hard to support her family. She has a pillow making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 28 years.  Minerva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.  Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pillow materials.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myrna has a soft drinks and beer vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft drinks and beer to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft drinks and beer to sell

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina has a live-in partner with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sabrina is 40 years old and both of her children are in school.

Sabrina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sabrina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

Sabrina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sabrina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemae

texts.en:
Rosemae is 34 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Rosemae has a photography business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her photography.

Rosemae has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosemae would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new photography supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 53 years old and married with three children. 

Luz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luz has been raising pigs for 32 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Es un hombre trabajador y luchador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, dos adolescentes que cursan su primaria y un menor de edad de año y medio. Desde hace 13 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y que su esposo le apoye atender el negocio. solicita financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, materiales de limpieza, toalla sanitaria, papel higiénico, verduras y frutas, en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es comprar un camión, para reducir costos de transporte de los productos que oferta.
texts.en:
Raul is a hardworking and determined man. Originally from Puerto Cabezas, he is 42 years old, married, with three children. Two are adolescents in primary school, and one is one and a half years old. 


Thirteen years ago he started a small general store for the purpose of having his own source of income, and so his wife could help him tend to the business. 
 

He requests funding to buy staple foods, cleaning supplies, sanitary pads, toilet paper, vegetables, and fruits in Managua, and sell them at affordable prices in the city of Puerto Cabezas. His dream is to buy a truck to reduce the transportation costs of the products he offers.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, cleaning supplies, sanitary pads, toilet paper, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena works hard to support her family. Ma. Magdalena is married and has a buy-and-sell  business in the Philippines offering ready-to-wear clothing.

Ma. Magdalena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothing to sell. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ma. Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Myrna

texts.en:
Ma. Myrna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Myrna is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Myrna has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Ma. Myrna requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, T-shirts, etc. to sell.

Ma. Myrna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, T-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jessenia Aracely

texts.es: Es una señora alegre y sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es policía. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde aproximadamente 5 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para incrementar su inventario y comprar mercadería: ropa interior, niños, jóvenes y adultos: pantalón, camisa hombre, blusas, chivería, granos básico y cosméticos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener su propio tramo
texts.en:
Jessenia is a cheerful and sociable lady from from Puerto Cabezas. She is 31 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a police officer. In order to have her own source of income, she set up her own business in her home about five years ago, where she sells new clothing for children, juniors, and adults. 

She is requesting a loan to increase inventory and buy merchandise like underwear, pants, men's shirts, blouses, snacks, basic grains, and cosmetics. Her dream is to expand her business and move it into a retail space.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama  LUZ DIVINA están en el 4to. ciclo con 16 integrantes, son todas mujeres de familias muy trabajadoras, que quieren unir esfuerzos en pos de seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes la señora Maria quien se dedica a la venta de comidas y a la cría de animales  y con este préstamo quiere poder comprar maíz, y más gallinas y algunas comodidades para su cocina, de manera a seguir creciendo en ambos trabajos que hace. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir progresando.
texts.en:
The Luz Divina (Divine Light) Committee is in its fourth year with 16 members. They are all women from hard-working families who would like to combine their efforts in hopes of continuing to help their families.

One of the members is a woman named Maria who makes a living selling food and raising animals. With this loan she wants to buy corn, more chickens and some items of convenience for her kitchen, in order to continue growing at both the jobs she has. 

She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens and to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Munkhtugs

texts.en: Mr. Munkhtugs, 41 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between Ulaanbaatar and Darkhan, the second largest city. His wife sells clothes at trade center. He is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to add an extension to his house. After the extension, his house will preserve more energy and lose less heat, reducing coal usage and emitting less smoke.

loans.use: to ad an extension to his house

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Los Angeles es un grupo formado en ciudad del este, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una persona muy trabajadora es Aureliana que se dedica a vender prendas variadas de forma ambulante. Por medio de este trabajo está dando a su familia lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella es una persona muy animosa y trabajadora que tiene muchas ganas de poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio y con ello quiere poder surtirse y tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Está agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe y que le permitirá crecer
texts.en:
Los Angeles is a group that was founded in Ciudad del Este. Its members are enterprising women and very hard workers. They belong to the poverty elimination program, which will enable them to learn about each of the members' life situation.

Aureliana is a very hardworking person. She works as a street vendor selling assorted clothing. Her work allows her to give her family what they need, so that they don't have to suffer any hardship. She is a very lively and driven person who is eager to be able to keep growing and helping her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in purchasing winter clothing, since the cold weather is approaching and she wants to be well-stocked and have a variety of items to offer her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting because it will allow her to grow.

loans.use: comprar prendas de invierno para la venta.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
This is Jacqueline, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Miguel, a tricycle driver and they have children.  She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Jacqueline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jacqueline hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El Señor Raul es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casado y tiene un hijo. Él es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, comenta que empezó a trabajar como macatero  (vendedor ambulante) y más adelante como encargado de un negocio, su sueño de siempre era de tener su propio local y trabajar en forma independiente, generar mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Pasaron los años y con su esfuerzo, dedicación y la ayuda de su esposa, salió adelante compro un terreno donde mando a construir un salón y así empezó a surtir su propio negocio que es una despensa y mercería.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con frutas, verduras, carnes, enlatados, y demás, de manera a seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que le están dando y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Raul is from the city of Santaní. He is married and has a child. He is a very hard worker and a very responsible and honest man. He says he started working as a street vendor, and later became manager for a business. But his dream was always to have his own business, work for himself, and generate better income to improve his family's quality of life. Years later, with his own effort and dedication as well as his wife's help, he was able to get ahead and purchase a plot of land where he had his business built. That is how he started stocking his business, which is a grocery and hardware store. 

He is requesting this loan in order to stock up on fruit, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and other items for his business in order to keep working. He is grateful for the opportunity he is getting, because it will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel  trabaja de forma particular con su tía vendiendo prendas de vestir, a la par, también está estudiando en la universidad la carrera de administración de empresas, ya que tiene como meta poder independizarse algún día en su propio negocio.
Él  vive con sus padres, y comenta que sus metas futuras es recibirse y crecer profesionalmente, independizarse para tener  un mejor  ingreso y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de la universidad, como pasajes de ómnibus, alimentación, copias y demás.
texts.en:
Angel works for his aunt selling clothing and he is also studying business administration at university as his goal is to be able to have his own independent business some day.

He lives with his parents and he says his future goals are to grow professionally and become independent so that he can have a better income and help his family.

He asks for this loan so that he can pay for his university expenses such as bus tickets, food, photocopies and more.

loans.use: pay for his university expenses such as bus tickets, food, photocopies and more.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando con el propósito de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Ella pretende terminar la carrera que está cursando, la cual es la de relaciones exteriores, que le abrirá las puertas a la vida profesional y podrá crecer. Comenta que tuvo que dejar lejos a su familia para poder estudiar, y es eso lo que más le cuesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar una notebook, que le será de mucha ayuda a la hora de hacer los trabajos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Julia is from the city of Ybycuí, she is studying with the intent of being able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She hopes to finish her degree in Foreign Affairs, which will open the door to a professional life and allow her to grow. She mentions that she had to travel far from her family to be able to study, and that is the hardest thing for her.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy a notebook computer, which will greatly help her complete her homework at university.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la ciudad de camana, trabaja en una ferretería como vendedor, asimismo tiene un empleo como vigilante con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Miguel esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá solventar algunos gastos personales, asi como también solventar algunos gastos de estudio ya que actualmente estudia la carrera de Educación, así podrá seguir estudiando y trajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Mejorar su vivienda y ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the city of Camana and works as a salesman in a hardware store. He also has a job as a security guard, which allows him to earn enough income to make ends meet.

Miguel is grateful to Kiva lenders, because the help they have given him will allow him to cover some personal expenses as well as some school expenses, since he is currently getting a degree in Education. This will allow him to stay in school and keep working towards building his career, which is his main goal.

loans.use: to cover school and personal expenses.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosemarie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what Rosemarie lost. Rosemarie is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Rosemarie has been with NWTF since 2013 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Flora has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Flora has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Flora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 58 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more grocery items to sell.

Margie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from fish vending and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 69 years old and widowed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, juice, coffee, candies, soft-drinks, etc.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.  Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 46 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. With two children currently in school, Marciana works very hard to provide for them.

Marciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, bread, sugar, sanitary pads, etc. 

Marciana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, bread, sugar, sanitary pads, etc. 

Marciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, bread, sugar, sanitary pads, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a vehicle rental business in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and married with six children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Milagros has restarted her rug-making business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Milagros has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Milagros is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kathlyn Grace

texts.en:
Kathlyn Grace is 27 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Kathlyn Grace is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Kathlyn Grace has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like noodles, vegetables, rice, meat, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like noodles, vegetables, rice, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Al- Jamia Al- Kadima Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Jamia Al- Kadima. It is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Aeda is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old and a married woman with nine children. She lives with her big family in their own house. Aeda works as a housewife and she is very dynamic woman. Her husband is an employee in the public sector. The salary that he receives from his work is good, but it is not enough to renovate their old house. Their house needs renovation from the inside. Most of rooms have not been renovated, in addition to the kitchen and the bathroom. This thing affects Aeda negatively and she feels ashamed especially if any guests or visitors come to her house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

Aeda hopes to renovate her whole house and rent it out in order to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 55 years of age, is married to a driver and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a transportation business for almost 19 years and earning a net income of PHP 800 daily. Together with her husband they work hard together to earn more income for their children. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 28,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her jeepney. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité San Rafael  es un grupo nuevo que se formó a partir de las buenas experiencias de los grupos vecinos que las motivaron para conformar su comité. El grupo tienen 16 integrantes, todas con la plena convicción de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia a partir del acompañamiento que se les brindará.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Ramona quien se dedica a la venta de comida, ella todos los días prepara y sale a vender por el barrio, donde todos ya le conocen por su producto y servicio de calidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, y esta agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
San Rafael is a new group that was founded based upon the positive experiences of neighboring groups, which motivated these women to start their own committee. The group has sixteen members, and they are all fully committed to improving their quality of life as well as their families' with the support they will receive.

Ramona is one of its members, and she is known to be very enterprising. She works selling food, which she prepares daily before going out to sell it throughout the neighborhood, where already everyone knows her for her products and her quality service.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy ingredients in order to keep making her food, like vegetables, meats, condiments, and other items. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina  EL PROGRESO están en el 3er. Ciclo, donde todas y cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes la señora Lucina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas y a la fabricación de artículos de limpieza de modo tal a diversificar sus ingresos y con este préstamo quiere comprar kits de limpieza y también mejorar un poco su cocina que es su medio de trabajo.
Todas están muy contentas y agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group El Progreso is in its third cycle, and each of its members is putting her best foot forward in order to get ahead.

Lucina is one of its members. She works selling food and making cleaning products in order to diversify her income. She wants to use this loan to buy cleaning kits and also improve her kitchen a little, since it is where she works.

They are all very happy and grateful for this opportunity of growth and improvement.

loans.use: to buy cleaning kits and improve the kitchen.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lida es estudiante, vive con sus padres y estudia. Ella es muy dedicada a sus estudios, es una persona que desea salir adelante con sus esfuerzos para alcanzar sus metas.
Su meta es tener su título universitario en Administración Agraria, y poder trabajar de forma independiente, y enseñar en las Universidades para tener un buen ingreso así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchos gastos de que cubrir.
texts.en:
Lidia is a student who lives with her parents and is currently studying. She is very dedicated to her studies and she is a person who, through her efforts, hopes to get ahead and reach her goals.

Her goal is to get her university degree in Agricultural Administration, to be able to work independently and teach in universities so she can make good money and therefore improve her family's quality of life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her tuition costs, since she has many costs to cover.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs.

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con lo que podrá ayudar a las demás personas, que es lo que siempre quiso hacer.
Comenta que sus padres la están ayudando a estudiar, y que está luchando para no defraudarlos y retribuirles todo lo que han hecho por ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mari is from the city of Villarrica, she is studying nursing so she will be able to help other people, which is what she has always wanted to do.

She mentions that her parents are helping her with her studies, and that she is trying her best not to disappoint them and repay them for everything they have done for her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees from her university, and therefore to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Juliet has been in this business for three years now.

Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Helen has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, wire, etc. for her broom making business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 9 years. Rosemarie earns more income from a general store.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: A- Aydi ** Group

texts.en:
A- Aydi ** is a group which comprises of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman. She studied till the elementary school, but she couldn't complete her study. Fatima's husband is employed as a soldier in the army. He is very dynamic and works hard in order to improve the living standards of his family. The salary which he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Fatima says that her house lacks of a refrigerator and she can't afford this thing. Inside the kitchen of her house, Fatima puts many kinds of drinks, foods, sweets, and vegetables without a refrigerator where they need to be in a cold condition. The climate these days is very hot. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep all those foods and drinks in a cold condition. As a result, most of those foods and drinks expire quickly. For this reason Fatima is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator for the house.

Fatima looks forward to improving the condition of her family through purchasing all home appliances in order to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Melisa is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Melisa has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, esta esforzándose bastante para poder cumplir su meta que es la de ser una profesional para poder ayudar a las personas de la sociedad. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar sus cuotas, y le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder seguir estudiando y pagar las cuotas de su universidad. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo de cubrir sus gastos de estudios.
texts.en:
Julieta is studying Business Engineering and she is making quite the effort to be able to reach her goal which is to be successful and to help people of society. She mentions that her previous loan was used to pay for her college fees, and it was very helpful.

Now she is asking for a new loan to be able to continue studying and to pay her college fees. She is thankful for this new opportunity that she is getting to cover her academic expenses.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Alejandro Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Alejandro Rafael es profesor de agronomia es una escuela tecnica vocacional del municipio de leon desde hace 8 años impartiendo sus enseñanzas a jovenes de entre 12 a 17 años de bajos recursos que presentan la ganas y la vocacion de querer aprender un oficio en un corto tiempo.
El Sr. Alejandro Necesita el credito para cubrir unos gastos de medicina y compra de medicamentos ya que actualmente presenta unos problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Alejandro Rafael has been a professor of agriculture in a technical vocational school in the municipality of Leon for 8 years, imparting his lessons  to youth who are of little means and between 12 and 17 years old, who show the drive and desire to learn a trade in a short time. 

Alejandro needs the loan to cover some medical expenses and to buy medicine since he currently has some health problems.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses and a medical consultation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KANKELETIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Dembela,  dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Rokia A assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Kankeletigui 1 Group are married women with an average age of 41 and an average of four children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Dambela Commune in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This will be their seventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were all paid back in full. The group's main produce is corn. The group's representative is Rokia, the woman sat in the middle of the first row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on buying farm inputs and seeds in order to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold on a village level as well as at the markets of Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women. She is planning on making an average profit of 170,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Zamir Benito

texts.es: El Sr.Zamir Benito labora para una empresa privada desde hace 8 años como gestor de cobro siendo su horario de trabajo de lunes a sabado de 8 am a 5:30 pm, siendo un joven que esta empezando su vida matrimonial, siente la necesidad de ir comprando poco a poco los articulos de su casa de habitacion por lo que solicito un credito de bajo intereses y un plazo adecuado a sus nececidades.
texts.en: Zamir Benito has worked for a private enterprise for the past 8 years as a collection agent, his work schedule being Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 5:30 pm. Being a young person who is beginning his married life, he feels the necessity to begin buying, little by little, articles for his home of residence, for which he requested a low interest loan and a term suited to his needs.

loans.use: to buy an electrical home appliance.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is 36 years old and happily married to Genelito who works abroad. God blessed them with loving children and all of them are studying. She and her husband are helping each other in working so they can give their family a good future.

Rowena owns a computer shop. These computer shops are rented for PHP 20 per hour. Still, some families don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad and others, specially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8 am and close at 7 pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns PHP 400 a day.

Rowena dreams of having another branch and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KANKELETIGUI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Dembela, chef lieu de la commune de Dembela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Adiara debout en deuxième position de la droite ver la gauche. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Kankeletigui 2 Group are married women with an average age of 44 and an average of four children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Dambela Commune in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This will be their seventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were all paid back in full. The group's main produce is corn. The group's representative is Adiara, the woman standing second from the right in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on buying farm inputs and seeds in order to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold on a village level as well as at the markets of Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women. She is planning on making an average profit of 175,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Dúo Los Planes Group

texts.es: Dúo los planes, este duo esta integrado por el señor Luis Martin de 32 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de comida en varias clases esperando que le puedan ayudar ya que el sueño de don Luis es tener un su comedor.
texts.en: Duo Los Planes: this duo includes Luis Martin who is 32 years old. He has made a living selling food for several years. On this occasion he is requesting this loan to buy goods for the preparation of various types of food. He is hoping that someone will be able to help him since Don Luis' dream is to have a small restaurant.

loans.use: to buy goods for the preparation and sale of food.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Don Abelardo es un señor de 54 años que rompe los estereotipos de género tradicionales, pues trabaja desde hace seis años como comerciante de tortillas. Junto a su pareja y sus cuatro hijos, participan en el negocio que sustenta los gastos del hogar y de la educación de cada uno. 
Anteriormente, Don Abelardo había conseguido otro préstamo, del cual se expresa con gratitud porque pudo mantener activo su negocio, debido a que compró maíz y leña para aumentar la productividad. En estos momentos, se ha visto afectado por el alza en los precios del maíz, es por esto que necesita de otro préstamo para comprar  maíz al por mayor, cal, bolsas y leña al menor costo posible, lo que además le beneficiará para almacenar y no sufrir en otra alza. Entre sus planes está seguir creciendo, por lo que al terminar este préstamo, piensa obtener otro financiamiento para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a 54-year-old gentleman who falls outside the traditional gender roles, because he has been working selling tortillas for the past six years. His wife and his four children also partake in the business, which provides for their household expenses and education.

Abelardo was previously granted another loan, and he talks about it with gratitude because it allowed him to keep his business actively operating. He used it to buy corn and firewood to increase productivity. At the moment, he has been affected by the rising price of corn, which is why he needs another loan to buy wholesale corn, lime, bags, and firewood at the lowest possible cost in order not to suffer if there is another hike in prices. His plans include to keep growing, which is why when he pays back this loan, he intends to obtain more financing to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, lime, bags, and firewood.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Janeth is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janeth has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Janeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg, 37 years old, lives with her son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a kindergarten since 2012. Her son is an assistant worker at a construction company. Her daughter is five years old and stays in the kindergarten where she works. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en: Obasanjo, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children. Two of his children are in school and one is still small. He has had a public transportation business for 10 years now. He works from 6:30 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be Obasanjo's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to maintain his dala dala (minibus share taxi) and has paid back all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, build one room to rent and cover his household expenses. He will use his loan to repair the engine of the dala dala, He dreams of owning a big business. Obasanjo will share this loan with his group "Kilombero", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair the engine of his dala dala.

loans.name: Fidelia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Fidelia Patricia, labora como responsable de entrega de subsidios en una de los centros de salud en la Ciudad de León desde hace tres años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Fidelia Patricia solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de cemento, arena y azulejos para reparación de cuarto de habitación, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Fidelia Patricia has worked as a manager for the delivery of grants in one of the health centres in the city of Léon for three years. She begins work at 7:00 am and finishes at 5:00 pm. She does this job to support her family. 

Fidelia Patricia is requesting this loan from Ceprodel to buy cement, sand and tiles to repair a room in her home, which will allow her to improve her living standards and quality.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Mesiya Group

texts.en:
Revocatus is in his mid thirties and is single. He has had two shops, electronics and hardware, for three years now. He works from 7:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Revocatus will use this loan to restock all of his shop inventory. He dreams of being a successful man. He will share this loan with his loan group "Mesiya" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock all of his shop inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Beatriz has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of dry goods like scissors, lighters, belts, etc. to sell.

Beatriz has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods like scissors, lighters, belts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 60 years old and widowed with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like candies, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, etc. to sell.

Catalina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as candies, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, etc.

Catalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like candies, shampoo, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Jean has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 56 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonarda has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

Leonarda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old married man with only one six-year-old child. He has an elementary education, but he couldn't complete his studies. His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man. As the main source of income for his family, Ali has sold groceries and food products since 2006. He started this business with a small capital. Thanks to Ali's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Ali to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Ali turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 175,000 YER to buy more food items for future sale.

Ali plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business more in order to provide his family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy more food items

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling of personal collection products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling peanut butter. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more personal collection products to sell for her direct selling business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more  personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, beer, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Welina

texts.en:
Welina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years now.

Welina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Ligia, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo y  labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de león, desempaña esta labor desde hace cuatro años,  inicia sus labores 7:00 am  finalizando  a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a domingo,  ella  realiza esta labor para el sustento de su hogar.   

Doña Alma Ligia solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, shores, faldas, entre otros productos, esto le permitirá aumentar su clientela y así poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alma Ligia is a mother of four children, two of which are under her care. She works in the city of León, as a shopkeeper in a market. She has carried out this type of work for four years; starting work at 7 am and finishing up at 5pm with this same schedule seven days a week. She works to sustain the livelihood of her household.

Doña Alma Ligia requests a loan from CEPRODEL so she can use it to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, among other products. This loan will help her increase her customer base and in turn, increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, among other products.

loans.name: Guadalupe Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe Lucia, labora como conserje en una de las universidades en la Ciudad de León desde hace veintiocho años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm de lunes a viernes, el realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Guadalupe solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de bloques, hierro y zinc para la construcción de su humilde vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Lucia works as a custodian for one of the universities in the City of León. She has worked there for 28 years, and she starts work at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday. She does this work in order to support her household. 

Doña Guadalupe is requesting this loan from Ceprodel to buy concrete blocks, iron bars and metal plates for the construction of her humble house. This will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.
