loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, iron bars and metal plates.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 55 years old, married and has two children. Through her beauty parlor business, Luzviminda is able to fully support her children's education and proud to share that they are now both finished with their studies. Through her business, she is also able to provide her adopted children's basic needs like foods and education. Luzviminda offers hair straightening, hair cutting and other beauty salon services to her customers. Aside from her beauty salon business, Luzviminda is engaged in selling handicrafts products beside her beauty salon stall. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy materials and treatment products for hair. She also plans to use the loan to buy baskets and other handicraft products to sell. She hopes to find additional productive businesses so that she will further sustain their needs.

loans.use: to buy materials and treatment products for hair.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Ana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell .

Maria Ana has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aine

texts.en:
Aine is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, bread, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, etc. to sell.

Aine has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from selling sand and gravel.

Aine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, coffee, bread, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, and milk to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is single and has an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresa has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Neneth is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Neneth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of sand and gravel business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more sand and gravel to sell. 

Emelina has been in this business for 23 years. Emelina earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Emelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.
.

loans.use: to buy more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Jackeline Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jackeline del Socorro, es madre de tres lindo hijos y  labora como Asesora Hospitalaria desde hace tres años en uno de los centros hospitalarios de la ciudad de León,  inicia sus labores 6:00 am  finalizando  a las 3:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a sábado,  ella  realiza esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.   

Doña Jackeline  solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el cual  utilizo para compra de Perlines y Zinc los cuales le permitirán la remodelación del techo de su humilde vivienda ya que esta próximo el período de invierno, esto le permitirá mejora su nivel de vida al igual que el de su familia.
texts.en:
Jackeline del Socorro is the mother of three beautiful children, and she has worked for three years as a Hospital Advisor in one of the hospital centers of the city of León. She starts work at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 3:00 p.m., following this same schedule from Monday through Saturday. She does this work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Doña Jackeline is requesting a loan from Ceprodel which she will use to buy metal beams and metal plates. With these, she will be able to renovate the roof of her humble home, since the Nicaraguan winter season is approaching. This will allow her to improve her living standards and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy metal beams and metal plates.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines, one of the areas affected when typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. She is married to Hugo, a businessman. He helps her to operate the fish pond. She has two children, both studying. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Flordeliza and her husband are operating a fish pond where they have been buying and selling prawn, milk fish, and crablets for more than nine years now. She was able to provide for her family through this business. Her customers are the local community and other buyers from other communities. Her minimum monthly income is PHP 50,000.

She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy more prawns, milk fish and crablets for her fish pond.

FLordeliza hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more prawns, milk fish and crablets for her fish pond.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a single man from Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines. His area was affected by typhoon Haiyan when it hit in November 2013. He is a responsible and a hard-working businessman. He is able to support his mother and his brother with his variety store business. 

Arnold has operated his variety store for seven years now. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Arnold hopes that his business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Rubilyn ran a business selling clothes for three years. When she get tired of it, Rubilyn decided to start a mini grocery business in her town. Rubilyn wants to expand the products she is selling to earn a higher income. She needs to increase her sales, and at the same time her income, to support her youngest child's education. Rubilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items, bread, and beverages. She hopes to attain her goal and finish her child's education soon.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, bread, and beverages.

loans.name: Estrelieta

texts.en:
Estrelieta works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Estrelieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Estrelieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Dulce

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Dulce works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling chicken and direct selling Avon products. Ma. Dulce is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Dulce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, one currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sand and gravel to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 17 years. Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Nancita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancita has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Nancita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase appliances for the house.

loans.name: Shirleychita

texts.en:
Shirleychita is 63 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Shirleychita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Shirleychita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, and sugar for her food-vending business.

Shirleychita has been in this business for five years. Shirleychita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, and sugar for her food-production business

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en: Biljana wants to thank all of the lenders for a previous loan she used to renovate the toilet and complete some other renovations in the house. It was with this loan that she managed to finally complete the renovations that were urgently needed. She has said that without the loan, it would have been impossible. Now, she is again requesting a loan to purchase the materials to renovate the façade of the house, which will help her to save money on her utility bills and expenses. She is very grateful for both loans and promises to pay the new loan on time again.

loans.use: To  purchase the materials to renovate the façade of the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the engine of a taxi

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en: The borrower, Ljubinka, is a married mother of 3 adult children, who are all married and living with their own families. She and her husband still live together in a minority community of Kosovo, where he receives a pension and she continues to work as a nurse, which she has been doing for her entire life. The house they are living in is very old and has not had any renovations since the money they had went to pay for her children, their education and the food for them all. Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan to change the doors and windows. This loan will help her to have better living conditions and a comfortable environment. She is very grateful for the chance to finally complete these repairs and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To change the doors and windows

loans.name: Milena

texts.en: Milena lives in a minority community in a small apartment. She is a young, married, 20 year- old mother, who currently is a housewife and stays home taking care of her baby. Her husband works as a taxi driver but receives a very low income. At this time she needs of a washing machine and kitchen table for eating, as until now they have not had a place to sit and eat together and she has had to wash all of the laundry by hand. These basic necessities and comforts of living have not been able to be purchased due to her husband’s low salary. She is requesting the loan so that she can improve her living conditions and make life easier, especially now having a baby. She is very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchahe a washing machine and kitchen table for eating to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Borka

texts.en:
Borka is a married mother with a son and a daughter. Although her husband receives a pension, she is involved in agriculture business to add extra income to the family and help to provide for them. Currently she has 2 pigs and 3 goats and she also works on the land planting wheat and corn. 
Now, Borka is requesting a loan in order to purchase 10 baby pigs to raise and then to resell them. She wants to thank all of the lenders for the opportunity to achieve her goals. 
.

loans.use: To purchase 10 baby pigs to raise them for resale

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eugenia es comerciante en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de León, la señora inicia sus labores 6:00 am  con la preparación de la comida finalizando  a las 10:00 am posterior se traslada a su puesto de trabajo para su debida comercialización con este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.

La señora Maria Eugenia se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito  el cual implemento para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Bloques, Hierro, piedrín, entre otros; esto le permitirá mejorar su humilde vivienda mejorando sus condiciones de vida de ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is a merchant in one of the markets in the City of León. She starts work at 6 am preparing food and finishes at 10 am Monday to Saturday.

Maria Eugenia went to Ceprodel to request a loan which she will use to purchase construction materials such as blocks, iron, gravel, among others. This will allow her to improve her humble home, improving the living conditions of her children and herself.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, iron, and gravel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with medical expenses (purchase medicine).

loans.name: Narcisa Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa Isabel,  es madre de tres  hijos, labora en uno de los centro de asistencia médica de la ciudad de León, desde hace 8 años, inicia sus labores a las 6:45 am y las finaliza a las 3:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a viernes, ella ha realizado esta labor para la mantención del hogar.
 
Doña Narcisa, se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en gastos médicos como son: consulta, medicamento, exámenes especiales, lo cual le permitirá recuperar lo más ante posible su salud.
texts.en:
Narcisa Isabel is the mother of three children. She has worked in a medical clinic in the city of León for 8 years. She begins work at 6:45 am and finishes at 3:00 pm from Monday through Friday. She does this work so that she can support her family.

Narcisa came to Ceprodel to request a loan that she will use for medical expenses like an appointment, medication, and special examinations, which will allow her to re-gain her health as quickly as possible.

loans.use: medical expenses (appointment, medicine, special examinations)

loans.name: Suncica

texts.en: Suncica, 55, is currently working as a teacher in a high school in the minority community where she lives with her two children. As her husband has passed away, she has had to work hard to support her children as the sole provider for them. Now, her daughter is also a teacher and her son is still a student. Without having a second income or additional support, Suncica has not been able to complete her home and is requesting a loan to finish the façade of the house and complete the second floor. This loan will improve their living conditions. She could not do the work without the loan on her salary alone. She is grateful for the help

loans.use: To finish the façade of the house and complete the second floor

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri, age 40, lives with his entire family in a small village in Kosovo. He is the father of four children and lives in the same house with his wife and children, his parents, and his brother. All together there are 11 people in his home which is not enough space for them all. The family has two cows to feed the family milk and milk products and to sell locally.  

They also plant wheat to eat and his brother works in construction but earns a low salary. Sabri's family is in need of a loan to renovate the house and replace the doors and windows. Sabri hopes in the future to expand the farm and increase their income to improve the living conditions for everyone in the house. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate his house and replace the doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  purchase materials for her work

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.es:
Godofredo tiene 57 años de edad, estudió técnico en ingeniería industrial, está casado y su esposa se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa en el mercado de Jucuapa y tienen 3 hijas las cuales las tres están estudiando medicina en la universidad.

Godofredo trabaja desde hace 24 años en una institución de gobierno como agrónomo, desde que terminó sus estudios se ha dedicado a este oficio, y es la única actividad que realiza, él viaja en  bus y le queda a una distancia de 60 min en un horario de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá para arreglar unas escrituras de dos parcelas que con mucho esfuerzo ha comprado, y les servirá de mucho a sus hijas, el préstamo le servirá de mucho ya que ahora no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar dichos trámites.

Él desea para un futuro que cuando se jubile de su trabajo, pueda seguir ayudándole en el negocio que la esposa tiene ya que con todo sacrificio le dan los estudios universitarios a sus tres hijas.
texts.en:
Godofredo is 57 years old and studied to be an industrial engineering technician. He is married and his wife is a merchant. She sells clothing in the Jucuapa market and they have three children who are studying medicine at the university.

Godofredo has worked in a government institution as an agronomist for the past 24 years. He has worked her since he finished school and it is the only job that he has. He travels by bus for 60 minutes to get to work, and he works from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. 

He will invest the loan in resolving issues with the deeds to two properties that he was able to purchase after putting forth great effort. The loan will help him and his daughters greatly because they do not currently have enough capital to complete the requisite procedures.

His hope for the future when he retires from his job is that he can help support his wife at her business, since they have made great sacrifices to provide a college education to their daughters.

loans.use: to resolve issues with the deeds to two properties that he was able to purchase after putting forth great effort.

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en: Tanja wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan that she used to purchase clothing to sell in her business. She continues to be very happy with her success and profit and is again requesting a loan to purchase more clothing for the same business. With these loans she has been able to purchase a large variety of clothing for resale and make a good profit. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support before and again now.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of clothing to resell

loans.name: Rolando Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Francisco es docente en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de León, inicia sus labores a las 8:00 am y finalizándolas a las 8:00 pm con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, el realiza esta labor  para la mantención de su hogar.   

Don Rolando Francisco,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la compra de  electrodomésticos, este me permitirá mejor la calidad de vida de el al igual que su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando Francisco is a teacher at one of the high schools in the city of León. He begins work at 8:00 am and finishes at 8:00 pm from Monday through Friday. He works at this job so that he can support his family. 

Rolando Francisco came to Ceprodel to request a loan, which he will use to purchase home appliances. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver, 36, lives with his wife and their three children in a minority community in Kosovo. Although he is working in administration and his wife is a nurse, they are still living in bad conditions like most people in their community. After the war, the economy and financial situations for the minority communities and the people living there changed drastically. Oliver is in need of a loan to renovate the inside of his house and repair the flooring, which urgently needs to be completed to provide the family with a safe and healthy environment. The loan will help him to address this issue and improve their standard of living. He promises to pay on time and is grateful to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the inside of his house and repair the flooring

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en:
Biljana, at age 32, is married and lives with her husband in a minority community of Kosovo. Her husband works for an electric company while she is still a student taking classes. Together they are involved in agriculture in order to add more income and try to start saving for their future. They plant wheat and corn to sell locally, but are in need of a loan to dig a well for irrigation on the land. Once this is completed, Biljana would also start planting strawberries, which is something that she has always wanted to do. 

After hearing about Kosinvest, she thought it might be the opportunity that she has been waiting for to plant her strawberry fields. She hopes to save the money from this business to ensure a better financial situation for her family and is very grateful for the help.

loans.use: To dig a well for irrigation on the farm

loans.name: Jay-Ar

texts.en: During his high school years, Jay-ar experienced having to stop attending school because his mother could no longer cover his tuition fee. With that experience, Jay-ar now wants to make sure that he can finish his college or vocational course, thus he is asking for a loan of Php 40,000 from KIVA lenders thru ASKI to pay for his tuition fee. He is looking forward to having a diploma for he believes that through that, he can provide a comfortable life for his family. Jay-ar hopes that lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Margie is 29 years old and has three children who are in school.

Margie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Margie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and other gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Luciliza

texts.en:
Luciliza is from Pontevedra, Capiz, Philippines, one of the areas affected when typhoon Haiyan hit in November 2013. She and her family started to come back from the cyclone and her business is continuously recovering. She is married to John, a laborer, and they have children. They both manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Luciliza maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Luciliza hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand and she dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Milutin

texts.en:
Milutin is a married father of a 4-year-old son. He is employed in a clinic as a lab tech but the money he generates is not enough to provide for his family and save for their future or other needs. In order to add more income, Milutin has been involved in agricultural work, planting wheat and corn. 

He is now asking for a loan in order to purchase a tractor and tools to work on the land. This loan will help him to add more income and be able to finally save towards his son’s future. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor and tools to work on the land

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado en la escuela, no pudo continuar debido a que en aquellos tiempos la escuela estaba demasiado lejos y sus condiciones económicas no eran muy buenas, ha procreado 4 hijos los cuales tres de ellos están estudiando y el otro está pequeño y no tiene la edad para empezar la escuela, solo su esposa e hijos son quienes dependen de él.


Juan  y su familia tienen un molino desde hace 28 años, en el cual él trabaja, decidió poner este negocio porque él vive en una zona bastante poblada y vio la necesidad que tenían los habitantes, y ahora junto a su esposa realizan el trabajo, el horario de moler es en dos jornadas, una lo hace de 8:00 am a 11:00 am y la otra de 3:00 a 5:00 pm.

El préstamo que él está solicitando lo necesita para comprar unas fajas al molino que le hacen falta ya que se terminaron y también comprará 9 discos de molino, el préstamo le servirá de mucho ya que habrá un mejor funcionamiento de sus molinos y además mejor servicio a los clientes.

Su sueño a futuro es tener vida para poder seguir trabajando y seguir prestando los servicios a las personas.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old, and he went to school up to sixth grade. He was not able to continue because at that time the school was too far away, and his economic situation was not very good. He has four children, of whom three are in school, while the other one is still little and not yet of school age. Only his wife and children are dependent on him. 

Juan and his family have operated a mill for 28 years, and that is where he works. He decided to start this business because he lives in a densely populated area, and he saw the need for a mill among the inhabitants. Now he works there together with his wife. His schedule for milling is divided into two periods each day: from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. and from 3:00 to 5:00 p.m.

He needs the loan he is requesting to buy some belts for the mill, which are needed because the old ones are worn out. He will also buy 9 discs for the mill. The loan will be very helpful for him, since his mill will operate more effectively and he will be able to provide better service to his customers. 

His dream for the future is to have life to continue working and keep providing services to people.

loans.use: to buy replacement belts and 9 discs for the mill he operates.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and paint to renovate the house

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana de 52 años de edad, es madre de seis hijos, cinco de los cuales ya viven con sus propias familias y su ultimo niño de 10 años de edad quien estudia segundo grado en la escuela que esta en la comunidad, ella se casó a los 30 años de edad, pero su esposo la abandonó por lo que ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para sacara delante a sus hijos.
Los hijos mayores de Sebastiana siempre están pendientes de ella, Sebastiana se dedica a la venta de tamales desde joven y sus padres le enseñaron , también los fines de semana sale a vender pupusas en el campo de la comunidad y le ayuda una sobrina suya, antes ella se dedicaba a los diferentes trabajos como la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo).
Sebastiana solicita este crédito, para mejorar su vivienda, ya que donde vive se humedece en el invierno y su familia sufre problemas en los pies y enfermedades respiratorias por el polvo y las lluvias, por tal razón necesita el financiamiento para la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y otros materiales para ponerle ladrillo al piso de la vivienda.
Sus planes a futuro son ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda, quiere hacer una cocina aunque sea de bahareque pues cocina dentro de la vivienda y esto causa enfermedades respiratorias.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 52 years old and is a mother of six. Five of her children already live with their own families, and her youngest, who is ten years old and is in second grade, attends the local school. She was married at the age of thirty, but her husband left her, so she has had to work very hard in order to provide for her children.

Sebastiana's older children always check up on her. Sebastiana has worked selling tamales ever since she learned from her parents when she was young. On weekends, she also goes out to the local fields to sell pupusas with the help of her niece. She also used to work as a farmer, growing corn, beans, and sorghum. 

Sebastiana is requesting this loan to improve her home, because the house where she lives gets damp in the winter and her family suffers from feet problems and respiratory illnesses due to the dust and rain. That is why she needs financing to buy sand, bricks, cement, and other materials in order to lay bricks on the floor of her house.

Her plans for the future are to improve her house little by little. She wants to build a separate kitchen, even if it is a waddle and daub structure, because she is cooking inside the house and this causes respiratory illnesses.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, and other materials to pave her floor.

loans.name: Claudia Nohemy

texts.es: Claudia, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 3 años que ella decidió dedicarse al comercio para obtener ingresos para el hogar. Vende variedad de ropa como ser camisas, blusas, jeans, short, etc. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 25,000 lempiras,es el segundo ciclo y lo invertirá en la compra de variedad de ropa para vender. Su meta es llegar a tener un local propio para su negocio y del mismo poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is 25 years old, and she lives in a civil union with her husband with whom she has a son. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Three years ago, she decided to make a living through commerce to bring income into her home. She sells a variety of clothing that includes shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, etc. She goes from door to door selling clothing, and she fulfills requests as well. 

The loan that she is requesting is for 25,000 lempiras, it is the second cycle, and she will invest the money to purchase a variety of clothing to sell. Her goal is to have her own location for her business, and to be able to help her family through her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of women's, men's, and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Coka - Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Sauda is a mother of three schooling children who is in her late 50s. She is a divorced woman who supports her family by running three enterprises: a Cafe, a Grocery store and a Charcoal store. She conducts business from 11 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Sauda has business helpers. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 15th loan, which she will use to install electricity and buy an aluminum cupboard for her business needs. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy a freezer and connect electricity to her new living house. She is doing great and thankful to everyone who has supported her. Her businesses still need some improvement and she believe to grow more with Kiva. She used the profit to pay school fees and home food expenses. Sauda dreams of growing more her businesses. 

She will share this loan with her group "Coka-Kiwalani", which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to install electricity and buy an aluminum cupboard

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Salmini is in his early 20s and married. For six years now, he has been a fruit vendor selling various fruit (mango, avocado, orange, banana, pawpaw etc).  He sells from 11:30 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.
 
He is requesting his12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, Salmini grew his business capital by purchasing more fruits. He earned a profit, which he used to save for his future. He is doing great with his business and is thankful for the support. He will use this loan to buy business inventory to resell. Salmini dreams to be a successful businessman. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" Malumbo", which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mariana es una joven que esta estudiando y luchando por poder salir adelante, comenta que esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las demás personas. Su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder pagar sus clases de la universidad y también sus cuotas, que le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Marina is a young woman who is going to school and fighting for a way to get ahead. She says she is earning her degree in nursing because she always wanted to be able to help others. She used her previous loan to pay for classes at the university as well as fees, and it was of great help to her.

Today she is requesting a new loan to pay her fees so that she can stay in school. She is grateful for this new opportunity of continuing with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 53, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children.  She and her children are managing their household while operating the business. They all work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Eden dreams that her store will get bigger and hopes to help her children financially.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hongly Oun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Hongly, 24, has one child. Hongly and her husband are farmers who have been growing pineapple for four years. Her current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Hongly is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her pineapple healthily to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sympathique Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sympathique vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 36ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier de Missira. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, d’ustensiles et de restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  11éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Aissata (2éme  femme de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’article divers dans le quartier de Missira et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 colis d'habillements(vêtements pour enfants et femmes) et 3 colis d'ustensiles de cuisine (tels les éponges métalliques pour laver les marmites, les assiettes), chez les grossistes dans les marchés de Ségou et de Bamako  pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte dans le marché, à la maison et en ambulant.
 Madame Aissata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 55 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Sympathique group all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 36 years old and have three children each. They all live in the Missira neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through ties of neighborhood, kinship, marriage and also through their income-generating activities in the Missira neighborhood. They are involved in retail businesses and sell clothes, utensils and cooked food. In order to increase their businesses, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. This is their eleventh cycle of solidarity loan.

Aissata (second from the left in the photo) is an important seller of various items in Missira and the surrounding neighborhoods. In order to meet her customers' demand, she is planning to use her loan to buy 2 packages of apparels (clothing for children and women) and 3 packages of kitchen utensils (such as metal sponges for washing pots, plates) from suppliers at the Ségou and Bamako markets. She sells her merchandise at the market and from home and she also works as an itinerant seller. Her customers are men and women. They pay her in cash and also often on credit.

With this loan, Aissata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 55,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of some of her family's expenses and to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 packages of apparels (clothing for children and women) and 3 packages of kitchen utensils (such as metal sponges for washing pots, plates)

loans.name: Saray Kon's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Saray is 27 years old and married. She has one kid. 

She has been farming rice and growing sesame. Having been in this business for almost several  years, she currently can earn about 12,900 KHR per day. 

Saray has been with VisionFund for five cycles, and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun is aged 57 years and married with one child living in a rural village of Kompong Speur province’s Phnom Srouch district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice which they have been doing for ten years. The current business earns them about 13,200 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Oeun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wants to use her loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for chicken feed. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children.

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy women's shoes and boots for men. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00.

Francisca is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes and boots for men

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a sewing machine, and a generator.

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en:
A $ 800.00 loan to Erminia will help improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, soy sauce, soy sour, fish and water. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Erminia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, soy sauce, soy sour, fish and water.

loans.name: Tuendelee Group

texts.en:
Kulwa is in his late twenties and has got one daughter who is still young. He is single and supports his family by running a general store. He has been in this enterprise for three years now and is able to make a good profit each month. He starts from 6 am and works to 4 pm daily. 

Kulwa is requesting a second loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan (which was paid back successfully) to expand his shop with new products. He earned a profit which he used to plow back into his shop. Kulwa will use this loan to restock his shop with new inventory. He dreams of being a successfully businessman and an individual borrower. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" TUENDELEE" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock his shop with new inventory.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Dame  Massan  est  mariée  et mère  de  famille.  Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de friperie au marché. Son crédit sollicité à WAGES lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises afin d'agrandir son activité et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massan is married and a mother. Her business is retailing second-hand clothing at the market. 

Her loan requested from WAGES will be used to purchase more products to grow her business and guarantee her children an education.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mikossokpo

texts.fr: Mikossopko âgée de 24 ans demande un second  prêt de  300000FCFA  pour s’approvisionner. Revendeuse de céréales  depuis 2005, elle est  mariée sans enfants. Son Mari est un électricien. Ce prêt lui permettra de stocker assez de céréales pour desservir ses clients. Le principal objectif  de cette dernière est d’arriver à épauler son conjoint.
texts.en:
Mikossopko is 24 years old, and is requesting her second loan of 300,000 francs CFA, that she will use to purchase supplies.

A grain merchant since 2005, she is married without children. Her husband is an electrician. This loan will enable Mikossopko to store enough grain to serve her customers. Mikossopko's main objective is to support her partner as an equal.

loans.use: to purchase grain for resale.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar  owns and operates a retail business. He has been in the business for more than four years and earns good income to sustain the family. He was able to improve the business and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for additional inventory goods. He is now taking a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado en una escuela donde el residía, es padre de dos niños de 11 y 9 años de edad, quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposa trabaja en la venta de ropa y en diferentes trabajos domésticos.
Manuel trabaja con un tío en una carpintería, él puede hacer mesas, camas, roperos, sillas y otros artículos que sean de carpintería, además trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la zona y en la agricultura.
Su tío lo motivó a trabajar en la carpintería pues considera que obtiene buenos ingresos económicos, dependiendo de la demanda que tengan en el momento, trabaja todos los días días de la semana donde su tío, y también hace trabajos en el hogar a personas cercanas a la familia.
Manuel solicita este crédito para comprar herramientas para el trabajo en la carpintería, con ello Manuel contará con un equipo de trabajo propio y así poder emprender el negocio poco a poco.

Manuel sueña con tener un puesto propio donde trabajar, pues es reconocido en la zona por su buen trabajo en la carpintería, y desea seguir apoyando a sus pequeños niños en el estudio para que tengan una buena educación y logren tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old. He has a ninth grade education and has two children, who are ages eleven and nine and go to the local school. His wife works selling clothing and doing different housework. Manuel works with his uncle in a carpenter's shop. He knows how to build tables, beds, closets, chairs, and other woodwork items. He also works locally as a helper in construction and farming.

He was motivated to to work at the carpenter's shop by his uncle, because he considers he earns a good living depending on the demand of the moment. He works every day of the week with his uncle, and also does sidejobs at home for people close to the family.

Manuel is requesting this loan to buy tools for his woodworking. This way Manuel will have his own equipment for work and will be able to undertake the business little by little.

Manuel would love to have his own workshop because he is well known in the area for his good woodwork and he wants to continue supporting his little ones through school so that they get a good education and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy woodworking tools.

loans.name: Totahara Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline  fait partie du groupe Totahara  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 27 ans  et est mariée  à Firmin, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…)  depuis  3  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  élever ses enfants   et  les voir étudier.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Totahara Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 27 years old and married to Firmin, a civil servant.  Together they have two children.  She has been selling various products (rice, beans, salt, etc) for 3 years.  

This will be Jacqueline's first loan with the field partner, Turame.  She plans to use her loan to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of products (rice, beans, salt, etc) for sale in her shop.  In this way, she hopes to increase her earnings.

In the future, Jacqueline would like to raise her children and see them all study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of products (rice, beans, salt, etc) for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Saema Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
Saema Al- Waytat is a group that consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is the leader of the group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living with them in their own house. Their house is uncompleted and it needs to have renovation from the inside. Maryam is the leader of the group. She is an uneducated woman, but she is a very active and dynamic woman. Recently, she has become an employee in the private sector as a worker. From this job, she receives a very low salary. In reality, this salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Unfortunately, the house where she lives is uncompleted and needs to be renovated from the inside. Also, her husband is unable to do the renovation for the house. For this reason, Maryam applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement, paint, and paving to renovate the house from the inside.

Maryam looks forward to renovating her house from the inside. She plans to start her own business in order to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase cement, paint, and paving to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Chiengkonpang F Group

texts.en:
Tingzanieng and 14 other women residing in various rural areas around Churachandpur, Manipur in northeast state of India have come together to seek a loan to buy a solar home lighting system. Tingzanieng is the featured profile member pictured with her hand raised. Devoid of continuous access to grid-based power, the family depends on alternative lighting devices like kerosene lamps, candles, petromax, etc. to light the home for a significant period of time after dark every day. Tingzanieng is forced to divert a considerable share of their means towards the purchase of these alternative lighting sources as  they demand expensive fuel. Besides, the lamps are putting the health of the family members at risk as they emit lethal gases while burning kerosene. 

Since a solar lighting system is powered by the sun’s renewable energy; the system is energy neutral and an absolutely clean source of illumination. Therefore, Tingzanieng and the rest of the group members want to purchase solar lighting devices which are a cleaner alternative. However, these women cannot afford them as they entail finances out of their reach. So, they are looking for support in the form of a loan amounting to 182,595 INR to buy solar lighting devices each costing 12,173 INR. Your help will not only bring an end to their daily ordeal with the noxious fumes but also engender additional savings to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy a 40 watt mini solar home lighting system which will light up 4 light bulbs for 12 hours a day

loans.name: Yawa Caroline

texts.fr:
Caroline est une femme âgée de 46ans. Elle est divorcée avec deux enfants à charge de 17et 13ans. Revendeuse depuis 2000, elle mène son petit commerce de produits alimentaires à la maison ou elle dispose d'un stand d'exposition.  

Pour s’approvisionner de ses divers produits, Caroline demande un prêt  un prêt de 150000FCFA et sollicite l’apport financier de Kiva pour cette cause.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé .Caroline à toujours pris soin de ses enfants et souhaiterait toujours rester sur cette lancée. Elle travaille de durs labeurs pour ainsi augmenter les quantités de ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Caroline is 46 years old, divorced and responsible for two children, aged 17 and 13 years old.  She has worked as a trader since 2000, and sells food products from a stall in front of her house.  She buys her stock from the main market in Lomé.

Caroline has requested a loan of 150,000 francs CFA and seeks the finance of Kiva for this cause.  She plans to use this loan to buy stock of various food products.

Caroline has always looked after her children and she wants to continue to do this.  She works very hard to increase the stock levels of her stall.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 35-year-old married mother of five children. In 2011, Lina started her own business, opening in her house a corner for vending housewares with her exceptional selling methods and giving her customers a high quality of products. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain, in addition to the customer care she offers. Today, Randa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to increase her business merchandise, such as dishes, cups, tissues, Tupperware, etc., to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. Randa is very proud of her business growth, and she hopes to open her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 32 years old. She is a mother of four children, aged between 6 and 12 years. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer, during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase production. She wishes to invest profits from her farming work in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 33-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and five children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. Amina has been working in the agriculture sector, for the past five years, in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her business. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new merchandise, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her business

loans.name: Aholou

texts.fr: Âgé de 46  ans ,Aholou est propriétaire d’une boutique. Il y  revend des produits alimentaires. Toujours célibataire et  sans enfant, il habite dans la ville de Lomé. Aholou mène cette activité depuis 1an  et pour faire ses approvisionnements, il sollicite un apport financier de 300 000 F CFA .  Ainsi ce prêt lui permettra de s’acquérir  d’autres  produits alimentaires. Aholou a toujours rêvé d’avoir une boutique plus grande  et espère qu’avec les revenus qu’il se fait de son commerce il y arrivera. Aholou prévoit dans un avenir proche se poser avec une femme pour enfin jouir du bonheur d’être papa .
texts.en:
Aholou is 46 years old and owns a shop where he sells food products.  He is single, has no children and lives in the town of Lomé.  Aholou has been running his shop for a year and has requested a loan of 300,000 francs CFA in order to buy further stock.

Aholou has always dreamed of owning a larger shop and hopes that he will achieve this with the profits he will make from his business.

In the near future, Aholou expects to set up home with a woman and enjoy the happiness of becoming a father.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Rahaf 22 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rahaf 22. It comprises four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB.

Ilfat is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She studied until elementary education, but she couldn't complete her study. 

Ilfat is a talented and respected professional woman. She has a great determination and doesn't surrender easily to her obstacles and problems. As a result, she started her own business selling groceries and goods in a small shop in her area. As the source of income for her family, Ilft has sold groceries and food products for one year. She started this business with a small amount of capital. 

Thanks to Ilfat’s hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed her to expand her sales volume. For the purpose of further developing her business, Ilfat turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER to buy more goods and items for the grocery in order to face all the demands of her customers.

Ilfat plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase her business. She also intends to expand her business through opening other branches besides the first one.

loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery in order to face all the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools and build a new welding workshop.

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Soksan lives in Roveang district of Preah Vihea province. She is now 24 years old, married and has a 3-year-old son. In order to support the family, she and her husband have been farming their rice paddy. This business help them earn 15,000KHR in average per day. 

Soksan has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helped her improve her family's living situation. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business, and cover food and healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a father of three. He is 40 years old. He is a student at University of Rwanda, in the College of Education. He is a very dedicated gentleman, with an aim to pay this loan at his master’s level. He wishes to teach at University, and to deliver the knowledge he got from his studies to impact many students, as well as the country.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees at his college

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon lives in Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is 61 years old, married and has four dependent members in her family. This family depends mainly on their rice field for a living. Sinuon and her husband have been farming the rice field for 23 years. They earn 13,800 riels (KHR) on average per day.

Sinuon has completed one loan with VisionFund already. The previous loan helped her family improve their standard of living. She is now requesting a second loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and pay for the family's food and health care.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Red Rose Group

texts.en:
Maria is a business woman who is married and she has two school-aged children. She is in her early forties and supports her family with a tailoring business. She has been in this business for eight years now and is able to make a very good profit each month. Maria works at this business from 8 am to 6 pm daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her eighteenth loan request which she will use to buy clothes-making materials. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought more in demand materials for her business and she used part for her personal development. Maria earned a profit which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothes-making materials. She dreams of managing a tailoring firm.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group "Red Rose" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro es una persona muy trabajadora, desde pequeño se dedica a las actividedes del Campo, junto a su esposa quien se dedica a la Venta de Ropa Usada han salido adelante y garantizan los gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos mayores son independientes y el menor de 9 año despues de sus estudios aprovecha para ir aprendiendo el manejo del Campo.  Don Leandro tiene la necesidad de comprar alambre de puas, grapas, postes para reparar las cercas de su propiedad y comprar insumos como fertilizantes, herbicidas para garantizar una buena cosecha de Maiz, para ello solicita credito, ya que no cuenta con el recurso economico suficiente de la producción agrícola y la venta de leche que son su potencial fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Leandro is a very hard-working person. Since he was small, he has dedicated himself to farm work. Together with his wife, who works selling used clothing, they have been able to make progress in life and ensure that their household expenses are covered. His two older children are already independent, and the youngest, who is 9 years old, is taking advantage of the opportunity to learn how to manage the farm after his schoolwork is done. Leandro needs to buy barbed wire, staples and posts to repair the fences on his property, and he also needs to buy supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides to ensure a good corn harvest. For this reason he is requesting the loan, because he does not have sufficient economic resources from his agricultural production and milk sales, which are his potential sources of income.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire and supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr:
Akpédze exploite une boutique .Agée de 34ans, elle vend des pagnes et fait des petits commerce de divers à côté. Elle a commencé son activité en 2000.
 
 Toujours célibataire, elle vit avec son enfant  dans la ville de Lomé.Elle  sollicite ainsi ce quatrième prêt pour augmenter son stock de marchandise. Elle ne rencontre aucune difficulté dans son commerce. 
Avec ses bénéfices, elle prendra  soin de son entreprise. Elle a l’intention d’ouvrir une succursale pour augmenter son bénéfice.
texts.en:
Akpédze is 34 years old. She works in a shop selling pagnes [brightly-printed West African clothing] and other diverse things.  She started this business in 2000. Single, she lives with her child in Lomé. 

Akpédze is seeking her fourth loan to increase her stock. She does not have difficulty conducting this business. 

With her earnings, she will take care of her business. One day she'd like to open another branch in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing), fabric, and hosiery

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab is a 39-year-old Lebanese married woman of four children who has been working in the agriculture sector for two years to help her family to meet their needs of life. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work with the aim to develop it. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new agriculture inputs for her business to increase the productivity and enhance her income. Rihab insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able to develop always her business.

loans.use: to buy new agriculture inputs for her business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman of three children who has been operating a Bookshop since 2009. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to feel her independence. She cooperates with her husband to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, Fatmeh is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase merchandise for her Bookshop in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her Bookshop

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her parents. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. She started her own job at an early age. She opened a beauty salon seven years ago. She has her loyal customers, and is happy with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase goods for her Beauty Salon such as a mirror and chair for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her Beauty Salon

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old, married, and a resident of San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through vegetable gardening.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for vegetable gardening.

Elsie deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing of PMPC.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for vegetable gardening.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Jolito, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marilou operates a food stall. She sells snacks like fruits, juices, and other street food staples that she sells in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy fruits, eggs, juices and other street foods needed in her business.

Marilou hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits, eggs, juices and other street foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Melogina

texts.en:
Melogina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melogina is 53 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Melogina has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. Melogina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment and tools for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melogina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Melogina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials  for her fishing business.

Lucinda has been in this business for 13 years. Lucinda earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Verdiane

texts.en: Verdiane is aged 52. She is married and has one child, aged 26. Verdiane sells bananas and has spent five years in this business. She has requested a loan to buy more bananas for resale. She will use the profits from her business to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 39 years old. He has two children who both go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy more fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, Vedaste wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machinery and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Ma Biri Group

texts.fr:
Mme FANTA représente le groupe  MA BIRI. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgée a 12ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme est tisseuse depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter ½ balle de fils pour tisser les pagnes, ½ kg de teinture noir, ½ kg de teinture bleu etc pour teindre les fils qui servirons à tisser pagnes.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un centre de tissage.
texts.en: Fanta represents the Ma Biri Group. She is a 33-year-old married mother to three children, with the eldest being 12 years old and the youngest eight years old. Two of her children attend school. Fanta has worked as a weaver for two years and gets her supplies from the local market. She plans on purchasing half a ball of yarn for weaving cloths, ½ kg of black dye, ½ kg of blue dye which will help her with her woven cloths.. With the profits from her work, she wants to increase her savings. It is Fanta's dream to one day open her own weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase half a ball of yarn for weaving cloths, ½ kg of black dye, ½ kg of blue dye

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: A citizen located in the Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Rong is forty-three years old and the mother of two kids, one of whom is in school. To support the family, she is growing rice and running a selling snacks. This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has been running these businesses for ages. Her previous loan, which she completely repaid, enabled her to buy household supplies and support her kid in school. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy a decent motorbike to support her snack selling. In future she hopes to expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to support her selling business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 27 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province. She has two children. Farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current business, she can earn approximately 44,200 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Chan through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rapalo Group

texts.es: Rosalina, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive con una hija en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula. Rosalina lleva 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad ha sido su fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras, en forma grupal con el fin de limpiar, abonar el terreno para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y poder sacar mejor producción y ganancias. El grupo se llama Rápalo, que lo integran tres personas, dedicadas a la agricultura y que viven en la misma zona. El monto de préstamo grupal es por 19,000 Lempiras que lo utilizaran para preparación de terreno donde sembrar granos básicos. En la foto esta Rosalina a la izquierda, luego esta Lesly y Kenia a la derecha.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 48 year old single mother of three. She lives with a daughter in small neighborhood in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. Rosalina has made a living for 20 years cultivating and farming corn and beans. This field of work has been the source of income to support her family. She has decided to request a loan of 5,000 Lempiras (HNL) in group form, in order to clean and fertilize the land for the cultivation of corn and beans to produce bigger yields and profits. 

The group called Rápalo, is made up of three people, who work in agriculture and live in the same area. The total group loan is for 19,000 Lempiras (HNL) that will be used for the preparation of the land where basic grains are sowed. In the photo: Rosalina is on the left, Lesly in the center, and Kenia on the right.

loans.use: To clean and fertilize the land for the cultivation of corn and beans.

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 54 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer  grado, está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, es con quien ha compartido toda su vida. Todos sus hijos viven aparte, ya solo quedos él y su esposa en casa. Nadie más vive con ellos.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 50 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura,  Carlos ha sido un hombre responsable, ha criado a sus 4 hijos sin abandonarlos, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, también en la compra de los insumos para los cultivos, con el préstamo pagará personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, ya que el solo le cuesta, pero la costumbre del trabajo lo tiene siempre ocupado. 

Sueña con poder tener primero lo más necesario para sobrevivir, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad el poder comprar los insumos que necesita.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old. He studied until the third grade. He is married and his partner, with whom he has shared his whole life, takes care of domestic tasks in the home.   All of their children live on their own and he and his wife are alone in their house. No one else lives with them.  

He is a farmer and he has spent more than 50 years engaged in this productive activity.  It was his father, who, through correcting him, made him the decent person he is in society.  It is due to the type of endeavors carried out in the area that he has engaged only in farming. Carlos has been a responsible man. He has raised his four children without abandoning them. His work is carried out near his house. He travels on food and no-one else works with him. His work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 11 a.m.
