He will invest the loan in preparing the land for cultivation and also in the purchase of supplies for his crops.  In addition he will pay people to help him with the work since he alone is responsible and the work always keeps him busy.

He dreams of being able to have first what is most necessary to survive. Therefore he hopes to always work as long as God grants him health and life. The loan will help him satisfy the need to purchase the supplies he needs.

loans.use: to prepare the land for cultivation and also to purchase supplies for his crops and pay people to help him with the work.

loans.name: Bet Al- Matari Group

texts.en:
Bet Al- Matari is a group comprised of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 6 children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest one is 15 years old. She lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is a vigorous and dynamic woman. Recently, she worked as a cleaner in the private sector. Fatima's house lacks many home appliances, and she can't afford these things. She needs an oven in order to make good breads, cakes, and other delicious food. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to purchase an oven to prepare that delicious bread. If she wants to prepare any bread or cake, she goes to her neighbors in order to use their ovens. Most of the time, Fatima feels ashamed of this. For this reason, Fatima is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new oven to prepare the delicious breads and cakes.

Fatima looks forward to building the second floor and renovating it in order to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven to prepare delicious bread and cake.

loans.name: Chiengkonpang H Group

texts.en:
Choinu is a caring and loving mother who thrives to give her children the best facility within her capacity. She lives with her three children and husband in Churachandpur, Manipur in the northeastern region of India. Choinu is the featured profile member of the Chiengkonpang (H) group, pictured with her hand raised. She is a teacher in a government run school in Churachandpur. As the electricity rates are going up now, the use of Solar is getting more  popular than conventional electricity. Solar is easy to maintain using sunlight to charge it and using it is so simple, resourceful and good to go.

Therefore, Choinu and her group want to avail a loan for a solar home lighting system for the household and for their children to have a better study environment. As the power supply is irregular and there is frequent load shedding in the town, studying in low light can have a bad impact on the children’s eyes. Hence, a 40-watt mini solar home lighting system, which will light up 4 light bulbs for 12 hours a day and has a 90-meter wire, can be installed in any four adjacent rooms or at the users own convenience. Choinu believes that as the lighting products are bright, it can provide a conducive to reading and studying for a longer period of hours. Likewise, the rest of her group members need solar home lighting for their respective income-generating activities and home use.

loans.use: To buy a 40-watt mini solar home lighting system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Norbin

texts.en:
Norbin is an enterprising woman of the country. She is dedicated to her husband and her children. She works daily in her field of pig raising to earn sustenance for her family and be able to guarantee a good future. She works in the labor of producing and raising pigs, work that she learned alongside her father.

She alternates this work with a job in farming that she has during the day with her husband to obtain more income. She wishes to expand her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy some piglets and feeds and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of dried fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to pay for dried fish she needs in her business. The more dried fish displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hilda dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
This is Noel, 39, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Single, he manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Noel operates a piggery. He earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes he has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, he also owns a commercial crab farming business and operates his own tricycle unit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 5,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands.

Noel hopes that he will have more pigs and crabs to raise for his business, and he desires to save for a house and a lot. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in his business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angela dreams that her stall will be bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting another Php15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nelly dreams of a bigger place for her business and a new house for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  She also can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane works hard to support her family. Jane is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net. Jane has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Ladislao estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó muy joven y tiene dos  hijos con su pareja, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, sus dos hijos viven con él y trabajan en un taller de mecánica.

Él es agricultor, tiene más de veinte años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseñó la actividad, también tiene un camión de carga, el cual le genera ingresos ya que trabaja con una ferretería, cuando alguien lo busca que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad y el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar llantas para el camión, con el que trabaja casi toda la época de invierno, con el préstamo el podrá comprar las llantas y así continuar trabajando. 

Su sueño más deseado es poder seguir trabajando, siempre que su estado de salud se lo permita, espera que sus hijos al igual que él sean personas de bien. Con las ganancias que la actividad le produzca, un porcentaje será para el pago de la cuota del préstamo y lo demás en inversión en su casa.
texts.en:
Ladislo went to school through the sixth grade.  He got married very young, and he and his life partner have two children.  His wife is a housewife.  She is in charge of the household chores.  Their two children live with him and work in a mechanic’s shop.

He is a farmer.  He has been doing this business activity for over 20 years.  When he was little his father taught him this business activity.  He also has a cargo truck, which generates income for him because he works with a hardware business.  When someone looks for him so that he will help them work, he also does that.  The distance that he travels varies because he does not always go to the same place.  

When he gets the harvest, he sells part of it.  The rest is for their consumption.  No one else is involved in his business activity.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.

He needs the loan to buy tires for the truck.  He works with it almost all of the winter season.  With the loan he will be able to buy the tires.  This way he will continue working.

His most fervent dream is to be able to continue working as long as his health permits.  He hopes that his children turn out to be good people.  A percentage of the profits from his production will be used to make his loan payments.  The rest he will invest in his house.

loans.use: to buy tires for the truck that he works with.

loans.name: Virgjinushe

texts.en:
Virgjinushe, who was born deaf and mute and releases only a few sounds and nothing else, is a widowed mother of two. She wants to stock up on inventory items for her little village grocery store that she has been running herself for the last few years. In addition to it, she has been doing agriculture/arboriculture planting/harvesting and selling mostly wheat, beans, fodder, peppers and tomatoes and looking after grapevines.

The village where Virgjinushe lives is situated in a field area and built just on the site of the national road Tirana-Korca. It has a very cold climate during wintertime and is cool in the summer. The agriculture/arboriculture is very developed here with plums, apples and grapevines as the most preferred orchards and wheat, corn, beans, fodder and potatoes being planted by most of the households; cows and sheep are the animals that each family has.

loans.use: who was born deaf and mute, to stock up on inventory items for her little village grocery store.

loans.name: Srey Toch

texts.en:
Srey Toch lives in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She is 32 years old and married. Her livelihood depends mainly on working the rice field. She earns 33,000 KHR on average per day.

Srey Toch has completed 3 loans with VisionFund already. The previous loans had a very good impact on her life. She is now requesting a fourth loan from VisionFund. The money will be used to cover the expense on her rice paddy field such as fertilizer and seed purchasing. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: K.salbung Group

texts.en:
This is the K.Salbung group of 12 tribal women created in the spring and summer. They all live in a small village on the outskirts of Churachandpur in Manipur State, which is in the northeastern part of India. They came together as a group to take a loan to create income activities for themselves and for the family. Nengkhovah is the group leader pictured with her hand raised. She is 46 years old and is the mother of two daughters and one son. She lives with five members as a family. Her husband's main line of income is construction work. However, his source of income is unreliable because he works on a temporary basis only when there is a requirement. Therefore, in order to supplement the family's income, Nengkhovah usually weaves traditional garments but could not produce much due to limited capital at her disposal. She initiated and formed the group to fulfill the capital needs for her weaving income activities. She started weaving four days a week and was able to produce six traditional wrap-around skirts of different quality and four shawls in a month and a week’s time. With the profits, she was able to buy yarn to continue weaving and with the little savings she has made from her profits, she managed to support her children's education better. She was able to pay the children's school fees on time. She is happy that her children could continue their studies. The oldest son is in secondary and the younger daughters are in high school. She is very happy with all the support that she gets from her husband as well as her children. Her children did well by bringing home their friends to buy the traditional garments that their mother weaves. In this way, people know where to buy when they need one. Now, she needs a loan to buy solar home lighting to continue with her weaving business and to increase her productivity. She needed a solar home lighting system because after sunset, she could not continue weaving due to irregular electric supply in the village.

Therefore, with the assistance of a Kiva loan, she wanted to buy a solar home lighting system for her family and to weave longer hours at night. Since this solar home lighting comes with 45 watts, which can light four bulbs for 12 hrs a day. she will be able to make more income than usual and will help her manage to save. She takes pride in her job and is satisfied because she can also take care of her household chores and manage the family affairs. 

The rest of the group members also need a solar loan for their respective activities and for their children’s study purpose. The group members' activities can be classified as weaving, tailoring and grocery store.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system

loans.name: Flamboyan I Group

texts.en:
Flamboyan I group successfully completed their second cycle with a loan from Kiva and the group is running smoothly and well. Their efforts are going increasingly well and they can thrive, so their lives are growing. The loan from Kiva was very useful for the welfare of every member of the family. They are taking a loan for the same type of businesses in the second cycle such as traditional foods including egg rolls, arem - arem, pastel wet, Cucur, Gethuk lindri, branches Gesing, and nagasari. There is also a business selling clothes. 

The loans in the third cycle will be used to increase the types of businesses and purchase better tools so the production rate will be faster and they can produce more. In the third cycle, there is a change in the leadership. Titi's mother was replaced by a woman named Sawinah. With this succession, they expect to be more vibrant again in the businesses in order to run smoothly and repay the loan. Sawinah has a small food business selling arem - arem and cucur. The benefits of this loan from Kiva , very mean to her life with her husband and to 5 children. Sawinah hopes cycle three will run smoothly and its members will grow even more.  With the loan this time, she will buy equipment for the production of cakes and expand the types of her cake. Sawinah because it will increase the types of cake, then Sawinah want to purchase tools for the production of her new cake.

loans.use: to buy equipment to produce cakes

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à OUOROFOURA un village dans la commune de DOGONI  dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  FATOUMATA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JIGUISSEME 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Jiguisseme 1 group are married women who, on average, are 49 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Ouorofoura, a village in the Dogoni commune, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Fatoumata, seated second from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts. With this loan, she plans to buy a 50-kilogram sac of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a half hectare field.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and at a Sikasso market to male and female customers for cash and credit. Fatoumata hopes to earn an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back a part of the loan and its interest as well as help her husband support their family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and farm inputs, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah City. He lives alone in a very simple house in the city. For the past year, Shareef has been working in a bicycle repair workshop he owns. It is a good business and the demand is high because of the high bicycle use in his area. 

Shareef ordered a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more repair parts for his workshop. By taking this loan, Shareef will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

Shareef appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his workshop

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yeredon est composé de 3 femmes monogames et 3 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban-Plateau chef-lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, restaurant, charbon du bois et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs  de riz, 3 sacs de maïs, et 4 sacs de mil en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-Plateau à une clientèle mixte. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group called Yeredon is made up of three monogamous women and three polygamous. They have an average age of 34 and on average, four children. They all live in the village of  Kalaban-Plateau, county seat of the circle of Kati (second administrative region of Mali) and they met each other through ties of community. 

The members of the group have small-scale businesses such as a restaurant, selling charcoal, and selling condiments. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with  Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan. 

Madame Fatoumata (the woman seated in the middle of the photo) has a great reputation for selling cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy three sacks of rice, three sacks of maize, and four sacks of millet at wholesale prices in the Grand Market. Her sales are made retail, in  Kalaban-Plateau, to a mixed clientele.  Madame Fatoumata  hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in the activity. Her goal is to buy a residential plot of land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 30-year-old single woman from Rafah. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her brother works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. Khetam works in her own business, which is a farm for raising sheep. She sells their milk and meat to the local traders. This project has been operating for the past three years. 

Khetam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her farm. by taking this loan, Khetam will be able to increase her productivity and improve her business. 

Khetam appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Hilen

texts.en:
Hilen is a 21-year-old single lady from a small village near Nabluc city. She lives with her parents in a simple house. Her brother is a worker in a local firm; he gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Hilen is a student in a local university where she studies science. Hilen would like to obtain a BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family with part of the family expenses.
 
Hilen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Hilen will be able to complete her study. 

Hilen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les dix membres du groupe Kototala ont en moyenne 39 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Badialan III. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), ustensiles plastiques et produits cosmétiques. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Kadiatou (femme  debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 corbeilles tomates  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au Badialan III en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married [and living] in monogamous households, the 10 members of Kototala Group are, on average, 39 years old with two children. They all live in Badialan III, a neighborhood of Bamako, and met one another through neighborhood ties and through their businesses at Badialan III's market.

The group members run small businesses selling vegetables (tomatoes), plasticware, and cosmetics. With the intention of growing their businesses, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman standing at far left in the photo) is a great tomato saleswoman. She plans to use her loan to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes wholesale in Bamako. She [will] resell them door-to-door at retail prices in Badialan III, to primarily women customers. Mrs. Kadiatou expects an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs from this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and meet small household needs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana Coura, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de gâteau, de baigne et d’encens.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente FATOUMATA, 2 eme personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet de haricot. Elle compte achète quelques bidons d’huile et 3 sacs de haricot sur place avec les grossistes à Fana. Le haricot est mis en poudre avant d'être transformé en beignet. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché journalier de Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme Group is made up of married women with an average age of 45 and and an average of five children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the town of Fana, in Fana Coura District, in the commune of Gyégnéka, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They work in the restaurant business, as well as in the commerce of condiments, cakes, fritters and incense. 

This will be the second loan for the women of the Djiguisseme Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Fatoumata, the second woman from the right, did not receive an education. She currently sells bean fritters. She plans on buying cooking oil and three sacks of beans from the wholesalers at Fana. She will then grind the beans into a powder in order to make been fritters. She sells her produce for cash at the daily market in Fana to a mixed customer base. She sees herself making an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: the buy beans and oil to make fritters

loans.name: Patience Akou

texts.fr: Patience  est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires .Mariée à un assureur,  elle est âgée de 49 ans. Mère de deux enfants qui font sa plus grande joie, Patience vend depuis des années . Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Patience   sollicite pour une sixième  fois un crédit de 400 000 F CF A auprès de WAGES .Elle  va s’approvisionner avec le montant reçu. Patience a pour habitude de réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son commerce .Son rêve serait d’arriver à atteindre le seuil d' un grossiste. Elle compte sur les bienfaits des crédits qui lui sont accordés pour  accroitre sa capacité d’autofinancement. Cela lui permettra par la même occasion de subvenir aux études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Patience sells food products. She is 49 years old and married to an insurance salesman. Mother to two children, who are the source of her greatest joy, Patience has been selling her products for many years. 

In order to satisfy customer demand, Patience is requesting a sixth loan of 400,000 CFA francs from WAGES. She will use the money to purchase supplies. 

Patience usually reinvests her spare revenue in her business. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and she is counting on the additional revenue gained through the loans to increase her self-financing capacity. The loans will also enable her to contribute to her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousseynou est un promoteur qui évolue dans le blanchisserie traditionnelle. Il a une expérience de plus de 5ans  dans cet activité. Marié et père de famille, il gère les charges familiales et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 500.000F pour acheter des friperies comme les pantalons, les chemises, etc.. les laver, les repasser et ensuite les revendre à ses clients potentiels. Il quitte sa maison vers les coûts de 8 h pour n'y revenir que le soir à partir de 22H. A l'avenir, il souhaite voyager en Turquie ou Dubaï pour acheter des habits neufs afin de diversifier son activité et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousseynou is a businessman who runs a traditional laundry service. He has over 5 years of experience in this line of work. Married with children, he handles the household expenses and the children’s tuition fees. 

He is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy second-hand clothing such as trousers, shirts, etc. which he will wash and press, and then offer for sale to potential customers. He leaves his house by 8 AM and only returns after 10 PM at night.

His goal for the future is to travel to Turkey or Dubaï to purchase new apparel, which would help him to diversify his activity and bolster his revenue.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to launder and sell.

loans.name: Odjoti

texts.fr:
Femme veuve âgée de 52ans, Odjoti  est mère de trois enfants. Revendeuse, elle demande un second  prêt de  600000FCFA  pour s’approvisionner. Elle vend des pagnes et de la quincaillerie    depuis 1990, ce commerce est pour elle son seul revenu  pour prendre soin de ses enfants.
Agrandir son activité serait ce qu’elle envisagerai  le plus pour un avenir proche et comme perspective d’avenir pour sa famille, Odjoti souhaiterait avoir des moyens disponibles pour l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Odjoti is 52 years old, widowed and mother to three children.  She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and hardware products since 1990, and this is her only source of income.  This will be her second loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy more stock.  She has requested a loan of 600,000 francs CFA.

In the immediate future, Odjoti would like to expand her business.  In the longer term, she would like to be able to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and hardware products for resale.

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Lucy is a mother of six children (three sons and three daughters), one is in school and the others are grown. She is sixty years old and is a widow. She supports her family's living by managing three microbusiness. She bakes cake for different functions, sells batiki and sells eggs for ten years now. Lucy is a hard-working mother and despite being a widow, she is struggling everyday to give her child and grandchild a better education. She runs her enterprise from 8 am to 6 pm each work day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Lucy's eighth loan request which she will use to pay for batiki amounts required as a group to get them at a low price. With her previous loans all of which were paid back successfully, she restocked on cake-baking ingredients, purchased more eggs and batiki. She received a business profit which she used to buy a plot and covered the school fees and home food expenses. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and build.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group "USALAMA" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for batiki amounts required for the group to get them at a low price.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is 43 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two school-aged children. Rodrigo has been engaged in hog raising activity for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month from this type of work. At present he is also working as a security guard in one of the institutions in his town. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two more piglets for his existing business. Rodrigo has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to expand his hog raising business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing two more piglets for his business

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo  owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. He has been in his business for more than eight years and earns a good amount. Danilo successfully repaid his previous loan used to buy tires. Recently, he took a new loan to buy motor accessories and pay repair costs. In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy motor accessories and pay repair costs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio  is from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboaga del Sur. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a banana raising business. For more than three years, he was able to sustain and earn good income for the family. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for farming. But his income was good enough for repayment and household expenditure. With this, he need to ask another loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs for weeding maintenance.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for weeding maintenance

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is a  single entrepreneur who owned and operated a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Aside from this, he also earned  salary from employment.

He had successfully repaid his previous loan, used for buying spare parts and motor maintenance. He has had a good return from his investment. 

Recently he took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit  to purchase new set of tires. 

In the future he wants to save his revenue for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase new set of tires

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a 59-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.  Lilia has been making savings for many days to be used to cultivate and expand her garden, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. Now she wants to buy new seeds and organic fertilizer so she can replant her garden, but she does not have enough money for it. Therefore, Lilia has requested a loan which, with the contribution of her savings, will allow her to buy new seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his Jeepney. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Romeo dreams for his children to finish their studies and still hopes to get another Jeepney unit. He meets up with his fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines fight off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfiinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya. She is fifty-nine and a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She manages their household while operating the business all by herself. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ligaya operates a food stall where she sells barbecue. She also has a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ingredients of barbecue and products for her variety store.

Ligaya dreams to expand her business and add more food like arroz caldo in her food stall. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients of barbecue and products for her variety store.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jennylyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly.

In the future, Jennylyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 47 years old and single. 

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lea has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Lea would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper cubes, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 24 years old. He lives with his family in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Mohammad has been looking for a way to depend on himself financially. For that, he started his own project selling home products at his small store five months ago. Now, he is planning to increase the quantity of products he sells, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products to resell

loans.name: Merlin Edgardo

texts.es: Merlin, tiene 43 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. El siempre ha generado ingresos realizando trabajos asalariados, pero ha necesitado obtener más ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos y hace tres años estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería para vender granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, papel higiénico, jabón, condimentos, cebolla etc. Lleva 4 ciclos invirtiendo en su negocio, el préstamo actual es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, refrescos, jabón y otros para surtir su negocio y vender. Su plan es crecer como un microempresario y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Merlin, 43, is single and has 2 children that he lives with in the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Barbara.  He has always generated income by doing salaried work, but he needed to earn more to help his children, so three years ago he started up his own grocery store business.  In his store, he sells consumer staples, sugar, butter, beverages, toilet paper, soap, condiments, onions, etc.  

Merlin has gone through 4 loan cycles investing in his business.  This loan is for 10,000 Honduran lempiras, and he will use it to buy products such as butter, rice, beans, sugar, bread, beverages, soap, and other items to stock his store. His plan is to grow as a businessman and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery store

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Don Inés, tiene 63 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 9 años el decidió generar sus propios ingresos y esta vendiendo ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas para damas y caballeros y sandalias. Esta mercadería la vende por pedidos y entrega a domicilio. El préstamo es por 21,000 lempiras y ya es el sexto ciclo, con el cual va surtir de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas y otros para aumentar las ventas. El espera mantener siempre el negocio que le genere sus ingresos.
texts.en: Inés is a single 63-year-old man with two children. He lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Nine years ago he decided to start making his own money, and he now sells clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses and sandals for men and women. He sells this merchandise on order and delivers to his customers' homes. This is his sixth loan, and it is in the amount of 21,000 lempiras. He will use the funds to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts and blouses so that he can increase his sales. He hopes that he always will be able to maintain his business from which he earns his income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts and blouses in order to increase his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, wood, sand, cement and stones to finish his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Ishraq

texts.en:
Ishraq is a 20-year-old married lady from a small village near Nabluc city. Her husband is a worker in a local firm; he gets a very low income which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs. Ishraq is a student in a local university where she studies Pharmaceutical science. Ishraq would like to obtain the BA degree and find a job in the future to help her husband in part of the family expenses. 

Ishraq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ishraq will be able to complete her study. 

Ishraq appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia finds pleasure in earning an income through her retailing business. She sells a variety of items from plastic-wares to dry goods and kitchen utensils. She is 69 years old and married. She busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledged member of PMPC. She credits her capital to the cooperative in supporting her retail business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase housing materials. She had her house for renovation. Lucia deeply wishes to live a comfortable life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 39 years old and lives in Estrella Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married and has four children.

To earn a living, Liza has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month, doing this work. Liza has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients for her snack-vending business, and partly to restock the store with basic commodities.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Liza would like to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her snack-vending business, and to restock the store with basic commodities

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one son and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's expenses. One year ago, Mohammad decided to start working in another business to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. So he started working in transferring goods using his rickshaw. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead using the rental one. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his business and increase his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo beside his rickshaw,

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of using the rental one.

loans.name: Cira Dories

texts.es: Cira. es una mujer trabajadora, soltera con una hija de 17 años, desde hace tiempo imparte el pan de la enseñanza en una escuela pública, de donde mantiene el sustento de su hogar, siendo ella el único soporte económico familiar.  En la actualidad necesita realizar un anexo que le servirá como cuarto, para lo cual solicita crédito que utilizaría para la compra de materiales de construcción como Cemento, Bloques, Hierro y Clavos.  Con esto dará mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Cira, a hardworking woman, is single with a 17-year-old daughter. For some time now, she has been earning a living as a teacher in a public school, and this is how she supports her home; she is her family’s sole means of economic support. 

Currently, she needs to build an addition that will serve as a room for her, so she is requesting a loan; she will use it to purchase construction materials such as cement, block, iron, and nails. With this, she will make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother for four kids: two sons and two daughters. Nuha and her husband have been working on their farm where they plant tomatoes using greenhouses. It is a very good business and the income is high. 

Nuha would like to improve her business and expand the farm, so she ordered a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more tomato seedlings for her farm. By taking this loan, Nuha will be able to increase her productivity and also her income.
 
Nuha appears in the photo in her farm.

loans.use: to buy more tomato seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Serlina

texts.en:
Serlina is 51 years old and lives in Olave, Enriquie Villanueva, Siquijor. She sells variety of goods, in order to help the family. Aside from selling rice cakes, she also operates a sari-sari store. 

In 2012, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 7,000  to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks for her store. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2011. He appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. He is a member in good standing and actively attends the various programs that the cooperative offers.

Roland has an existing business selling variety of items. Roland wants to venture into piggery business for another source of income.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional feed and piglets. Roland dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and to earn an adequate income from his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is 45 years old and married with four children.

Amorlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Amorlina has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Amorlina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like shampoo, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 73 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela ya que antes eran escasas en el lugar donde él vivía, pero puso un esfuerzo y fue así como aprovecho un programa de alfabetización que hubo en la comunidad, con todos los sacrificios que le tocaba hacer, ya que primero tenía que ir al campo a trabajar y después al curso de alfabetización y aprendió a leer, tiene 3  hijos, solo una hija viven con él, los otros dos viven  en caseríos vecinos, también en la casa vive una nieta de dos años de edad.

Él es agricultor, tiene más de 60 años de realizar la actividad, su padre fue el que se encargó de que aprendiera a ser un hombre de bien, también se dedica a la albañilería y aprendió observado cuando era ayudante a un albañil, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que trabaja dos parcelas y no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar los insumos agrícolas como abonos y herbicidas.

El sueño más deseado es poder seguir trabajando, siempre que su estado de salud se lo permita, espera que sus hijos al igual que el sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 73. He never went to school since things were scarce in the place where he lived before. He made an effort and therefore took advantage of a literacy program that was in the community, with all of the sacrifices that he had to make, since first he had to go to the field to work and then the literacy course. He learned to read. He has 3 children, only one daughter lives with him. The others live in neighboring homesteads, also his two year old niece lives in the house.

He is a farmer; he has more than 60 years' experience doing this job. His father was the one who ensured that he would learn to be a good man. He also works as a mason and he learned observing when he was a mason's apprentice. The distance he travels varies since he works two plots and doesn't always go to the same place. When he reaps the harvest, he sells one part and the rest is for consumption. No one else is involved in this activity. He does the work in the morning from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.

The loan will be invested to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and herbicides. His most desired dream is to be able to continue working, that is health will always allow him to, he hopes that his children will also be good people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Leahcim is 17 years old and is first of two children in the family. Her mother Nellie who is the member of NWTF supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Leahcim is studying Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the second year of this 4-year course.

Leahcim is borrowing 6,000 PHP to pay tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Leahcim plans to find a job to be able to help her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is thirty, married and has two girls. His wife works for the government.

Alaa is the main provider for the family. For the past three years he has been working as a carpenter and blacksmith. Now he is seeking a loan to buy needed materials for his business such as iron, wood and boxes, plus a solderer so that he can improve his productivity and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy iron, wood and boxes, plus a solderer

loans.name: Shafika 22 Group

texts.en:
Shafika 22 is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Mahfotha is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with seven children living with them in their one house in Taiz. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. Her husband is an employee in the private sector and the salary which he receives is not enough to cover all of the expenses of the family. Mahfotha decided to help her husband in those expenses, so she has started selling women's clothes and accessories as a door to door business. She found this business as a good fit for her. Mahfotha runs her business very well. She earns good profits from this business. For further expansion, Mahfotha asked for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and make up to resell more for her customers.

Mahfotha looks forward to expanding her business more. She hopes to renovate her house and build other floors to make her house comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, accessories, and make up to resell to customers.

loans.name: Thingkangphai E Group

texts.en:
“Being a single parent, it’s lonely sometimes and always hard work,” says Nengkhonei. She is a single parent to a lovely daughter. She is pictured with her hand raised and is the featured profile member of Thingkangphai (E) group. 

She lives with her daughter in Churachandpur, which is 62 km from the city of Imphal in the northeast region of India. Her daughter is 15 years old and studying in grade 10. Her husband died from a prolonged sickness in August 2009, leaving her family with little money and forcing her to work any available jobs to provide for the family. In April 2010, her son too died, of complications from several sicknesses while she was still struggling to cope with the loss of her husband. 

Nengkhonei managed the household affairs and her daughter’s education expenses with the little amount her husband left as an army pension. In order to supplement the family income, she started a business using her weaving expertise. However, the light irregularity in her village presents a hurdle to completing her work as per the customers' deadlines. She could not continue weaving after sunset; therefore, it slows down her work. 

If she wanted to weave until late hours, she has to spend extra money for an alternate lighting device like candles, petromax or a kerosene lamp. Therefore, she wants to avail the solar loan, which will help her to buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system, which will light up 4 bulbs for 12 hours a day. Since it has a 90-meter long wire, it can be installed anywhere as per the user’s convenience, and since the lighting products are bright, it can provide luminance conducive to weaving and studying.

Likewise, the rest of the group members also want to purchase a 45-watt solar home lighting system for their shops and family use.

loans.use: to buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system, so she can weave for longer hours at night.

loans.name: Kimet

texts.en:
Kimet is a villager who wants to buy a trailer and plug for his agricultural tractor. 

Kimet is married and is a father of two; he is in his early 60s. Agriculture has been his practice by choice now for very long time, according to him. Here  is what he said during his interview with the Branch Assistant:  “I love nature, food, doing physical work and also I love independence. So, this type of activity, has given me all of these. And I am very happy doing agriculture.” 

Kimet plants and sells in large quantities mostly potatoes and barley. He has a dairy cow to cover for his family’s dairy needs and also he sells apples from his own orchards.

loans.use: to buy a trailer and plug for his agricultural tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, su hermano, su cuñado y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado frente al centro de salud que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, agua, hielo y todo lo necesario para su venta, para poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her mother, her brother, her brother-in-law and her child. She works selling soft drinks. She has her business in front of the health center than is near her home, and has many customers because it is a very saleable product; with what she earns from her sales, she manages to pay the household expenses. The client is asking for a loan to purchase juice, soft drinks, water, ice, and all the needed supplies for their sale, in order to have, along with her family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase juice, soft drinks, water, ice and all needed supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace algunos años, su principal siembra es el maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa  en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, en las ultimas cosechas no tuvo muy buenos resultados por esa razón solita un préstamo para seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito y poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y así darle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 25 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and child. He has worked in agriculture for some years; his primary crop is corn. When the harvest is ready, he sells it in the different markets near his home. The last few harvests were not very good, and for this reason, he asks for a loan to continue with his crops since it is his only source of work, and for this reason he asks for this loan to be able to purchase seeds, chemical and natural fertilizers, pesticides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with his cultivation and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, chemical and natural fertilizers, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 39 años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia , ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno está en un lugar accesible, apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo almacena en los graneros así como lo muestra la fotografía y luego lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, Teresa  es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Teresa, 39 years old, lives with her family group in their own house.  She works growing corn and beans and has worked for a number of years in agriculture and has done it a much valuable experience, which has permitted her to always get better and better harvests. The land is in an accessible place, fit for farming and with fertile soil.  Everything that is produced is stored in the granaries as is shown in the photograph, and later is sold in all the areas of the community, since she has many customers, because the people know that everything she sells is of the best quality and of reasonable prices. Teresa is a responsible and hard-working woman. She asks for the INTEGRAL loan that will permit her to purchase seeds, herbicide, manure, tools, etc.  She has good references for her payment history, she is sure to be able to pay off the debt and at the same time offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, herbicide, manure, tools, etc.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a forty-four-year old male. He is married with six children. He is a carpenter who makes chairs and beds. The general public are his major clients. 

He wishes to educate his children. However  he faces a challenge of customers not paying on time. Habib is a hardworking man who needs a loan to buy timber to use in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy timber to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 23-year-old man from the Katito region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man and supports three people in his family; he has one child who is 2 months old.

He operates a motorcycle for transport, a business he has been doing for the last 12 years, and gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase another motorbike, and he will use the anticipated income to expand his business.

His dream is to own more than three motorbikes.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family. She has six children whose ages are nine, six, three, 12, 14 and 16 years old.

Esther sells fish, a business she has been doing for the last five years, and gets a monthly income of 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to increase her working capital to buy more fish for sale . She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

Esther's dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29-years-old mother from Vihiga County, located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Benson who is a farmer and supports their family. She supports three people in her family and was blessed with two children aged 10 and 4 years old respectively.

She has a green grocery stall which she has been operating for the last ten years. It generates a monthly income of KES 5,800. She has applied for her third loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase stock for her green grocery. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 30 years old from Nyandarua South and is a married lady with four children, aged between the ages of three and 14 years old.

Sophia is a farmer and has been in it for four years. She has applied for a loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on her farm. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a fifty-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has been growing cocoa for seven years. This has helped her to cater to her family, only to be affected by little output. 

She wishes to expand her cocoa growing and sell to big cocoa agents in the area who buy at a fair price. Selina is requesting a loan to rent a cocoa garden and harvest for sell selling.

loans.use: to rent a cocoa garden and havest  for selling.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 39-year-old married woman with four children and all go to school. She has been a teacher for 15 years in a primary school and has a passion for interacting with children. 

Dorothy needs money to buy land for farming, but her small salary is a challenge she meets. Dorothy is a faithful woman who appreciates the services being offered.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe whose name in English means ‘white’ has been photographed at her own home. She is requesting this loan to invest in a dairy cow.

Bardhe is in her late 40s and is a married mother of five children ranging in age from 11 to 23 years old. She is from northern Albania, and the way she is dressed represents that of the women in the northern regions. Agriculture/livestock is what Bardhe has been pursuing these past years, and she has an established clientele for her agricultural products. Pigs and goats are the animals that she looks after; she sells the babies of these animals to the locals. She has also 1500 m² where she has planted grapevines; she sells homemade red and white wine. Added to all these efforts, she has also rented from her neighbors agricultural land where she plants fodder in large quantities, and she sells this to the locals.

loans.use: to invest in a dairy cow

loans.name: Siraj Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This is the Siraj Al- Hodeidah group, which is comprised of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 130,000 YER through AMB.

Fozya, the leader of the group, is 42 and married. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. She knows very well how to earn money.

After her husband became unable to look after the family, Fozya decided to assume responsibility. More than three years ago she started selling accessories, cosmetics and ready-to-wear women’s clothing door to door. She earns a good profit doing so.

As part of this group Fozya will be using 30,000 YER of this loan to purchase more women’s ready-to-wear, accessories and makeup to sell. She looks forward to expanding her business by establishing a small store in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more women’s ready-to-wear, accessories and makeup to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married lady happily living with 2 children in Fort Portal. At the age of 40, she operates a bar selling alcoholic drinks and soft drinks, which she has operated for a period of four years now. She is supporting her family successfully. Grace has an ambition of constructing rentals at her plot, which she bought using the profits from her bar. Grace complains of defaulters who limit the rotation of capital in her business. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
This is Andrea, a villager who loves his goats. He has ten adult goats and seven kids. Here he is outside his home holding an adorable baby one. He also is a farmer, growing mostly beans, potatoes, wheat, tomatoes, peppers and fodder and selling them to wholesalers in large quantities.

Andrea is a married father of three and is in his early sixties. One of his sons was born a deaf-mute; he is now married to a woman with the same disabilities. The couple has become parents recently and lives with Andrea.

Andrea has been a longtime client of VFA in good stead. He is applying for a 150,000 ALL loan to buy insecticides for his crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es: Jose de 52 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, también se dedica a la crianza de animales.  Don Jose desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, 52 years old, is a very responsible man with his household obligations, so that he has always been characterized as offering the best to his family.  He currently lives with his family group.  He is a hard-worker, and always has done it with happiness and enthusiasm.  He works as a farmer; his primary crops are corn and beans. He also works raising animals. Jose wants to increase his sales and because of this, he visited the INTEGRAL offices to ask for a loan which will permit him to purchase manure, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, among other supplies and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. He wants to have the help he requests since he doesn't have any other income and with this he will continue to bring the daily bread to his household without any problem.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, among other supplies and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Doña Angela Maria ha trabajado la tierra por mucho tiempo, actualmente esta en proceso de establecer una manzana de Sorgo por lo que necesita comprar el grano, fertilizantes, abono y preparar el suelo, para ello requiere de capital, ella solicita este crédito para la compra de todo lo mencionado, espera que su economía mejore con esta cosecha, Agradece el apoyo y confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Ángela María has worked the land for a long time. Currently, she is in the process of establishing a manzana (1740 square meters) of sorghum and for this she needs to purchase the grain, fertilizer, manure, and prepare the soil. And for this, she needs capital; she is asking for this loan to purchase all the mentioned supplies. She hopes that her economic situation improves with this harvest. She is grateful for the support and confidence that Kiva and Afrodenic have offered her.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael de 36 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol, adicional a eso también trabaja como albañil; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla  a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Misael  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Misael is 36 years old, very friendly and a hard worker. He lives with his wife and children and works very hard on his own piece of land where he grows corn and beans. He also works as a bricklayer. His produce is of very good quality, and when the crop is ready, he sells it in the different markets that are near his house. 

Misael is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so that he will have the money he needs to invest in buying agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. to continue growing his crops and improve the land which you see in the photograph.  He is anxious to increase his sales so he can earn more money and give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Om – Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
Om–Ibrahim is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 140,000 YER through AMB.

Saida is the leader of the group. She is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She is uneducated but is a very active and dynamic woman. Her husband works as a bus driver, but his salary just barely covers all of the family’s expenses.

Saida's house lacks many common home appliances such as a washing machine, oven and refrigerator. Those others she does have are very old and need replacing. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do so. With her 50,000 YER portion of the loan she would like to buy one or more of these appliances.

Saida looks forward to improving her family’s conditions. Her dream is to have a home with new furniture and appliances.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep and goats to breed.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene, 46 years old, is married and has two children. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 55 years old, is the father of four children, two of whom go to school. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Hermer Salvador

texts.es: Hermer de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Hermer está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  zapatos por mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hermer is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his domestic partner and son. For the past few years he has had a business selling shoes which is located in a very busy area. Thanks to the quality of his merchandise and his good prices he has many customers. 

Hermer is asking for a loan to buy shoes at wholesale so he can keep his business going, as this is his only source of income. This will allow him and his family to  have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis tiene 47 años de edad, casado, sin carga familiar, vive en el caserio de Culpón distrito de Nueva Arica, la cual es una zona rural. Su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.
