Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, en su mismo domicilio; esposo es trabajador estable de la empresa agroindustrial de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la venta de ropa de temporada y de esta manera tener mayor ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lelis is 47 years old, married and has no family responsibilities. She lives in the Caserío de Culpón, in the district of Nueva Arica, which is a rural area. Its population works in farming, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, north coast of Peru. She works raising and selling barnyard animals in her own house. Her husband is a steady worker in the agribusiness company of the district.

She has requested Edpyme Alternativa a 3,000 Nuevos Soles loan to invest in the selling of season clothes to have a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde realiza sus siembras. Wilfredo tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 38 and lives with his wife and their four children.  He earns his living in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He's been in the business for many years and he's gained extremely valuable experience that allows him to reap better harvests.  The land he works is located in an agricultural area.  He sells in all the surrounding areas and has a lot of steady clients who always prefer his products because they're quality and priced reasonably, and Wilfredo's service is incomparable.  He wants to invest in agricultural supplies but he needs capital, so he's seeking a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pest control, tools, etc., and to improve his farmland.  Wilfredo has good payment references and is sure he'll be able to pay off the loan on time.  At the same time, he's confident he'll be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pest control, tools, etc., and to improve his land.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, desde hace más de 20 años, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo pelado repartiendo a las tiendas de las zonas, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old, she has been living in the District of Buenos Aires for over 20 years. She lives in her own house with her children. Life in the community is peaceful and the people there work in farming, cattle ranching, and commerce. It is located in the province of Morropon which belongs to the region of Piura, north coast of Peru.
She works selling skinless chickens. She is being delivering to the stores around the area for two years. She has steady customers in the area. 

She has requested a 1,000 Nuevos Soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa to buy more chickens to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline, 26 years old, is the mother of two children. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Pierre, 34 years old, is married and has three children aged between 8 and 13. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize production.

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en: Jean Damour, aged 44, is the father of four, all attending school. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 32 years old. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie, 29 years old, is married and has three children. The Post-Harvest Bridge Loan, a new loan product for UOB, is a top up loan for farmers who have received the Agric Production financing and are waiting for their harvest to be bought by buyers. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from the production financing, which is significantly boosting their yield or production. During the post-harvest process, they are experiencing more poverty as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva Loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during this period.

loans.use: To pay for warehouse/store construction for maize produce.

loans.name: Altagracia Noemi

texts.es:
El olor a maíz recorre por todo el negocio rodeado por pedazos de madera.  Altagracia de 42 años, quien a diario se viste con su caracterizado delantal blanco para elaborar y comercializar las tortillas. Desde hace 14 años, estos ingresos se han convertido en el sustento de su hogar y de sus tres hijos que de lunes a viernes asisten al colegio. Al llegar a cuarto grado de primaria tuvo que abandonar el tren del colegio, debido a que no podía costear más el boleto, sin embargo eso no fue ningún problema para ser alguien que sale adelante.   
Altagracia mostró con mucho afecto el agradecimiento que tiene por haber recibido un préstamo antes, con el cual pudo incrementar su producción y venta, mediante la compra de materiales como maíz y leña. Ahora solicita otro préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor que le permitirá ahorrar un poco de dinero. Además necesita comprar una cocina industrial para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor producto, en mayor cantidad y más rápido. Por el momento no se siente una persona autosuficiente porque sabe que va a seguir invirtiendo mediante préstamos, no obstante no descarta la idea que en un futuro pueda serlo.
texts.en:
The scent of corn with hints of wood permeates the entire locale.  Altagracia, 42, makes and sells tortillas every day, attired in her characteristic white apron.   Over the past fourteen years, revenue from the business has become the support of her home and her three children who go to school Monday through Friday.  When she was in fourth grade, Altagracia had to leave school because she couldn't afford the tuition anymore.  However, that didn't present a problem for someone who was moving ahead.  

Altagracia has shown with great affection the appreciation she has for having received a prior loan, with which she was able to increase production and sales by buying supplies like corn and firewood.  She is currently seeking another loan, to buy wholesale corn that will allow her to save a bit of money.  In addition, she needs to buy an industrial kitchen so she can offer her clients a better product more quickly and in greater quantity.  She knows she needs to keep investing by taking loans, so for the moment she doesn't feel as though she's self-sufficient, but she doesn't rule out that she may be in the future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, 38 years old, is from a small village in the Kobuleti district. She is married and lives with her husband, Gocha, and two children. Maia and Gocha are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they grow maize and nut trees on their plot of agricultural land. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. 

As the income is not enough for their four-member family, Maia decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,200 Gel to start a sales business. Maia will purchase clothes from wholesalers and then resell them among her villagers at a higher price. This will increase the family's income, which will enable them to improve their living conditions. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo tres estudian, su esposa le ayuda en el cuido de los animales ya demás tiene experiencia en la elaboración de artesanías,  como folder de tule, depósitos para lapiceros, costuras entre otras actividades.

José se dedica al comercio de pollos los cuales encuba y nacen a los 22 días, los alimenta durante siete semanas y luego los vacuna para que no se enfermen, tiene un año de dedicarse a esta actividad lo cual lo aprendió de un hermano suyo, , además ya tiene 12 años realizando los trabajaos de agricultura y lo aprendió de su padre.

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar transporte y llevar la semilla de frijol a vender a otra ciudad.

Su sueño es tener buenos resultados con la cosecha y seguir trabajando fuerte en la agricultura y seguir dándole los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 40 and has studied through the second grade.  He has a wife and four children, of whom three are students.  His wife helps him care for their animals and in addition has experience in making crafts such as tule folders, pencil holders, and sewing projects, among other activities. 

José raises chickens which incubate and are born in 22 days.  He then feeds the chicks for seven weeks, after which he vaccinates them so that they won't become ill.  He has been working in this occupation, which he learned from one of brothers, for one year.  Additionally, he had already been working in agriculture, which he learned from his father, for 12 years.

This loan is to pay for transport and to take bean seeds to sell in another city.

José's dream is to get good results from his harvest, and to keep working hard in agriculture to continue providing for his children's studies.

loans.use: to pay for transport and to take bean seeds to sell in another city

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, 40 years of age, is married and lives in a rural area with his family of 7 children. Since 2002, he has operated a retail shop. Godfrey earns additional income from farming, growing crops such as bananas, maize and beans. Godfrey has requested a loan since he needs to restock his shop, which will enable him to meet all his customers' needs. 

Godfrey works 12 hours per day. He acquired this loan to buy more stock for his business and to pay for school fees. He has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around him. His clients are traders from his village and the surrounding places. Godfrey's main challenges are bad debts from customers. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. Godfrey appreciates lenders for the services rendered to them.

loans.use: To buy stock of retail items to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man who is 31 years of age and living in a rural area with his family of  four children. He is a produce trader dealing in agricultural produce such as maize, coffee, and bananas. He also works as a driver to earn additional income.  He started this business in 2000.

Godfrey works 12 hours per day and he acquired this loan for school fees and to buy more stock of coffee to sell later when the prices have increased.  He has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply the coffee machines around Kyotera. His clients are traders from his village and exporters from the surrounding area.

The challenges he faces are bad weather conditions.  He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates the services rendered to them.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children and to buy more stock of coffee

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.en:
The Highlands of Guatemala are a rich tapestry of lush green mountains punctuated by majestic volcanoes, blue lakes and skies and colorfully dressed indigenous people. Sololá is a large town above Lake Atitlan and is known as “the city of landscape” because of the striking beauty that surrounds it. In contrast, it is an area where well over half of the indigenous population lives in poverty and an estimated 30% live in extreme poverty, a level where families are unable to obtain the minimum daily caloric intake of food.

Ten women in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Estrellas” (The Stars) are committed to not being part of the above statistics. They are participating in the Microcredit Plus Program of the organization that combines small loans and education. They work in various small businesses including a “tortillería”, where fresh tortillas are made three times each day, animal husbandry and agriculture as well as the production of typical handicrafts, crafts and textiles.

Marcela, a single 21-year-old woman, is the youngest in the Trust Bank. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of chickens. She plans to fatten them up and sell them at a good price. The proceeds of her sales will enable her to continue with her education as she recently returned to school to finish her secondary studies. As a small child, she was unable to continue her education as her mother died and she needed to help care for her seven siblings. Marcela is most excited to participate in the monthly educational trainings given by a Loan Officer of Friendship Bridge. Subjects covered include hygiene, health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants as well as self-esteem and women’s rights. Other topics include successful business management, including information on accounting, budgeting and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

The women of the “Las Estrellas” Trust Bank send greetings and thanks to KIVA investors for their thoughtfulness and generosity in supplying capital for their loans. Along with their families, they face a more successful and prosperous tomorrow.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten up and sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, gari, groundnuts/peanuts, etc. in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es: Santos de 37 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Santos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Santos is 37 and has been working in agriculture for many years.  He plants beans and corn and when they are ready to harvest, he takes them to market in the areas around where he lives. 

From the sale of his crops, Santos manages to cover household expenses. He is a responsible, honest man and a hard worker. Santos lives with his wife and children.  

Santos is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicide, etc. for his crops and to improve his land (shown in the photo); what he earns is not enough to cover these costs.  By doing this, he hopes to have a better income and improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicide, etc. to improve his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for one of her children.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 54 años de edad, lamentablemente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, sus padres creían que era una pérdida de tiempo, está casado y su esposa se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar, y solo tienen 1 hijo.

Rodolfo trabaja sembrando maíz, oficio que aprendió a muy corta edad ya que su padre lo llevaba a realizar jornadas de trabajo  y a la vez ayudaba en la siembra, además el hijo de Rodolfo le ayuda en la siembra de 14,000 mts de maíz.

Él solicita este crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprará los insumos que necesita tales como: abono, semilla,. Agroquímicos y el pago del tractorista que realiza el arado.

El sueño de Rodolfo es tener mucho ganado para no depender directamente de la agricultura, también desea mejorar su vivienda y tener salud para continuar esforzándose en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 54 years old. Unfortunately he didn’t have the opportunity to study. His parents thought it was a waste of time. He is married and his wife does the household chores. They just have one son.

Rodolfo works growing corn.  He learnt this job when he was very young because his father took him to work and he helped him. Rodolfo’s son also helps him sowing an area of 14,000 meters of corn.

He is requesting this loan to invest in farming, he will buy the supplies that he needs, such as, fertilizer, seeds, agrochemicals, and to pay the tractor driver that plows.

Rodolfo’s dream is to have a lot of livestock so he doesn't have to depend directly on farming. He also wishes to improve his home and be healthy to strive in his job.

loans.use: to invest in farming, to buy the supplies he needs such as fertilizer, seed, agrochemicals, and the payment to pay the tractor driver that plows.

loans.name: Monica Rosario

texts.es:
Monica vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como cocinera en un wawawasi de su ciudad desde las 6 e la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobr too porque es madre soltera  y por su hijo es que se esfuerza mucho.

Monica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habira, asimismo comprara algunos enseres y solventará algunos gastos personales, con lo cual podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación y calidad de vida para su hijo”.
texts.en:
Monica lives in the city of Ica.  She works as a cook at a local nursery school from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. so she can earn some income and get ahead. She works so hard because she is a single mom and does it for her son.

Monica is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to make improvements to her house, buy some household equipment, and pay some personal expenses. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: "Provide a good education and quality of life to her son."

loans.use: to make improvements to her house and to buy some household equipment.

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es: Es una mujer amable y emprendedora, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 6 años estableció su negocio de utensilios para cocina, venta de trastes plásticos y de vidrios en un tramo que alquila en el mercado del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Gracias a los créditos anteriores que le ha otorgado PANA PANA, le han permito crecer y ampliar su negocio, crear fuentes de empleo, ya que actualmente alquila otro tramo en el mercado y es atendido por una joven, cuyo salario mensual es aproximadamente de C$ 2,500 (Dos mil quinientos córdobas) en donde ofrece: ropa interior, cosméticos, prensa pelos, accesorios para mujeres y bisuterías. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es reanudar sus estudios universitarios de contabilidad.
texts.en: Antonia is a friendly and enterprising woman. She is a single mother of a three year old son. With the goal of having her own source of income she started her business, 6 years ago, selling kitchen utensils, plastic and glass dishes in a stall that she rented at the Municipal market of Puerto Cabezas. Thanks to her previous loans that Pana Pana has given her, she has expanded and grown her business, creating employment. She now rents another stall in the market which is attended to by a young woman, who's monthly salary is about 2,500 NIO. She offers undergarments, cosmetics, barrettes , accessories for women and jewelery. Antonia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in Managua to resell at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas. Her dream is to resume her university accounting studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua to resell at accessible prices in Puerto Cabezas.

loans.name: Xecam En Victoria Group

texts.en:
In the Highlands of Guatemala, nine ladies have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank named after the town where they live, “Xecam en Victoria.” We are excited to report that they have just successfully completed their very first loan cycle funded by Kiva investors and only their second with Friendship Bridge. The women have proved themselves to be responsible and trustworthy and have now decided to apply for a new loan. In addition, they have just welcomed two new members to the Trust Bank!

The nine women in the Trust Bank average five years of formal education and have an average of four children. The majority of them work in traditional textile production using their sewing and embroidery skills.

Doña Francisca, the 38 year old President of the Trust Bank, is divorced with five children. For many years, she has focused on her goal to create a better life for herself and her children. Doña Francisca has requested another loan that she will use to buy more of traditional ornate blouses called “huipiles” that she will resell to wholesale customers throughout the country. With her business, Doña Francisca can earn enough money to take care of her children, including the education of her three youngest ones and their home. She can clearly visualize a better future for all of the family!

Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer meets with the “Xecam en Victoria” Trust Bank. The nine women eagerly participate in the educational trainings on timely subjects like children’s nutrition and education, health and hygiene as well as the use of medicinal plants. Other topics discussed are effective business practices including accounting, budgeting, planning and customer service. It is the combination of the educational component and the loans that Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus”. It is a combination that works!

Appreciation goes to Kiva investors for funding these essential loans. The women are so very grateful! Thank you to each Kiva investor!

loans.use: To buy more of traditional ornate blouses called “huipiles” that she will resell to wholesale customers throughout the country

loans.name: Alfredo Arnoldo

texts.es: Alfredo de 33 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol. Alfredo desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía,  Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Alfredo is 33 years old. Hie is a man who is very responsible with his household duties, and he has always been known for providing the best to his family. He currently lives together with his family group, made up of his wife and his two children, who are 7 and 14. He is very hard-working and has always carried out his work with cheerfulness and enthusiasm. He works as a farmer, and his main crops are corn and beans. Alfredo wants to increase his sales, and for that reason he visited the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan which will permit him to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides, among other supplies, and to improve the land shown in the photo. He hopes he can receive the help he is requesting because he does not have other monetary income, and thus he will be able to keep providing the daily bread for his household without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and other supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino tiene 61 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, él solo estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica,  está casado y su esposa se dedica a la a la venta de pan, los gastos del hogar son cubiertos por los dos; son padres de 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos están con ellos, una trabaja y el otro estudia.

Él es agricultor y también se dedica al cuido de ganado, desde su niñez aprendió el trabajo ya que su papá le enseño, anteriormente se dedicaba a la crianza de aves de corral.

El crédito lo necesita para pagar la mano de obra para empezar a trabajar la tierra para la temporada agrícola ya que el cultiva varias hectáreas de cultivo. 

Él sueña con mejorar su economía y la calidad de vida de su familia, quisiera que sus hijos obtuvieran una carrera universitaria y así tener una mayor oportunidad dentro de la sociedad actual.
texts.en:
Catalino is 61 years old. He is a very hard-working man. He only went to school up to the second grade of basic education. He is married, and his wife works selling bread. The household expenses are covered by the two of them. They are the parents of 5 children, only two of whom are living with them. One is working and the other one is studying. 

He is a farmer, and he also works raising livestock. He learned this work starting in his childhood, because his father taught it to him. Previously he has also worked raising domestic birds.

He needs the loan to pay for labor to begin to work the land for the planting season, since he is cultivating numerous hectares of crops. 

He dreams of improving his economic situation and his family's quality of life. He would like his children to earn university degrees and thus have better opportunities in today's society.

loans.use: to pay for labor to start working the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Semetabaj Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Trabajadoras Semetabaj” or “Hardworking Women of Semetabaj” is made up of eight women and is located in a small municipality of San Andres Semetabaj in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is an agricultural area where corn, onions, and beans are harvested. Many in the town work in traditional textile production as well. 

There are eight women in the Trust Bank. Sonia, a 56-year-old married mother of six children, is the Treasurer of the Trust Bank. Although she was only able to attend primary school for a limited time, she carefully keeps track of the funds of her Trust Bank. Sonia is requesting a loan for her traditional textile business and will use it to buy a variety of supplies including thread. She fabricates pretty napkins and placemats as well as colorful traditional blouses called “huipiles.”

The ladies involved in the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus Program of the organization realize the great value of education for their children and lifelong learning for themselves. Sonia works hard to help her grandaughter who has begun to study at the University level. Other women are thrilled that their children have completed primary school and are moving on to higher levels of learning. The women of each Trust Bank reap tremendous benefits from the educational component of their monthly meetings with a Loan Officer. They learn about how to manage their small businesses with classes on accounting, budgeting and customer service. The ladies learn about health and hygiene, nutrition and medicinal plants as well as self esteem and violence against women.

KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge in Guatemala in providing the seed money for the loans. The hardworking women of the Trust Bank in San Andres Semetabaj are already reaping benefits for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To buy a variety of supplies, including thread, to fabricate pretty napkins and placemats

loans.name: Sacpulupense Group

texts.en:
Sacpulup is a small rural town located about 35 minutes from the much larger municipality of Chichicastenango, Guatemala. It is known for its traditional K'iche' Mayan culture with distinctive language and colorful traditional dress. A recent visitor described the town as one with homes made of mud with metal roofs, dogs napping and scratching, floppy-eared pigs tied with ropes around their bellies and chickens clucking with their baby chicks following after them. 

Seeking better lives for themselves, their families and their community, ten women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Sacpulupense”, meaning “People from Sacpulup”. The majority of these ladies are involved in traditional textile production, as is the case of 37-year-old María, the secretary of the Trust Bank, who has had six years of formal education. In spite of this, she is able and proud to keep accurate minutes of the Trust Bank meetings, as well as other proceedings and agreements. Maria has eight children. She joined the Trust Bank in order to obtain a loan which she will use to purchase good quality thread and other supplies to create typical tablecloths and napkins. She wants to attract more clients and intends to improve her designs so that they are unique and more in demand.

Maria feels happy because, along with her husband, the couple has been able to send their children to school. When the children are not studying, they work with their parents in the textile business which allows the family to create and sell more of their products. 

Maria also participates in the monthly educational trainings of her Trust Bank, where a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer presents information on essential topics such as effective business practices, including proper accounting, budgeting, and customer service, women’s rights, self esteem and health as well as nutrition and medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”.

Transforming themselves into empowered women eliminating poverty, Maria and her friends in the “Sacpulupense” Trust Bank see a brighter and more hopeful future. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your participation and good will!

loans.use: To purchase good quality thread and other supplies to create typical tablecloths and napkins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pump to improve biofertilizer use.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón de 57 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde realiza la siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía, ramon tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 57, lives with his wife and their three children.  He is a farmer.  Specifically, he grows corn and beans.  He has been involved in this line of work for many years.  It has given him very valuable experience that allows him to get the best harvests.

The land that he cultivates is located in an agricultural area.  He sells in all of the outlying areas.  He has a lot of fixed customers.  These people always prefer his product because of the quality, the truly affordable prices, and the incomparable service.

He wants to invest in agricultural supplies, but he needs capital.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, pest controls, and tools, etc.  It will also allow him to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph, where he plants.

Ramón has good payment references, and he is sure that he will be able to repay the debt on time.  He is also confidennt that he will be able to give his family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, pest controls, and tools, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is a woman who stands out searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. Three years ago she began making a living selling grocery goods in their village. She thanks God since the results of these sales have been very rewarding and her products well-liked. Based on this success Rosana is asking for a loan for the purchase of additional grocery goods which will allow her to continue to forge her dream of growing as an entrepreneur, always looking for the well being of her family and the grace of God.

loans.use: for the purchase of additional grocery goods

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops for sale. She earns well from this and this is their main source of income for many years. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. She also farmed corn for an additional crop to grow. Ermelinda is now requesting a loan  to purchase organic fertilizer and new seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new seedlings

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rebecca has a general store in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for one year. In the future Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and iron

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 23 years old and married with one child.

Ana Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like laundry soap, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries for resale.

Ana Mae has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ana Mae aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like laundry soap, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries for resale.

loans.name: Carmi

texts.en:
Carmi is 21 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmi has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Carmi requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell to customers.

Carmi has been in this business for ten years. In the future Carmi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Wendy Del Socorro

texts.es: Wendy es una persona esforzada, trabajadora, con esfuerzo y prestamos obtenidos ha ido realizando mejoras en su vivienda, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien de vez en cuando le salen trabajos como perito agricola, ella tiene su trabajo estable como vendedora de artefactos electricos en Gallo mas Gallo.  a pesar de ser una familia unida aun no ha podido completar las mejoras en su vivienda, necesita construir una habitacion de concreto para cuando crezca su hijita contar con su privacidad.  solicita este credito para la compra de materiales de construccion como: Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Arenilla, Hierro y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Wendy is a dedicated and hard-working person.  With effort and the loans she has gotten, she has been making improvements to her house.  She says that has help from her husband, who once in a while gets jobs as an expert in agriculture.

She has stable work selling electrical items in Gallo Más Gallo.  In spite of having a united family, she still has not been able to complete the improvements on her house.  She needs to build a concrete room so that when her daughter is older she will have her privacy.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, grit, and iron and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, gravel, grit, and iron.

loans.name: Sonia Gloria

texts.es: Sonia de 49 años de edad desde hace varios años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la variedad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, café, azúcar, etc. y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia, 49, has had a shop in her home for several years. She has many customers due to her variety of products and good prices. With the money she earns from sales, she is able to pay her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and daughter.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale products such as basic grains, sweets, drinks, soup, coffee, sugar, etc. so she can earn more income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale products such as basic grains, sweets, drinks, soup, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is working and operating her business to be able to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her children. She needs to pay for her children's school fees, miscellaneous costs, and also cover her household expenses. Her goal is to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family.

Wilma is striving for a better life through her business, and she says that she is requesting this loan to buy more raw materials for furniture making. She is grateful to receive this opportunity which will be very helpful to her in improving her family's general living situation.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Andrelita

texts.en:
Andrelita is very thankful for the loan assistance extended to her. She has utilized the loan to buy additional items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

To help her to continue operating her business, Andrelita is requesting another 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional mobile phone and cell phone units to expand her product inventory: the more items displayed in the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Andrelita hopes that her children will finish their studies through all her hard work and by the Grace of God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional mobile phone and cell phone units for her business.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Florinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling rice.  Florinda is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Florinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, aged 38, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past 16 years. 

Rosalie has requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 48 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly, aged 49, is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 12 years. 

Beverly has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio, tiene cosecha de Piña, aproximadamente dos manzanas su papa le colabora bastante con el cultivo, este credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Abonos y fertilizantes para darle un optimo mantenimiento a su cosecha, comprara: Completo, Triple, Urea, etc. Muy agradecido don Julio con Fondos Kiva y Afodenic por la confianza que le han dado al permitirle estos financiamientos.
texts.en: Julio has a pineapple crop, which is around two blocks. His father helps with the crop. He is requesting this loan to buy manure and fertilizer to perform the best maintenance on his crop. He will buy Completo, Triple, Urea, and more. Julio is very grateful for the Kiva funds and Afodenic for the trust they have shown in him in giving him this financing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maintenance.

loans.name: Ian Roy

texts.en:
Ian Roy lives in  Misamis Occidental. He earns income through providing training services to support his needs. He has been doing this for eight years. He uses his motorcycle in supplying training services.
Without hesitation Ian Roy requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover his motorcycle maintenance costs. 
His plan in the future is to hopefully improved his business by having his own gym.

loans.use: to cover motor maintenance costs

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en:
Zarah previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband, who now works as an electrician, are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

To help her to continue operating her business, Zarah is requesting another loan of 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her product inventory: the more items displayed in the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zarah hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams of happy and healthy lives for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Tito Josué

texts.es:
Tito tiene 29 años de edad, estudió el bachillerato, posteriormente siguió estudiando un técnico en computación, y luego decidió entra a la formación para pastor, está casado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y nadie más vive con ellos.


Él  se dedica al pastoreo de la comunidad, es un hombre entregado a las cosas, y se preocupa por ayudar a los que necesitan, tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a ser pastor. Su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad: no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique. 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar una motocicleta, le mejora es que ya tendrá su propio medio de transporte, ya que por compromisos le toca salir constantemente, y muchas veces no sale a tiempo del bus cuando sale tarde de las reuniones.

Sueña con tener primero lo más necesario para sobrevivir, por lo que espera trabajar siempre.
texts.en:
Tito is 29 years old. He completed his secondary studies, after which he continued studying to become a computer technician, and then, he decided to enter into training to become a pastor. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household duties. He has a three-year-old child, and no one else lives with them. 

He pastors the community, and he is a dedicated man who cares about helping those in need, devoting himself to being a pastor for more than four years. His father gave him the guidance that made him a person who is good for society, and he does not devote himself to any other occupations.

The loan will be invested in purchasing a motorcycle. This will be an improvement because he will now have his own transportation, as his commitments require him to go out constantly, and many times he does not get off the bus on time, when he leaves meetings late.

He dreams of having, first, that which is most necessary to survive; and for this reason, he hopes to work forever.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell household equipment business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Elena is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her buy and sell household equipment business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Elma is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 35 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for the past eight years and also earns income from a photocopier.

Jeanna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Jeanna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa, aged 36, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has had a clothing sales business in the Philippines for the past two years. 

Maria Teresa has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fernando Alfieri

texts.es:
Fernando Vive en el distrito de Parcona, e sun hombre muy trabajador y con mucha gnas de salir adelnate, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza en su trabajo como vigilante en la municipalidad de su distrito, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que este empleo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Fernando esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su madre, ya que actualmente tiene una cocina de kerosene y es muy peligroso; de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir la vivienda de su madre”.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in Parcona district, and is a very hard-working man with a great desire to succeed. This is why each day he does his best in his work as a watchman for the municipal government of his district. He works around nine hours a day, as this job is his only source of income for moving forward in life.

Fernando is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy a gas stove for his mother, as currently she has a kerosene stove and it is very dangerous. This way he will be able to improve her quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: "To finish building his mother's house."

loans.use: To buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino owns farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for 5 years and earns a good income for the family. 

Avelino had successfully repaid his previous loan for farming. He requested another loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 6,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jaime Amilcar

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 21 años de edad, vive en una colonia, tiene 21 años edad y estudió hasta octavo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, aún no tienen hijos y solo su compañera de vida depende de él.

Jaime es agricultor, siembra una hectárea de maíz y también cultiva maicillo y frijol desde muy pequeño realiza este trabajo que le permite llevar el sustento a la familia. Además Jaime ayuda a otras personas a realizar este trabajo y le permite ganar dinero extra para la familia el lugar donde Jaime cultiva está muy cerca de su casa, trabaja de 6:00 am a 12: md

El dinero lo utilizará para cancelar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara y para comprar los herbicidas y los fertilizantes necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha la necesidad satisfecha será la obtener el capital de trabajo 

Lo que Jaime y su esposa desean primordialmente es tener su primer hijo ellos son muy conscientes que es una responsabilidad muy grande y que tiene que trabajar mucho para brindarle a su esposa e hijo una buena calidad de vida, él espera que su cosecha sea muy abundante para cubrir todos los gastos y año tras año seguir cultivando más.
texts.en:
Jaime is 21 years old and lives in a suburb. He went as far as eighth grade in school. He lives with his partner and she is a housewife. They don't have children yet and only his life partner is dependent on him.

Jaime is a farmer. He cultivates a hectare of corn and also grows sorghum and beans. From a very young age he has been doing this work, which allows him to support his family. In addition, Jaime helps other people with farm work, and this allows him to earn extra money for his family. 

The area where Jaime farms is very close to his home. He works from 6 AM to 12 PM. 

He will use the money to pay for the rent of the land he will farm, and to buy the herbicides and fertilizers he needs in order to obtain a good harvest. The need that will be met is that of obtaining working capital. What Jaime and his wife wish for first and foremost is to have their first child.

They are well aware that it is a very big responsibility and that he has to work hard to provide his wife and child with a good quality of life. He hopes that his harvest will be very abundant in order to cover all the costs, and to continue farming year after year.

loans.use: To pay for the rent on the land where he will farm, and buy the herbicides and fertilizers he needs to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Ever Saul

texts.es:
Ever tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, tienen 2 hijos entre 1 y 8 años de edad, solo su esposa y sus hijos dependen directamente de él, y además en casa vive la abuela de su pareja.

Ever trabaja como motorista de un microbús de un amigo, con el cual realiza viajes al aeropuerto o a otros destinos de nuestro país, también tiene un vehículo propio con el cual realiza, tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de dedicarse a este trabajo, cuando trabajo para su amigo que vive en otro cantón, él se trasporta en su vehículo hasta ahí y está a una distancia de 30 minutos en bus.

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar una motocicleta que le permita conducirse con más facilidad hasta el lugar donde vive su amigo para reducir los costos económicos que le genera el andar su carro.
texts.en:
Ever, 29, studied through high school. He is married and his wife works at home and cares for their 2 children, ages 8 and 1. They have no other dependents, but his wife's grandmother also lives with them.

Ever works as a minibus driver for a friend, making trips to the airport and other destinations in his country. He also has his own vehicle. He's been in this line of work for about four years. When he works for his friend, who lives in another canton, he has to drive his car over there or take the bus for 30 minutes. The money from the loan will be used to buy a motorcycle so that he can drive there more easily for work and reduce the expenses from driving his car.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es una persona de 28 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Antonio Palopó, departamento de Sololá, es soltero, todavía vive en la casa de sus padres, se dedica a vender verduras, compra por mayor y lo vende a menudeo, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, todos los conocimientos los adquirió de su papá porque desde niño empezó a ayudarlo, Juan solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 8,000.00 para comprar verduras por mayor y luego venderlos, Juan tiene planeado mejorar la casa donde vive y así tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 28, lives in the town of San Antonio Palopo in the department of Solola. He is single and still lives at home with his parents. He sells vegetables, buying in bulk and selling in smaller quantities. He has been doing this for 6 years and learned everything he knows from his father, who taught him from a young age.

Juan asks for a loan of 8000 Quetzals to buy vegetables at wholesale and later resell them. He has plans to make improvements to his parents' home and thereby improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casado y tiene 2 hijos entre 6 y 9 años de edad.

Luis se dedica a la pesca, tiene 8 años de realizar esta labor anteriormente trabajo para una empresa el área de empaque, junto con su esposa tienen una pupusería desde hace 6 meses la cual es una fuente de ingreso para la familia, el horario de pesca muchas veces es de todo el día y la pupusería solo la abren por las tardes              

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar sillas, mesas y más productos para ampliar el negocio y le permita atender a más clientes y no solo tener el negocio por las tardes si no todo el día.

Sus planes a futuro son mejorar el negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos y poder construir su propia casa y brindarle la educación a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro, él sabe que esto lo puede lograr junto a su esposa con mucho trabajo y sacrificio
texts.en:
Luis, 25, studied until 8th grade. He is married and has 2 children, ages 6 and 9. Luis has been working as a fisherman for 8 years; before that he worked in a packing business. He and his wife have a pupusa restaurant that has been an added income source for their family for 6 months. He often is out fishing all day, and the pupusa shop only opens in the afternoon.

The loan will be used to buy seats, tables and other products to make the business bigger and allow them to attend to more customers. They also want to expand the restaurant's hours to be open all day.

His future plans are to improve the business and thereby increase their income. He wants to build a home and provide his children with an education so that they have a better future. He knows that he and his wife can achieve this with a lot of hard work and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy seats, tables and other products to make the business bigger.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, hamburguesas, salchipapas, bebidas gaseosas, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos.

Flor esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo mejorar las parte de la fachada, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y segur trabajando para poder hacer realidad su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Flor lives in the city of Ica. She works in a small business selling food like hamburgers, sausages and fries, and soft drinks. This gives her money to get ahead, and the most important fruit of her labor has been to be able to get her 4 children ahead in life.

Flor is grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy materials to make improvements to her home, especially the front of the home. This will improve her quality of life and she will continue working to make her life goals a reality.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos es una persona de 56 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Antonio Palopó, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos; 3 ya están  casadas, 2 aún viven con ellos trabajan en la elaboración de artesanías, se dedica al cultivo de cebolla,  tiene sembradío de café, trabaja también en chalet que está ubicado en la orillas del lago, sus productos los vende el mercado del municipio, Marcos necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 3,000.00 para comprar de insumos que sirve para el mantenimiento de café, Marcos tiene planeado hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcos, 56, lives in the town of San Antonio Palopó, in the department of Sololá. He has 5 children; 3 are already married and 2 still live at home. They work in artisan crafts, growing onions, and cultivating coffee. He also works in a chalet that is located on the edge of the lake. He sells his products by going from town to town.

Marcos needs a loan of 3000 Quetzals to buy inputs to help him care for his coffee crop. He plans to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed spare parts of her tricycle. Her loan helped her business and also for her children's education. Her income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Bella hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liza is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish, spices and seasoning to sell to customers.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish, spices and seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 44 years old and married with two children who both attend school.

Jonabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Jonabel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from farming rice.

Jonabel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marites has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kankeletigui  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KANKELETIGUI  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Dembela,  chef lieu de la commune de Dembela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Bintou assise au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir 1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the KANKELETIGUI 4 group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old with 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Dembela, the main town in the commune of Dembela, in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

These women have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are now on their seventh loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Bintou, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is the woman seated in the middle of the front row.  She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to cultivate 1.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in Sikasso and in her village. She is expecting to make an average profit of 190,000 CFA francs per planting season. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KANKELETIGUI  5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Dembela,  chef lieu de la commune de Dembela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Adama assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 107.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the KANKELETIGUI 5 group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Dembela, the main town in the commune of Dembela, in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

These women have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are now on their seventh loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Adama, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to cultivate one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in Sikasso and in her village. She is expecting to make an average profit of 107,000 CFA francs per planting season. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Angela has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from .

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nohanena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nohanena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell gasoline business, and coconut farming. Nohanena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Nohanena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Carolina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Carolina has been in this business for 30 years now.

Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food market business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy more spices and frozen foods to sell to customers.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. Teresita earns more income from farming rice.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spices and frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda lives in Sagrada, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, along with her family.

Her husband is a farmer and this is their main source of income, while Alfreda manages their piggery to earn a living. Earning well from this business, she successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for her piggery. 

Now she wants to expand her business and so she has taken out a new loan to buy additional piglets. She hopes to gain more income and be able to save a portion of her revenue as a reserve fund for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Kartierton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe     KARTIERTON 1 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Seriba debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000 francs FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the KARTIERTON 1 group are married men who are, on average, 45 years old with five children each. They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

These men have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. 

Seriba, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, he is standing second from the right. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 1.5  hectare of land. After the harvest, he sells his production at the Sikasso markets to a group of customers which mostly consists of resellers from the main cities.  He is expecting to make an average profit of 200,000 CFA francs per planting season. Thanks to this profit, he will be able to repay his loan and to contribute to his large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Jaime Manuel

texts.es:
Jaime vive en la ciudad de Nazca, tiene 33 años y se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente ha sembrado papa, a su vez trabaja como albañil, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra parapoder solventar los gastos de su hogar; Jaime cree que le va ien porque es responsable y porque esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos, es pro ello que tiene mucha dedicación.
