Jaime esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar de insumos para el cultivo como abono, fertilizantes, gastos de regadío, arado, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener una mejor cosecha y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello podrá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”  Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in the city of Nazca. He is 33 years old and makes a living from agriculture. Currently he is growing potatoes. He also works as a bricklayer, which gives him extra money to be able to cover the household costs. 

Jaime thinks things are going well because he is responsible and because this is his only source of income he puts a lot of effort into it.

Jaime is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help they have provided he will be able to buy supplies for his crops such as manure, fertilizers, irrigation costs, pay for ploughing, and other items. In this way he will be able to have a better harvest and will be able to improve his income. As a result he will be able to keep working hard towards realising his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizers and other items.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan for her to purchase additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef to sell. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida dreams of expanding her business even more and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef to sell.

loans.name: Kheeneth

texts.en:
Kheeneth previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used buy more pork and chicken meat needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more pork and chicken meat needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Kheeneth hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more pork and chicken meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Celerina has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of root crops business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more sacks of root crops to sell for her buying and selling of root crops business.

Leonille has been in this business for eight years. Leonille earns more income from poultry and farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Christine Mae

texts.en:
Christine Mae is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Christine Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Christine Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc., to sell.

Christine Mae has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Christine Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: María Aracely

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, estudió en la escuela de enfermería, está acompañada y aún no tiene hijos.

María se dedica a trabajar como enfermera, hace 4 años que  terminó sus estudios superiores pero por falta de oportunidades de empleo no había trabajado sino hasta hace 3 años que inició en la empresa donde está  actualmente, ella desde pequeña soñó trabajar  en el área de salud , se sacrificó para salir bien en los estudios básicos y de nivel medio , luego ingresó a la escuela y  cuando la mandaban a realizar sus primeras practicas a clínicas y hospitales era su mayor emoción ya que quería perfeccionar más sus conocimientos, por el momento no tiene otra actividad productiva y antes, solo ayudaba a sus padres en los oficios del hogar. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 8 kilómetros
de su casa y para llegar a la oficina se transporta  en bus, y de la oficina a los caseríos y cantones que visitan se transporta en motocicleta. Su horario es variable ya que, trabaja bajo metas  a veces entra a las 7 A.M  le toca salir a las 5:00 de la tarde

Con el crédito, María terminará de cancelar un lote que le venden cerca de su casa, el crédito ayudará ya que sin él no podría comprar el terreno.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda ya que está un poco deteriorado el techo y siempre vive pensando en que pueda ocurrir un accidente, por otra parte pretende seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and studied at nursing school. She has a partner and does not have any children yet.

María works as a nurse. She finished her higher studies 4 years ago but because of the lack of work opportunities she had not worked up until 3 years ago, when she started at the company where she works currently. She dreamed of working in healthcare from when she was little. She made sacrifices in order to do well in her basic and high school studies and then started at nursing school. When they sent her to do her first practicals in clinics and hospitals it was really exciting, since she wanted to perfect her knowledge even more.

At the moment she does not have any other work and previously she just helped her parents around the house.

The place where she works is 8km from her home and she goes by bus to get to the office. To get to the hamlets and cantons she visits from the office she goes on a motorbike. Her working hours are variable as she works to targets and sometimes she starts at 7am and works until 5pm.

María will use the loan to finish paying for a piece of land which is being sold near her house. The loan will help her since without it she would not be able to buy the land. Her dream is to improve her home as the roof is in a bit of a bad state and she always thinks that an accident could happen. She also hopes to continue studying.

loans.use: to finish paying for a piece of land she is buying near to her house.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey went to his local school as a teacher. He is single and is earning well from his salary. He uses his motorcycle as his means of transportation. He wants to pay his balance, for this motor was acquired from the company with amortization payments. 

To pay for his motorcycle, Rey borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microfinance. He wants to serve better to earn good returns for his needs.

loans.use: to pay for his motorcycle

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old and married. She has five children and lives in Balide, Aurora, Zamboang del Sur. Editha operates a general store in their village and she earns well for the family's needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

Editha find ways to earn more return and with GDMPC, her dreams become easier. She took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods. Editha plans to expand her business in order to assure the better future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a mother of four children, helps her husband operate their own farm and at the same time runs a retail store to make a living. 

For six years, the couple have earned well to provide for the family. Erlinda planned to improve their business in order to earn daily, to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer, in order to have higher returns from the business. 

In the future, she wants to provide good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns from her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia previously accessed a 45,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal household and business expenditures. 

Now she would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia hopes to be more successful in business and that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel tiene 21 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad en su juventud de ir a la escuela, se acompañó hace más de seis meses, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de lunes a sábado.
Rosibel trabaja desde los nueve años en la agricultura, crianza de cerdos y la venta de antojitos (tamales, pan, atol y otros) su madre le ha enseñado dichas labores desde su niñez.
Hoy en día que vive con su esposo, Rosibel se dedica a la venta de pan y de tamales, vende cuatro días a la semana y le es rentable, ya que en la comunidad donde vive hay mucha demanda de este tipo de productos y su hermano la apoya en el trabajo.

Rosibel solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, pollo y harina para tener materia prima, para iniciar mas fuerte el negocio que posee en la comunidad, y le ayudará de mucho pues tiene que comprar al por mayor, debido a que no hay transporte diario en la comunidad.
Rosibel sueña con ponerle ladrillo al piso en la casa donde vive con su esposo, para cuando su hijo nazca poder tener así el piso en mejores condiciones, actualmente es de tierra y esto le provocaría alguna enfermedad respiratoria a su bebe.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 21 years old and when she was young she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She met her partner over six months ago and he works in the city from Monday to Saturday. Since she was nine years old Rosibel has worked in agriculture, raising pigs and selling snacks (tamales, bread, "atol" [a cornflour drink] and other items). Her mother taught her these skills from when she was little.

Now that she is living with her husband, Rosibel makes a living selling bread and tamales. She sells four days a week and it is profitable for her, since in the community where she lives there is a lot of demand for these types of products. Her brother helps her with the work.

Rosibel is asking for the loan to buy corn, chicken and flour so she can have her raw ingredients, in order to start strengthening the business she has in the community. This will help her a lot since she has to buy wholesale, as there isn't daily transport in her community.

Rosibel hopes to put down a brick floor in the house where she lives with her husband, so that the floor will be in a better condition when her child is born. Currently the floor is made of earth and this could cause the baby to have respiratory problems.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken and flour to have the raw ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 7 hijos, 4 esta casados ya no viven con él, dos hijos de las edades de 11 y 4 años estudian primaria en la escuela de la comunidad, y una hija de 13 años que ayuda a su mamá en los oficios de la casa, se dedica a cultivar ejote y zanahoria, de estas actividades obtiene su ingresos, también hace labores de jardinería, Juan necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 3,500.00 para comprar insumos para el cultivo de ejote y zanahoria (semilla, abono orgánico, fertilizante y otros), el sueño de Juan es cambiar el techo de su casa, él comenta que ya no está en buenas condiciones su techo.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old and lives with his family in the town of Sololá in the department of Sololá. He has 7 children. Four of them are married and no longer live with him, two of them aged 11 and 4 go to the community primary school and his 13-year-old daughter helps her mum around the house.

Juan makes a living growing green beans and carrots. He gets his income from this and also works as a gardener.

Juan needs a loan of Q.3,500 to buy supplies for growing his green beans and carrots (seeds, organic manure, fertilizer and other items).

Juan's dream is to replace the roof on his house, as he says it is not in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing green beans and carrots.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 41 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. She is borrowing PHP 30,0000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en:
Nilma is 56 years old and married with three children.

Nilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nilma has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nilma aspires to save enough money in order to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married entrepreneur with five children, who operates a general store to make a living. For the two years she has been running the business, Elizabeth has earned a better income to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain this. She has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. Elizabeth hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell
